loans.name: Glorious

texts.en:
Glorious  lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is aged 34 and widowed with two children aged 3 and 6; one attends school. She started  her clothing shop business in 2008 so as to meet a better standard of living and she gets additional income from selling porridge. Her hopes are educating her children and constructing her own business premises. 

Glorious’s major challenge is competition.She is a very hard-working lady and needs a loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a food cart, ingredients to prepare hamburgers, hot dogs, roast meat, potatoes, juices.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rosalie is 44 years old and has five children who are in school.

Rosalie has a fishing-net making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business.

Rosalie has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business

loans.name: Fátima Ximena

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como El Cady en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito La Cantera, en esta localidad la mayoría de las personas se dedican a la agricultura.
En este lugar vive la señora Fátima, tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera de 4 hijos de 13, 11, 9 y 3 años, el mayor estudia en colegio y los menores en escuela. 
Doña Fátima es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar para sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella en las mañanas vende periódicos y en las tardes vende sabanas, sobrecamas y edredones, su mercadería la deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, esto le permite conseguir más clientes y sus ventas siempre mejoran, ella lleva más de 5 años en este negocio el cual le permite sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar sabanas, edredones y sobrecamas. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe del banco. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the area known as "El Cady" in Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo, the La Cantera Credit Group partner meet fortnightly. In this town, most people are involved with agriculture.

Here, Fatima, 28, lives as a single mother with her four children aged 13, 11, 9 and 3. The eldest studies at high school and the others at primary. Fatima is a very strong woman who likes to work to raise her children. She sells newspapers in the mornings and in the afternoons she sells sheets, bedspreads and quilts. She allows for the goods to be bought on credit and be paid every week, this allows her to get more customers and sales always improve. She has more than 5 years in this business which has allowed her to bring up her children.

She is asking for this loan to buy sheets, quilts and bedspreads. She has been in this Credit Group from the beginning and likes it for the help they receive from the bank. Her dream is to give her children the best she possibly can

loans.use: to buy sheets, quilts and bedspreads.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 62 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Imelda has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Teresita has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from food vending.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mirella Esther

texts.es:
Mirella tiene un puesto tradicional de venta de obleas negocio que ejerció hace 4 años como medida para ayudar a su marido en el sostenimiento de los gastos de la casa y de sus 5 hijos, a sus 41 años de edad siempre lleva una sonrisa que dibuja su rostro y trasmite esa alegría a sus cliente, quiere solicitar un crédito para mejorar su carrito, repararlo ya que se encuentra muy inestable, comprara salsas, queso y obleas para mejorar sus ventas.

El crédito para ella es muy importante pues el carro donde actualmente labora está muy inestable y requiere reparaciones inmediatas y solo quiere seguir trabajando en el negocio que tanta alegría trae a su corazón.
texts.en: Mirella holds a traditional job selling wafers, a business that she began 4 years ago as a way to assist her husband with the payment of the expenses associated with their home and their 5 children. At 41 years old, she always wears a smile on her face and she passes this happiness on to her customers. She is seeking a loan to improve her cart and repair it because it is currently very unstable, and to purchase sauces, cheese and wafers to increase her sales. This loan is very important for Mirella because the cart that she works from is very unstable and needs immediate repairs. She only wishes to continue working on this business which brings a lot of happiness to her heart.

loans.use: to make repairs to her cart that she needs urgently and to purchase wafers, sauces and cheese.

loans.name: Aminata's Group

texts.fr:
Créé depuis juillet 2014,le groupe est composé de membres qui sont unis par la solidarité,et ont comme activité l'agriculture.

Aminata,qui se trouve à l'extrême droite de la photo et levant le bras,est responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 52 ans,mére de 11 enfants et actuellement veuve.

L'agriculture constitue sa principale activité.

Avec son crédit,elle compte acheter des semences:100kg d'arachide pour 25000f,de l'engrais à 10000f.

Son objectif est de pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins et celui de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created in July 2014 and is made up of members of the farming community and who work together.

Aminata is on the far right in the photo with her arm raised and is the leader of the group. She is aged 52 and is a widow with 11 children.

Her principal activity is farming.

With her loan she plans to buy seeds: 100kg of groundnuts for 25,000f, and 10,000f worth of fertilizer.

Her goal is to be able to provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Jane requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, sugar, coffee, etc.

Jane has been in this business for 11 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Jane would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, sugar, coffee, etc

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: Mildred lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is a hardworking single lady aged 26 .She started an agriculture business in 2010 to improve her standard of living and get more income. Her dream is expanding the acreage of her maize plantation. Her challenge is weather changes and she needs a loan to improve her agriculture activities such as weeding, harvesting and preparation of land for next season.

loans.use: to improve her weeding, harvesting and preparation of land for next season.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is 28 years old, married, and has been blessed with three children aged between 3 years and eight months. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For the past four years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables to local customers. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Ester requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for four years now.

Ester would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Tessito Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis juillet 2012.Il est composé de membres qui sont issus du même village et partagent une responsabilité solidaire.Elles ont comme activité le commerce et l'agriculture.

Maimouna debout à l'extrême droite et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 52 ans et mariée.

Son activité est le commerce de poissons séchés et la vente de légumes.

Ainsi avec le prêt,elle compte acheter 25000f de poissons séchés,de la patate pour 10000f et du choux pour 10000f et supporter des frais de transport pour 5000f.

Son objectif est de pouvoir contribuer aux dépenses familiales,tel que la nourriture.
texts.en:
This group was created in July 2012. It is made up of members who come from the same village and share a solidarity pact. Their fields of activity are commerce and agriculture.

Maimouna is standing on the far right with her arm raised. She is the leader of the group and is 52 years old and married.

She sells dried fish and vegetables.

So with her loan she plans to buy 25,000f worth of dried fish, 10.000f of potatoes and 10,000f worth of cabbage and to pay 5,000f for  transport costs.

Her aim is to be able to contribute to family expenses such as food.

loans.use: to buy dried fish, potatoes and cabbage.

loans.name: 1§De Agosto Group

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 28 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo y se dedica a la venta de comida (de izquierda a derecha la cuarta persona, de camiseta rosada).
Ella es una persona amable, luchadora, trabajadora, humilde, sencilla, confiable, amiga de los negocios, leal, impulsadora, responsable, dedicada y también toma la iniciativa para cumplir sus metas y objetivos. Su lugar de residencia es la ciudad de Santa Cruz, una zona caracterizada por el clima cálido y la humedad de su ambiente. Ella formó una banca de personas con el ánimo de solicitar un préstamo para el bien común.
María es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, estatura mediana y viste de forma moderna, su negocio es la venta de comida típica de su región, para la cual utiliza como ingredientes principales; la yuca, el maíz, camote, calabazas, frijoles, carne de res, carne de cerdo y pollo. Cada día al salir el sol, su clientes ya saben la comida del día, pues el día determina la comida, sus comidas son; churrasco, majao, pacumuto, sopa de maní, locro de gallina, arepas, etc. Ella necesita mejorar el mobiliario de su pensión (mini restaurante) para ofrecer una mejor atención al cliente y recibir más visitas, para lograr mejores ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, su sueño es tener un restaurante y piensa que se dirige por el camino correcto.
Es por esos motivos que María solicita un préstamo para la compra de alimentos por mayor para abastecer su mini restaurante (pensión).
texts.en:
Maria is a 28 year old woman who lives with her partner, has a son, and makes a living selling food (from left to right fourth person, pink shirt). She is a kind, determined, hard working, humble, simple, reliable, friend of businesses, loyal, promoter, responsible, dedicated person, and also takes the initiative to meet her goals and objectives. Her place of residence is the city of Santa Cruz, an area characterized by its warm weather and humid environment. She formed a group of people with the intention of requesting a loan for the common good. 

Maria has a dark complexion, long black hair, medium stature, and a modern look. Her business is selling the typical food of her region for which she uses the following main ingredients: yuca, corn, sweet potato, pumpkins, beans, beef, pork, and chicken. Every day at sunrise her customers already know the meal of the day, as the day determines the meal. Her meals are: barbecued steak, majao [Bolivian dish - eggs, rice, and plantains], shish kabob, peanut soup, chicken stew, arepas [corn tortillas], etc. 

She needs to improve her mini restaurant so that she can provide better customer service and receive more visits. She is doing this to have a higher income and improve the quality of life of her family. Her dream is to have a restaurant and she thinks is on the right path. For these reasons Maria is requesting a loan so that she can buy food in bulk to stock her mini restaurant.

loans.use: to buy food in bulk to stock her mini restaurant in order to improve her family's quality of life

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an overlocking sewing machine and a flatbed coverstitch sewing machine.

loans.name: Wilberforce

texts.en: Wilberforce lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is aged 34 and married with three children aged between 3 and 9. He started a hardware shop in 2008 to meet his daily expenses. He gets additional income from a saloon. His dream is business expansion but he is limited by inadequate capital and competition. He needs a loan for buying cement, iron sheets and wire mesh to sell.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron sheets and wire mesh to sell.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional charcoal to sell.

Merlinda has been in this business for 18 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional charcoal to sell

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is 60 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Felicitas is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Felicitas has been in pig fattening for six years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jevilyn

texts.en:
Jevilyn is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Jevilyn has been in this business for less than a year now.

In the future, Jevilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Luis Stiven

texts.es:
Todo el que quiera triunfar y salir adelante en la vida lo único que necesita es tener ganas y motivos para hacerlo, Luis es un hombre que fui nacido y criado en el campo pero sabe que en muchas ocasiones es muy difícil salir adelante, por eso desde joven se vino para la ciudad y aprendió de un tío el negocio de la cerrajería. 

Gracias a los conocimientos y a sus ánimos de ser alguien monto su propio negocio y hoy pide ayuda crediticia para la compra de equipo de soldadura y herramienta de mano como llaves, tornillos, alicates, martillos entre otros para seguir creciendo y demostrando que salir del campo a buscar un futuro fue su mejor idea.

Sueña con tener un negocio muy bien constituido y que le genere rentabilidad para mandar dinero a sus padres que siguen en el campo quizás pasando necesidades.
texts.en: All anyone who wants to succeed and thrive in life needs is the desire and motivation to do it. Luis is a man who was born and raised in the country, but who knows that a lot of the time it is very hard to get ahead there. Because of this he came to the city when he was very young and learned from an uncle the business of locksmithing. Thanks to his knowledge and his desire to make something of himself he started his own business and today he is asking for a loan to purchase welding equipment and hand tools such as keys, screws, pliers and hammers, among others, to continue growing and demonstrating that leaving the countryside to seek a future was his greatest idea. He dreams of having a very established business that generates profits so he can send money to his parents who continue living in the country and to perhaps go there if needed.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for welding and hand tools such as a hammer, keys, etc.

loans.name: Eduardo Enrique

texts.es:
Saludos desde Colombia!

Eduardo es un padre de 47 años con dos hijos de seis y 13 años. Se dedica la producción agropecuaria del cual depende su familia desde 15 años. Sueña con darles una buena educación.

Su ética de trabajo y dedicación lo demuestra todos los días pues no hay día en el cual descansa del campo. Aprendió sobre la producción agropecuaria empíricamente, ósea através de ver otra gente que hacía este trabajo.

El crédito ayudara a Eduardo comprar insumos agropecuarios como abonos y fertilizantes para el sostenimiento y aumento de la producción de su cultivo.

Sin el apoyo de Kiva y Interactuar, sus ingresos tendría menos producción de cultivo que afectaría a la calidad de vida de su familia. Eduardo sueña con darles una buena educación a sus hijos.

¡Apoye la labor de Eduardo para su familia con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Hello from Colombia!

Eduardo is a 47-year-old father who has two children aged six years and 13. He works in agricultural production, something which his family has depended on for 15 years. His dream is to provide them with a good education. He shows his work ethic and dedication every day, as he doesn't rest for a single day from working in the fields. He learnt about agricultural production empirically; that is, by watching how other people did the work.

The loan will help Eduardo to buy agricultural supplies such as manure and fertilisers to maintain and increase his crop production. Without Kiva's help and support, he would have a smaller crop, which would affect his income and his family's quality of life. His dream is to provide his children with a good education.

Please support Eduardo's work for his family through this loan!

loans.use: to buy supplies such as manure and fertilisers for his land.

loans.name: Emine

texts.en:
When Emine’s husband retired, the family began to have financial problems. She needed money for the education of their three children. She looked for a solution to increase their income and provide for her children’s education. Because her husband wouldn’t give her permission to work, she considered jobs she could do from home. She decided to make and sell manti, traditional Turkish ravioli, with a friend. 

They began making manti at home with the friend’s sister as well. When they first started they sold to their friends and neighbors. After a disagreement, Emine decided to separate from her partners and start her own shop. This time she began working on her own. She spent weeks making contacts at large markets to sell her products. When she had problems with capital in 2004, she learned about Maya and took out a loan. She has begun working with her son and his wife to develop the business, which is expanding. She takes out a loan each year and has bought a machine to cut dough, an oven and other appliances to increase productivity. 

Emine now provides jobs for 15 housewives. All three of her children have completed university.This year she will use the loan from Maya to buy flour and onions. “In expanding, working with help from Maya has been a great pleasure for me,” she says. She wants to expand her business even more and open a big manti store and run it like a restaurant. She has also begun working to patent her manti.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Emine Hanım eşi emekli olunca ekonomik sıkıntı içene giriyor.Üç tane Çocuğunu o zamanlar okutmak için paraya ihtiyacı var.Gelirini arttırmak çocuklarını okutmak için çareler arar.Eşi çalışmasına izin vermediğinden ,evinde yapabileceği işleri düşünür.Ve bir arkadaşı ile mantı yapıp satmaya karar verirler.Arkadaşının ablasını da yanlarına alarak evde mantı yapmaya başlarlar.İlk başlangıç da komşulara çevrelerine satarlar.Emine hanım ortakları ile anlaşamayınca onlardan ayrılır ve kendine bir dükkan tutar.Bu sefer tek başına mücadele etmeye başlar.Büyük marketlere gider orada haftalarca tanıtımlara yaparak satış yapmaya başlar.2004 yılında nakite sıkışınca Maya ile tanışır ve kredi çeker.İşlerini ilerletir oğlu ve gelinini de yanına alarak çalışmaya devam eder.Giderek işleri büyür.Her sene kredi almaya devam eder, dükkanına hamur kesme makinası,fırın vs.alarak işlerini daha da büyütür.Emine hanım bugün on beş ev kadınına iş imkanı sağlamaktadır.Çocuklarının üçünü de okuttu üniversiteden mezun etti.Bu yılda bizden aldığı kredi ile un ve soğan alacak.”Ben büyürken elimden tutan Maya ille çalışmak benim için büyük bir zevk.”diyor.Ve elinden geldiğince işlerini büyütmek,büyük bir mantıcı dükkanı açmak burayı lokanta gibi işletmek istiyor.Annemin mantısına patent almak için çalışmalara başladı.

loans.use: to buy flour and onions

loans.name: Mario Andres

texts.es:
Hola! Mario Andrés es viudo y trabaja para proveerles a sus dos hijos de 11 y 7 años.

Recientemente pasó por un tiempo muy difícil. Perdió a su señora esposa que paralizó toda su actividad de cultivo que resulto en la pérdida total de su cultivo. 
Mario Andrés quiere reactivar su actividad agrícola y busca apoyo para poder seguir adelante.

Usará el crédito para comprar insumos como semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para preparar su tierra para el cultivo.

Gracias al apoyo de su suegro, aprendió sobre la cultivación. El y su familia dependen de las ganancias de su producción agropecuaria desde hace diez años. 

Busca volver a la cultivación pues dice que, “seré feliz porque eso me gusta mucho.”  Su sueño es poder pagar para la educación de sus hijos y algún día tener una finca.

¡Impacte la necesidad actual y futuro de Mario y sus hijos con un crédito!
texts.en: Hello! Mario Andrés is a widower and he works to provide for his two children who are 11 and 7 years old. He recently passed through a very difficult time. He lost his wife which paralyzed all of his harvesting activity which resulted in the total loss of his crop. Mario Andrés wants to reactivate his agricultural activity and seeks support to be able to get ahead. He will use the loan to purchase inputs such as seeds, fertilizers and compost to prepare his soil for the crop. Thanks to the support of his father-in-law he learned about growing crops. He and his family have depended on the earnings from his agricultural production for 10 years. He seeks to return to farming because he said "I will be happy because I like it a lot." His dream is to be able to pay for the education of his children and to one day have his own farm. You will impact the daily needs and the future of Mario and his children with this loan!

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 42 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. Analiza works very hard to provide for them.

Analiza's business and family home was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Analiza has restarted her food vending business and now needs to provide her family with a safe shelter.

Analiza has taken a PHP 6,214 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labour.

Analiza is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labour.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman aged 61 years; she has four kids, all of whom completed school. She lives at a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwaka operates a goat meat-selling business; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbours. She faces a challenge of competition and seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase goats for resale. She dreams of expanding and establishing a butchery in the future.

loans.use: to purchase goats for resale

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Vicenta works hard to support her family.

Vicenta has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock. Vicenta is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business such as spices, meat, vegetables, etc.

Vicenta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as spices, meat, vegetables, etc

loans.name: Gracee

texts.en: Gracee lives in Hoima, Uganda. Aged 52, Gracee is widowed with six children of whom two attend school. She started a produce business to meet her daily needs. Gracee earns more money from a retail shop. She hopes to expand the produce business. Her biggest challenge is limited capital, therefore she needs a loan to buy more maize, sugar, onions and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize, sugar, onions and soap to sell.

loans.name: Al- Sedk Wal- Amana Group

texts.en:
Al- Sedk Wal-Amana is a group comprised of four women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They have applied for a loan of 140,000 YER from AMB.

Nabela is the leader of the group, a 41-year-old married woman living with her children in their own house in the capital city of Sana'a. She is a very active and dynamic woman who works as a housewife, while her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family. 

Most people purchase many kinds of foods for their houses during the holy month of Ramadhan, to be consumed during the fasting breaks. The people fast during the day, and they need delicious and good food for their break in the evening. For this reason, Nabela will use her portion of the loan 40,000 YER from AMB to purchase the appropriate foods. 

Nabela looks forward to building the second floor of her house and renting the first floor in order to improve the living conditions of the family. She hopes to open a saving account with AMB.

loans.use: to purchase food materials for all the needs of the house through Ramadan month.

loans.name: Kafoulaha  A Group

texts.fr:
Les 4 membres du groupe  KAFOULAHA A sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 54 ans et ont en moyenne 9 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des familles traditionnelles à IFOLA un village dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils  collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur septième prêt de production de maïs avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de maïs  avec monsieur NGOROU débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme  KAFOULAHA A. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter  8 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 10 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  160 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part de contribuer  les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The four members of the Kafoulaha A group are married men who are on average 54 years old with nine children. Most of them live in traditional families in Ifola, a village in the Sikasso circle in the third administrative region of Mali.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in order to manage their farming activities in the winter.
This is their seventh production loan for corn, the previous loans were correctly repaid.
Mr. Ngorou grows corn. He is standing second from the left  in this photo of the men from Kafoulaha A group. 
With his loan he plans to buy eight sacks of 50 kg of fertilizer, 10 cans of different quality weed-killer, and to pay labour costs for looking after one hectare.
After the harvest he sells his production in the village, in Sikasso to a mixed clientele for cash and for credit.
He hopes to make an average profit of 160,000FCFA per field.
This profit will enable him to repay part of his loan, and to contribute to the daily expenses for his family.

loans.use: To buy fertiliser and pay for labour costs.

loans.name: Derlis

texts.es:
Derlis es madre de seis hijos entre los 15 y 22 años. Aparte a su familia, se dedica a la cultivación agricultura desde hace 15 años. Ella aprendio este negocio empíricamente, es decir atraves de observación de otras personas.

Ella y su familia viven una zona rural de Colombia en la cual no es fácil tener acceso a servicios financieros como los que aporta Interactuar.

Su crédito lo va usar para comprar insumos agropecuarios como semillas, productos para el control de plagas, y abonos para poder preparar sus cultivos.

Gracias a este crédito, la economía de su familia y la calidad de vida mejoraría pues pudiera aumentar sus ingresos.

Derlis sueña terminar con la legalización de los papeles de su tierra. 

¡Impacte la vida de Derlis y su familia con un crédito!
texts.en:
Derlis is the mother of six children between the ages of 15 and 22. In addition to caring for her family, she has been a farmer for 15 years. She learned this business empirically, that is, through observing other people.   

She and her family live in a rural area of Colombia where it isn't easy to access financial services like the ones offered by Interactuar. She is going to buy agricultural materials such as seeds, pest control products, and fertilizer to prepare her crops. 

Thanks to this loan, her family's budget and quality of life will get better because she can improve her income. 

Derlis dreams of finishing making the papers for her land official.   

Impact Derlis' and her family's life with a loan.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials such as fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre emprendedor, tiene 38 años de edad, es soltero y vive en San Vicente junto a su familia. Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Desde muy joven ha trabajado para poder apoyar a su familia con los gastos del hogar ya que eran de escasos recursos económicos. Lamentablemente no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional al no tener muchos ingresos pero eso no fue un impedimento para que saliera adelante. Desde hace varios años trabaja como Operario de Construcción y le va muy bien porque es muy responsable, trabajador y siempre se preocupa por realizar excelentes trabajos.
Juan está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar materiales de construcción para poder seguir brindando sus servicios y de esta manera pueda tener mayores ingresos. Gracias a esto podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y así seguirá esforzándose para más adelante poder estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Civil.
texts.en:
Juan is an enterprising man, He is 38 years old, single, and lives in San Vicente with his family. He is a person who really wants to get ahead. Since he was very young, he has worked to be able to help his family with the household expenses, because they were of very low income. Unfortunately, he wasn't able to go to college because he didn't have enough income, but this didn't stop him from getting ahead. For several years, he has worked as a construction worker and it is going well for him because he is very responsible, hardworking and dedicated to doing excellent work.  

Juan is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the support they have given him, he will be able to buy construction materials to be able to keep offering his services and thus have better income. Thanks to this, he will be able to improve his and his family's quality of life and thus keep striving to get ahead and be able to study Civil Engineering.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Ayat

texts.en:
Ayat is a 36-year-old married woman from a village near Jenin. She is a mother of three sons and one daughter. Her husband is a farmer; he gets a low and unstable income. Ayat finished her high school studies, but she could not go to the university immediately because of the bad economic conditions. Ayat would like now to take the BA degree and find a job to improve the family's living conditions. 

Ayat took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the first university installment. By taking this loan, Ayat will be able to complete her study in Islamic studies and find a job in the future. 

Ayat appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the first university installment

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, who is 48 years old, wants a loan to buy more sugar, biscuits and soap to sell. He lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is married and charged with the responsibility of taking care of twelve children, six of whom attend school. He got capital from farming and started a retail shop.

He desires to build a residential house.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, biscuits and soap to sell

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 72 years old and is married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. Dolores has been in this business for 15 years. 

In the future, Dolores would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is age 41 and married with six children, all of whom attend school. He owns an electronics shop and makes extra income from electricity wiring and connecting. He plans to buy a personal car. He will use this loan to buy more electronic equipment to sell.

loans.use: to buy more electronic equipment to sell.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka appreciates the previous loan that helped her expand her business.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Chari

texts.en:
Chari is a 23-year-old married woman with two children, all attend school. She lives at a house without electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Chari operates a fruit and vegetable market stall and sells to town people and neighbors. She faces a challenge of competition and changing seasons in her business. 

She will use 10,000 KES to purchase fruit, oranges, bananas and green vegetables to resell. She dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fruit, oranges, bananas and green vegetables.

loans.name: Cemile

texts.en:
Cemile, who is divorced and disabled, has three children. Because she rents, she has to work as well as look after her children. She prepares a regional lentil ravioli dish at home. She makes beet molasses during the October harvest season to meet the household’s expenses. With the loan from Maya, she will buy lentils, flour, eggs and oil to make the lentil ravioli and provide for her family. She wants to ensure a good future for her children.
Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Cemile Hanım,eşinden ayrı biri özürlü üç çocuk annesi.  Kirada oturuyor çalısarak çocuklarına bakmak  zorunda .  Evinde yöreye ait  mercimekli mantı yapıyor.  Sezonlukda Ekim ayında hasatı yapılan pancardan pekmez yapıyor, satarak evin geçimini sağlıyor. Maya’dan aldığı kredi ile mercimek un yumurta ve yağ alarak üretim yaparak evinin geçimini sağlayacak .  Çocuklarına iyi bir gelecek hazırlamak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy lentils, flour, eggs and oil.

loans.name: Fahriye

texts.en:
Fahriye is divorced and is living with her two sons. After 18 years of being happily married, she separated from her husband because of a disagreement. She hadn’t worked for 18 years and was petrified, not knowing what to do. She had to do something to earn money and move on with her life. She didn’t have a profession, so she began selling skin products. To learn about the products, she began working with a hairdresser. She observed closely and with great determination to learn this profession. She practiced cutting and dying on her sisters and friends to gain experience. She would make new tones by mixing dyes. After completing some more training, she gathered her courage and opened a hair salon. She hoped to work for a year and succeeded. She has now been doing this work for seven years. “I had never even touched scissors or a blowdryer before but I overcame all difficulties with willpower, work and affection". 

She will use the loan to buy hairdressing supplies. She wants to increase her variety before the holiday. She wants to be more successful in her business, move forward, develop herself and expand. She wants her children to reach a good situation. She says she wants to be a “purple cow,” that is, make everyone she touches happy.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Fahriye hanım eşinden boşanmış iki oğlu ile hayatına devam ediyor.Onsekiz senelik mutlu bir evliliğinden sonra eşi ile aralarında çıkan bir anlaşmazlıkdan dolayı eşinden ayrılır.Onsekiz sene boyunca hiç çalışmamış ,ne yapacağını bilmeden öylece kalakalır.Bir şeyler yapması para kazanması gerekiyor hayatını devam ettirebilmek için .Hiç bir mesleği olmadığından da cilt ürünleri satmaya başlıyor.Ürünlerinin tanıtımını yapmak için bir kuaförün yanına giriyor.O kadar azimli ve dikkatli ki bu işi bakarak öğrenmeye çalışıyor.Evde ablalarına ,arkadaşlarına saç kesimi ve boyama yaparak acemiliğini atlatıyor.Sürekli boyaları karıştırarak çeşitli renk tonları buluyor.Biraz daha çıraklık yaptıktan sonra cesaretini toparlayıp bir kuaför dükkanı açıyor.Bir yıl işleri olsun diye bekliyor ve başarıyor.Yedi yıldır kendini geliştirerek mesleğini yapmaya çalışıyor.”elime makas fön makinası almamışken azim ,çalışama ve sevgiyle tüm zorlukları yendim”diyerek kendini ifade ediyor.Aldığı kredi ile kuaför malzemeleri alacak.Bayram üzeri çeşini arttıracak.İşinde  daha da başarılı olmak,ilerlemek,kendini geliştirerek büyümek istiyor.Çocuklarının iyi bir yere gelmesini çok istiyor.Gene kendi deyimi ile bu dünyada mor inek olmak istiyor(herkesin hayatına dokunup mutluluk vermek)

loans.use: to buy hairdressing supplies

loans.name: Faiz Al- Daba Group

texts.en:
This group is called Faiz Al- Daba. It consists of four women. They all live in traditional and simple families in Sana'a, Yemen. They know one another through friendship and neighborhood connections. They applied for a loan of 140,000 YER from AMB.

Ne'ema is a 48-year-old married woman living with her spouse in their own house. She is the leader of the group. She works as a housewife and her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family. The family lives in their own house which is very old and small. In addition, it is not renovated from the inside. As a result, Ne'ema is requesting a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase construction materials such as cement and bricks to renovate the house from the inside and to expand to the house.

Ne'ema's dream in the future is purchasing a large piece of land and building a new house on that land.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement and bricks to renovate the house from the inside and to expand the house.

loans.name: Enfamil

texts.en:
Enfamil's greatest wish in life is to have her two children finish their education and have a decent job someday. Enfamil and her husband are persevering in doing things the best way, so that they will give a better future to their children. 

Aside from farming, Enfamil also engages herself in the caring of hogs for an additional source of income. She wanted to keep on running her hog raising business, and further provide financial assistance for their children in pursuing their education. 

Hence, Enfamil is requesting a loan of P17,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs. She believes that having the loan, she will manage well the business and it will serve as her support in reaching her wish.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more beauty products and tools for use in her salon.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 47 years old and a widowed mother with three children. 

Fatima and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Fatima is taking out a housing loan amounting to $175 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Fatima has been a NWTF borrower since 2011. She plans to recover through her business raising livestock.

With your help, Fatima can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Mukole Central Group

texts.en: Agnes is a married woman with three children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She has a retail shop that sells a variety of commodities like soap, sugar, salt, and beer in a rural area. She also operates a restaurant where she obtains additional income. She is a member of Mukole Central village group where members save and guarantee one another to get a loan. Limited capital to buy more products hinders her from obtaining trade discounts with companies. Agnes' vision is to be economically well-off with proceeds from her business. Agnes needs the loan to buy beer, soap, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer, soap, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is 62 years old and married.  

Angela has bought and sold livestock for 3 years. Angela requested 11,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional livestock.

She has previously borrowed 4 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Angela would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase  livestock.

loans.name: Nazan

texts.en:
Nazan is married and the mother of three children. Her husband has been in prison for seven years. After her husband was sent to prison she had to find a way to support her children. 

Her first job was working with someone making manti, traditional Turkish ravioli. She earned enough to provide for her children. When her children grew older and started attending school, they had more needs, and her salary wasn’t enough. 

To earn more money and provide for her children, she began selling Amway products. She does both jobs. She will use the loan to buy additional Amway products and increase her sales. 

Her wish is for her husband's freedom and to raise her children to have a good future.

loans.use: to buy Amway products.

loans.name: Agalar

texts.en:
Agalar is 31 years old and married, but he has no children.  Agalar works as a drinking water distributor, and his income from the business is helping with his family's everyday needs and expenditures. He has been working in this field for 11 years and his monthly income is 200 AZN.

Azerbaijan is developing quickly and every year experiences many changes. One of the most important needs in this region is access to safe water. Young people take a part in water projects in order to build water channels and make life in the region better. 

Agalar ’s income isn’t enough to cover his family’s demands, and his team has to improve its project in order to increase income. He is applying for a $1550 (1200 AZN) loan in order to buy good coveralls and quality tools for work.

loans.use: to buy good coveralls and quality tools for work.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru:
Фируза молодая целеустремленная жительница района Хуросон в возрасте 23 лет. Она замужем за Насимджона, который является торговцем и у них годовалая дочь. 
Фируза до сего времени была домохозяйкой. Сейчас она начинает новый бизнес, чтобы открыть свой источник дохода. Она тоже хочет самостоятельно зарабатывать на жизнь и быть независимой женщиной. Фируза уже составила свой мини бизнес-план. Она приобрела помещение и оформила его в стиле магазина. Фируза планирует заниматься продажей детской и женской обуви, и считает его прибыльным бизнесом. Однако чтобы привезти товар Фирузе не хватает 2000 долларов США. Эту сумму она просит в кредит. Она очень надеется на финансовую помощь. Ведь именно благодаря вашей поддержке она сможет реализовать свою цель.
texts.en:
Firuza is a young and purposeful resident of the Khuroson region. She is 23 years old. She is married to Nasimdjon, who is a sales man, and they have a one year old daughter. Firuza has been a housewife until now. Currently she is starting a new business, in order to get a source of income. She would like to earn money for living herself and be an independent woman.

Firuza has already put together a small business plan. She has acquired premises and set it up as a store. Firuza plans to sell children's and women's shoes, as she considers it a profitable business. However, Firuza is missing 2,000 US dollar in order to bring in goods. She requests a loan in this amount. She hopes very much for financial help. Indeed, she can only realize her goal with your support.

loans.use: to purchase children's and women's shoes to open a store

loans.name: Nyantwire Farmers' Gp Group

texts.en:
Mary is a member of Nyantwire farmers' group and each member guarantees each other to access a loan.

She lives in Fort Portal Uganda and earns an income through farming and operating a  retail business. She started these businesses with a hope of raising enough income for her family. She faces the challenges of changing weather and limited capital. However, Mary dreams of becoming a model farmer. 

Mary applied for a loan to purchase mulch and pay workers.

loans.use: to purchase mulch and pay workers.

loans.name: Annamae

texts.en:
Annamae is a 28-year-old married woman with two children.

Annamae has raised pigs for 4 years.   Annamae requested 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has previously borrowed 3 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Annamae would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy land to increase the acreage of her plantations.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is a 28-year-old married man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He deals in retail and farming, the businesses he started with a vision of employing himself. He faces hardships of competition, besides that, he hopes of having a good residential house. 

Ronald needs a loan to buy iron sheets, windows and doors for construction.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets, windows and doors for construction.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer expresses appreciation for her previous Kiva loan.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge; the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes. 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a 28-year-old married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He deals in the sale of spare parts and has a small retail shop. He started these businesses with the hope of earning a living for his family. He faces the challenge of low capital. However, he hopes of expanding his stock to new areas. Christopher needs a loan to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married mother of two children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and transportation.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge; the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes. 50,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is an experienced farmer from Khoronq village in the Armavir region. She lives there with her husband, who supports his wife with farming. 

Gayane owns a greenhouse where she cultivates tomato, cucumber, and eggplant. Land cultivation is the main source of family's income, so Gayane works hard to take care of her greenhouse and gather enough income for living. 

The requested loan of 1500 USD is much needed for Gayane to be able to purchase a polyethylene cover and wires for the greenhouse. Gayane will be very grateful to lenders for their support.

loans.use: to pay for a polyethylene cover and wires for the greenhouse.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies for the preservation of her family's traditional business.

loans.name: Melek

texts.en:
Melek is 38. She is raising her child on her own, and wants to provide her with a good future. Melek has sold Tupperware, Foraivia, and Ersag products for four years to support her family and contribute to the national economy. When she first started doing this work, she didn't have any capital, so she made sales by placing orders from a catalog. Later she used a loan from Maya as capital to buy products wholesale. Her customers increased, and they bought more products when they could actually see them. 

Melek will use her second loan from Maya as capital to buy more products and increase her potential customers. She has an affectionate, warm and hardworking disposition. She wants to accumulate savings for her child, and for her to learn a profession. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Melek Hanım, 38 yaşında çocuğunu tek başına büyütmeye çalışan ve ona iyi bir gelecek sağlamak isteyen bir anne.Melek hanım 4 yıldır tupperware,foraivia ve ersağ markalı ürünleri satarak aile ve ülke ekonomisine katkı saplıyor.Bu işe başladığında sermayesi olmadığı için kataloglardan sipariş ile satış yapmış.Daha sonra Maya’dan aldığı krediyi kendisine sermaye yaparak ürünleri toptan almış.Böylece müşterileri ürünleri görüp alınca daha çok almaya ve müşterileri artmaya başlamış.Melek  hanım Maya’dan 2. kredisini kullanarak daha çok ürün siparişi vererek sermayesini ve müşteri potansiyelini artırdı.Melek hanım sevecen,sıcak kanlı ve çalışkan bir yapıya sahip.Çocuğu için birikim yaparak onu iyi bir meslek sahibi yapmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy more products

loans.name: Sulait

texts.en:
Sulait is a permanent resident of a village in the Isingiro District, age 36. He is married with four children and two dependants from his brother, who is sickly. All his children and the dependants are in school. 

From childhood he has been a farmer. He has been dealing with banana (matooke) sales until 2014, when he learned about the existence of Ugafode microfinance. He has been trying to finish his house, but had challenges of finances, and has since approached Ugafode to help to fund him so that he can complete his family house. 

Pictured is Sulait with the wife at their house.

loans.use: To buy cement, lime and paint

loans.name: Tamoil Al- Wadi Group

texts.en:
Tamoil Al- Wadi is a group which is comprised of four women members who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 120,000 YER from AMB.
Huda is the leader of the group. She is a 30-year-old single woman, living with her parents in their own house in the capital city of Sana'a. She is the leader of the group. Huda is a very active and dynamic woman and works as a housewife and her father is the sole breadwinner of the family. His income is unfixed. Due to her father's unfixed income, the family deals with financial crisis most days. As a result, Huda applied for a 40,000 YER portion of the group loan in order to purchase food materials for the house as flour, sugar, meats, and other food materials to face all the demands of family's food inside of the house in order to prepare delicious meals for her family.
Huda looks forward to preparing food for the family with all of the food materials inside the house.

loans.use: to purchase food materials for the house to prepare delicious meals for her family.

loans.name: Arny

texts.en:
Arny is a 39-year-old married woman with children to support. 

She operates a small store to sell biscuits, eggs, bread, and canned goods. She earns  3,000 PHP monthly. She wanted to increase her income but had insufficient funds to buy more merchandise to sell. 

She asks for 5,000 PHP to buy cooking oil, canned goods and soft drinks to sell. This will  increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, canned goods and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.ru:
Марина замужем. У нее есть сын. Марина  имеет свой бизнес.

Марина продает постельные принадлежности на центральном рынке города. У нее несколько торговых точек с реализаторами. Марина ответственная и трудолюбивая. Она хочет развивать свой бизнес в будущем.

Марина просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 20 000  гривен на увеличение ассортимента товара. Кредит поможет увеличить доход семьи.
texts.en:
Marina is married and has one son. She has her own business. Marina sells bedding at a central market in the city. She has several stores with retailers. 

Marina is responsible and hardworking. She would like to expand her business in the future. Marina requests a loan in the amount of 20,000 hryvnia to increase her assortment of goods. The loan will help increase the income of her family.

loans.use: to increase her assortment of bed linen

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en: Apolonia is 43 years old, married and has nine children; three of whom are still studying, the rest have already settled into marriage. She is selling vegetables as source of income. She patiently sells them around their village. She hopes to increase her sales so she is now asking for the additional capital of 4,000 PHP to buy bananas, tomatoes and eggplants to sell. This loan will help her achieve good profits for her family.

loans.use: to buy bananas, tomatoes and eggplants to sell.

loans.name: Edith Madeleine

texts.es:
Edith es una joven trabajadora, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera, y vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Lamentablemente no sus padres no cuentan con recursos para apoyarla con su educación superior por lo que no puede estudiar una carrera universitaria. Sin embargo ella entiende la situación y colabora con los gastos del hogar trabajando como Jornalera desde hace más de 2 años en un Fundo agrícola. Le va muy bien porque es muy responsable, trabajadora, honesta y sus padres le han inculcado muchos valores que hacen la diferencia con otras personas.
Edith piensa utilizar el préstamo para comprar mercadería e iniciar su propio negocio. De esta manera busca tener mayores ingresos y seguir apoyando a su familia. Gracias a ello mejorará su calidad de vida y seguirá esforzándose para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Edith is a hardworking young woman, just 21 years old, single, and lives with her family in Ica. Edith has a strong ambition to improve her life. Her parents, unfortunately, lacked the funds to pay for her to attend college, so she couldn't study for a university degree. Edith, however, understands her family's situation and has worked at a farming cooperative for over two years so that she can help pay the household's expenses. Edith has done very well at the cooperative as she's a very honest, hardworking, and trustworthy - values that her parents instilled in her and that make her stand out from many other people.  

Edith plans to use this loan to purchase merchandise and start her own store. She hopes that running her own business will generate higher income so that she can continue to help support her family. A successful business will improve Edith's quality of life and allow her to continue her career as a businesswoman in a stronger position.

loans.use: to purchase goods to start her business.

loans.name: Ovilla

texts.en:
Ovilla has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for fifteen years and she earns well from this. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her five children. She had to work hard, with the determination to have a better income and to provide their children with a better education. 

To improve sales, Ovilla would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 15,000, she could purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Ovilla hopes that her business will grow bigger. She still dreams for her children to finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for years and she earns well from this. She also owns and manages a tricycle unit as their additional source of income. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her four children. She had to work hard, with the determination of having better income, to provide their children with better education. 

To improve sales, Ma. Luisa would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With 40,000 PHP she can purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. She will also use a portion of the loan for the maintenance of her tricycle. She sincerely sends you her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Ma. Luisa hopes to buy additional tricycle unit and expand her business. She dreams of better and well-off living for her family. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her life and business and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan owns and operates a variety store business to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for eight years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income by working as a teacher in their community day care center.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to increase her product inventory. She is requesting an amount of PHP 15,000 to buy more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

Susan only hopes to be healthy and strong every day. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is 59 years old and married with seven children. 

Diosdada has bought and sold livestock for 5 years. Diosdada requested 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy chickens and pigs to sell.

She has previously borrowed 8 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

Diosdada would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 32-year-old married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He sells maize and beans and grows crops like maize and bananas. He started these businesses with the hope of earning a living; however, he faces the challenge of unstable market prices. He hopes to build a self-supporting business. Richard needs a loan to buy maize flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth a 31-year-old woman with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in a textiles business for three years, and makes juice, where she gets additional income. She began the business to earn a living. 

Elizabeth likes her business, and dreams of expanding it into a wholesale business however, she is faced with a challenge of limited capital. 

Elizabeth wants money to buy bitenge, dresses, shirts and other textiles to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ilyas

texts.en:
Ilyas 24 years old, married and he has one daughter. Ilyas is a farmer and the income from his business is helping with their everyday needs and expenditures. He raises seasonal fruits and vegetables, such as corn, cucumbers, tomatoes, apples, pears, peaches, plums, and cherries. But, he has a problem with water because he consistently has to borrow water from his neighbor in order to water his land. 

Ilyas needs your financial support. For this reason, he is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000 AZN. With this money, he plans to buy tools to build sluiceway. He is thankful to Kiva and the Aqroinvest organization for a loan

loans.use: to buy tools to build a sluiceway.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
This is Glenda. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to pay for spare parts, accessories, and the maintenance of her tricycle. Her earnings were a big help in her family's personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and to maintain her tricycle unit. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Glenda hopes that her business will continue to flourish and that she will be able to buy another tricycle unit. She meets up with her co-fellowship members weekly to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay for micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and maintain her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used home appliances to resell in their store.

loans.name: Dodie

texts.en:
Dodie is 34 years old and has three children. Dodie is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Dodie is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. Dodie requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Dodie has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Dodie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 38 year old hardworking man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda and has been a farmer since 2004.

He hopes to sustain his family with his income.  David faces challenges of weather changes and diseases that attack his cattle.  

David has hopes of having a well established farm.  He needs a loan to buy two improved breeds 0f cattle for milk production.

loans.use: to buy two improved breeds of cattle for milk production

loans.name: Hyacenthe

texts.en: Hyacenthe 21 years old, she is married with one child who is too young to go to school. Her husband is a motorcyclist. She has been selling foodstuffs for one year. With the loan, she would like to become a big supplier of foodstuffs such as beans, maize and sorghum. The profits from the business will be used to improve their welfare of the family.

loans.use: to buy more beans, maize and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Anderson

texts.en:
Anderson is full of energy, ambitious, and a go getter. He is 50 years old and lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya.  It is a popular banana growing region and the bananas are used for  “matoke ”, which is a staple food prepared from bananas. 

Anderson is a family man blessed with e wife and 5 adorable children, they always place a smile on his face. 

Anderson has farmed for 15 years and has gathered so much experienced that he  is known as the best farmer in his village. Although he practices mixed farming, he really loves dairy farming and has even nicknamed one of his cows “Nyangera” (the name of a person).

Anderson come from a humble background and he had to work his way up. He is determined to succeed and puts in twice the effort into his business. Although he earns a decent income, his biggest challenge is not having a dairy building to milk his cows and  rest his cows. Poor weather conditions affect the health of his cows and he has to spend money buying medicine.

The loan will help Anderson to comfortably milk his cows and save money to buy medicine. Anderson will be able to collect cow dung and urine and will use it in his farm to increase productivity. 

Anderson is a very enterprising man who wants to provide a safe and secure future for his family and a solid education.  This is a privilege he never had.
Through increased profits from selling milk, Anderson will improve his life and realize his dreams.

loans.use: to build a dairy building.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a 25-year-old  single woman (with one child)  who lives in Kasese Uganda. 

She has operated a drug store since 2011. She began the business to have a source of income to meet her family's day to day needs. Annet is a hard working woman with a dream of expanding her business. However, she is faced with a challenge of competition and limited capital. Annet wants money to buy drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and transportation.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes. 40,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a 23-year-old is a married woman . She owns a house without electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a retail shop business to sell wheat flour, rice, and cooking oil.  Changing seasons are her major challenge in the business. 

Umazi requests for 50,000 KES  to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to  purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Aghavnik

texts.en:
Aghavnik is from the town of Vedi, where she lives with her husband. The couple has been engaged in agriculture for more than ten years. Their two daughters are married and live separately with their families. Aghavnik cultivates tomatoes and peppers and sells the gathered harvest in the local markets. Aghavnik's husband is a seasonal worker in a neighboring country and he goes abroad for a work two times a year. 
The requested loan of 1,300 USD is very important for Aghavnik to be able to purchase fertilizer and hire workers for land cultivation. The loan will greatly help this family to organize cultivation work and they hope for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and hire workers for land cultivation.

loans.name: Bozi

texts.en: Bozi has been selling spare parts for cars and motorbikes for the past eight years. He is 37 years old and married to a retailer. The couple has four children, ranging in age from five to thirteen years old, three of whom are already in school. Bozi has a shop in a market near Lomé, the capital of Togo, where he conducts his business. He is seeking a second loan from WAGES in order to increase his stock. Bozi used the profits from his previous loan to reinvest in his business. He hopes through this loan to continue growing his business and to further ensure his family’s future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Jovia

texts.en: Jovia is a 30-year-old married woman with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. Jovia deals in fresh foods, such as tomatoes. She has been in  business since 2011. Jovia earns additional income from farming. She needs money to buy more baskets to be used in the packing of tomatoes for sale. Jovia is hardworking and dreams of expanding her business, however weather changes, competition and lack of enough capital are major challenges. She needs money to buy more baskets to be used in the packing of tomatoes for sale.

loans.use: to buy more baskets to be used in the packing of tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a permanent resident of a village in the Isingiro District .  He is a 42-year-old married man with 5 children and 2 dependents.
All his children and dependents are in school. 

He struggles to pay university tuition for his children because his  salary is low and the cost of living is high. He needs money to pay the tuition for his two children so that they can continue their education. He will manage to pay small installments using his salary. He thanks Kiva lenders through UGAFODE for the financial support.  WIthout it, things would have been different for his children. 

He is resilient and hard working.

loans.use: to pay university tuition for his two children.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is a resident of a village in the Isingiro District.  He is a 34-year-old married man with 3 children and 2 dependents. His children and dependents attend school. 

He has been a farmer since childhood and grows vegetables. In 2010, he learned about  Ugafode micro-finance and borrowed 1,000,000 UGX to improve his plantation. He prospered and managed to build a semi-permanent house to accommodate his family.  

He requests 3,000,000 UGX to fertilize his plantation. He is hopeful this will increase his yield.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Aris

texts.en:
Aris is 32 years old, married and has two kids. He is raising seasonal fruits and vegetables, such as corn, cucumbers, tomatoes, apples, pears, peaches, plums, and cherries. But, he has a problem with water because he consistently has to borrow water from his neighbor in order to water his land. 

For this reason, he needs your financial support. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,200 AZN. With this money, he plans to buy tools to build a sluiceway. He is thankful to Kiva and the Aqroinvest organization for a loan.

loans.use: to buy tools to build a sluiceway.

loans.name: Carolin

texts.en: Carolin is 25 years old and married with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. Carolin deals in the production of tomatoes. She has been in that business since 2013. She began the business to have a source of income to meet her family's needs. Carolin is hardworking with a dream of expanding her business, however competition is a challenge. She needs a loan to buy more tomatoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy papers, a new printer, ink cartridges, and some items for his office.

loans.name: Janerose

texts.en:
Janerose is a 56-year-old widow with 8 children and lives in Fort Portal Uganda. 

She has grown bananas and maize since 2004. She started the business to earn a living. Limited capital hinders her business. 

Janerose needs a loan to plaster her house.

She hopes to have a healthier family.

loans.use: to plaster her house.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Wonderful Lenders! The above picture presents to you a 40-year-old woman who is very hardworking and very passionate about farming, a mother of four lovely children. She hails from the Nyamira area of Kenya, a region known for growing bananas. Esther was raised in challenging circumstances and her basic needs were never covered, so she vowed she would turn her life around and live a comfortable life. That is why she started mixed farming, and she has been farming for the past 14 years. Through dedication, hard work and commitment, she has been able to provide for the basic needs of her family. Although she makes some profit, she has the challenge of inadequate water for irrigating her crops and even for her home consumption. 
Most of the rain water is wasted, and Esther wants to harvest that water. That is why she is kindly requesting a loan to buy a water tank. The Nyamira area has no piped water, and this means that you have to travel for long distances in such of “this precious commodity.” But, with the loan, she will be able to store water for home consumption. The loan will also help Esther irrigate her farm.  She plans to use the sprinkle irrigation method, so that there will be a high production level on her farm. Esther always says “Water is a very precious commodity and should not go to waste”. Having access to funds is very challenging for African women, but with partners such as Kiva and Juhudi Kilimo, Esther is sure that her dreams will become a reality and she will be able to improve her living conditions. The profits from increased production of crops will be used to repay the loan and also to improving her living conditions. She also plans to buy more water tanks so that she can harvest as much water as possible. Esther awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to harvest rain water for home use and to irrigate her crops.

loans.name: Bonifance

texts.en:
Bonefance is a resident of rural Mbarara District.  He is a 40-year-old married man with 6 children and 2 dependents. His children and dependents attend school.

Bonifance is a seasonal farmer and grows  bananas, beans and corn. He wants to buy mulch to improve his yield. He is grateful for the work done by Kiva lenders and UGAFODE.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, soap, cooking oil and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah appreciates the previous loan that helped her expand her business.

For the past six years, she has operated a cosmetic shop business, selling retail to her neighbors and passerby. In addition, she operates a food stall, selling from home, which earns her another source of livelihood. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in her business. Serah dreams of establishing a retail shop business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes. 20,000, she wants to purchase stock of cosmetics and foodstuff for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans that will boost her business.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics such as shampoo, hair weaves, creams, and other beauty items.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en: Svetlana lives in the town of Goris. She is a farmer who keeps livestock and cultivates land. Svetlana's husband works in the private sector, but his salary is so low that it would be very difficult for their family to survive without agricultural income. The requested loan of USD 1,700 is very important for Svetlana, who will use it to buy two more cows. This will give her an opportunity to create more milk products and increase the profits for her family. Svetlana hopes for goodwill from the lenders.
