loans.use: to buy two cows for her dairy farm.

loans.name: Serpil

texts.en:
Serpil, who is separated from her husband and the mother of one, is a hardworking and successful woman. Her first loan from Maya helped her buy a shop. With her second loan, she will have more capital to buy goods and ceramic materials. Her 11-year-old son is helping her instead of having a summer vacation. She plans to include her son in her work and, in the future, to teach him the profession. 
Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Serpil Hanım,eşinden ayrı bir çocuk annesi çalışkan başarılı bir kadın .Seramik ve takı tasarım yapıyor .Maya’dan aldığı birinci kredisi ile dükkan alırken katkı saģlamış. ikinci kredisi ile dükkanına mal ve seramik malzemeleri alarak sermayesini artırmayı ďüşünüyor.Oğlu 11 yaşında yaz tatil yerinde annesine yardımcı oluyor.Oğluna da mesleği öğretiyor ileride beraber bu işi yapmayı planlıyor.

loans.use: to buy goods and ceramic materials

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard, 38, is a permanent resident of a village in Isingiro District. He is married and has eight children and  two other dependents he cares for on behalf of his brother, who is elderly. Four of his children and the dependents are in school. Since childhood, he has been a farmer, raising and selling matooke (cooking bananas). In 2008 when he learned about the existence of Ugafode Microfinance, and he approached them for his prior loan of UGX 3,000,000 to improve his farm. This has made him prosper in life, and he even managed to build a semi-permanent house to live in. He is applying for a loan UGX 4,000,000, to renovate his house and make it more habitable.

loans.use: to improve the semi-permanent house he built with part of his prior loan.

loans.name: Yawa Massa

texts.en:
Yawa Massa is seeking a fifth loan from WAGES to continue growing her business selling school supplies, such as workbooks and pens. 

She has used her previous loans to reinvest in her business and to increase her stock. The new school year will start soon, so it is important to be able to stock up on school supplies in order to successfully meet the increased demand from her customers. 

Yawa Massa, 31 years old, is married to a mechanic, and the couple recently had their third child. The profits from her business will help her secure the well-being of her growing family.

loans.use: to purchase various school supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: vegetables, beans, corn, spices, cheese and a variety of cold and hot drinks.

loans.name: Ma. Magdalena

texts.en:
Ma. Magdalena is 58 years old. She is married to a soldier and they have five children. She sends her son to school, which is why she needs additional income for him. Her spouse's income is not enough for all their expenses that is why she raises hogs to sell upon attaining the desired weight. She usually gets 10,000 PHP upon selling piglets. 

She hopes to ensure good nutrition to hogs but she has insufficient funds right now. Ma. Magdalena is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy feed, vaccines, and medicines for the hogs. With proper care and enough sustenance to the hogs, they will grow healthier and can be sold at a higher cost someday.

She hopes to continue growing as a successful hog raiser.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and medicines for her hogs.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 32 year-old married woman with three children, living in Kasese Uganda. 

She deals in poultry farming and this has been her business for 10 years. She began farming to supplement her salary since it could not cover all her family needs.  She needs a loan to buy chicken feed and medicine.

Grace is a hard working person hoping to expand her project into a supply center.  Grace is faced with challenges of weather and competition.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and medicine.

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en:
Sulaiman is a 36 year old married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been in transport since 2000 and joined with the hope of employing himself. 

He faces challenges of competition.  However, he dreams of owning two motorcycles in order to generate more income. Sulaiman needs a loan to buy a motorcycle for his business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for his business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
HELLO KIVA LENDERS! Peter is 27 years of age, very brave, ambitious and a very hard worker who hails from the Nyamira area of Kenya, an area known for its quality and variety of bananas. Peter is from a humble background and, due to the high unemployment rate in Kenya, he never got a white-collar job, but he never lost hope or gave up on his dream of farming. He started mixed farming and has been doing this for the past two years. His primary sources of income are crop farming and dairy farming, but he also does some small business work to make ends meet.

Peter is single, that is why he wants to lay a good foundation for the family that will come in future and that is why he works hard to improve his living conditions. The Nyamira area has a high demand for poultry products, but the supply is low and Peter, being an enterprising person, would want to take advantage of the ready market that is there.
Peter is kindly seeking a loan of 30,000 KES to buy poultry so as to satisfy the demand that is there and also improve his income. Being simple, responsible and having good management skills, Peter will make good use of the loan and be able to turn his life around.
Peter has got a lot of desire to get ahead and he is sure that, through the loan, he will be able to make more money through selling eggs and poultry products to his neighbors and the ready market that is there.
Because of the good saving culture and being disciplined with his own finances, Peter will repay the loan and save more profits. He projects that after one year he will have doubled his egg production.
Through this loan, Peter is going to achieve the dream of improving his living condition.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Aref

texts.en:
Aref is a 45 years old married man who has a university education.  He is a father of four children; his oldest child is 22 years old and the youngest is five years old.  Together, they live in Taiz city, Yemen. 

Aref is a very active and dynamic man.  His dream is to  make a better future for his children. However, his income is not enough to cover all his expenses.
And his house lacks many home appliances and furniture.  For this reason, Aref applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to purchase furniture.

Aref looks forward to improving the living condition of his family by opening a grocery in his area.  He also plans to open a saving account in AMB.

loans.use: to purchase home furniture.

loans.name: Sofia Esperanza

texts.es: Sofia Esperanza acompañada con tres hijos mayores de edad originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, ella se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos, por falta de recursos económicos y por la pobreza en la que vivían no pudo terminar sus estudios, por lo que se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad, Para ayudar con los gastos del hogar, gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante es que decide poner una pequeña pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitación donde ofrece productos de consumo diario del hogar como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, detergentes, jabón, aceite, galletas tostadas, leña, golosinas, productos congelados, gaseosas, jugos, salsas de tomates, tomates, cebollas, entre otras, sus compras son al contado en distribuidoras y camiones distribuidores que le ofrecen sus productos en la puertas de su casa, sus ventas son al contado los cuales tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, inicia su negocio con fondos propios con una pequeña mesita vendiendo golosinas, frescos naturales, frutas pero ahora ella tiene una pulperia pequeña, el cual día a día va creciendo,  uno de sus sueños es poder crecer mas en su negocio mejorar la condiciones de su negocio, su jornada diaria empieza desde muy temprano abre las puerta de su negocio para al publico y gracias a su buen trato es que hoy en día su clientela ha incrementado y por lo que tiene mayor demanda de sus productos. el objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su inventario con nuevos productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esa forma pueda obtener mejores ingresos.-
texts.en:
Sofia Esperanza is in a relationship and has three adult children.  She comes from one of the municipalities of Chinandega, located in the west of the country.  She is characterized by being a hard worker, responsible, and has a desire for self-improvement.  In her free time she likes to enjoy the company of her children.  Due to a lack of economic resources and the poverty in which she lived, she was not able to finish her studies, and as a result was obligated to work from an early age.

So that she can help with the expenses of her household, and thanks to her effort and desire to get ahead, she decided to set up a small grocery store in her home where she offers everyday goods such as: rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergents, soap, oil, biscuit cookies, firewood, sweets, frozen goods, soda, juice, tomato sauce, tomatoes, and onions, among other products.  Her purchases are made in cash from wholesalers and wholesaler trucks that offer their products at the door of her home.  Her sales are in cash, and she has regular customers as well as those who come now and then.

She started her business with her own funds, with a small stand selling sweets, fresh juices, and fruit, but she now has a small grocery store, which continues to grow by the day.  One of her dreams is to be able to further grow and improve the conditions of her business.  Her workday begins very early when she opens the doors of her business to the public. Thanks to her good deals, her clientele has increased, and because of this there is a greater demand for her products.  

The goal of this funding is to invest working capital and stock her inventory with new products to offer her customers and in this way she can obtain a greater income.

loans.use: to invest working capital in the purchase of everyday home products to sell in her store, such as: firewood, rice, sugar, beans, oil, tomatoes, onions, soda, frozen goods, and detergents, among others

loans.name: Ayten

texts.en:
Ayten is married and the mother of two children. She carves meerschaum, a local stone referred to as white gold and used to make jewelry and pipes, with her husband. 

With her first loan from Maya, she bought raw meerschaum to process and sell and she made a good profit. Now she is ready for a second loan. She will increase her capital to buy meerschaum to process again. 

Ayten is a hardworking woman and contributes to her family income and the national economy with her work.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Ayten Hanım, evli ve 2 çocuk annesi.Eşiyle birlikte lületaşı yapıyor(lüle taşı  yöresine ait beyaz altın denilen bir maden.Genellikle takı ve pipo yapımında kullanılır) Maya’dan aldığı birinci kredi ile lületaşını ham olarak alıp işleyerek güzel para kazandı.Şu anda 2. kredisini kullanıyor.2. kredisiylede yine lületaşı alıp işleyerek sermayesini artırmayı planlıyor. Ayten hanım çalışkan bir kadın,çalışarak aile ve ülke ekonomisine katkı sağlıyor.

loans.use: to buy meerschaum to process.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima is 30 years old married with three children, living in Kasese, Uganda. She is fish monger and has been in the business for three years. She earns additional income from making shopping baskets. She began the business to diversify sources of income for her home consumption.

Salima is hardworking and has a dream of expanding her business, but competition is her major challenge. She needs this money to buy more fish for resale.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy: electrical wire, light sockets, metal boxes, switches and outlets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a taxi to work on it as a driver to earn money in order to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beef cattle.

loans.name: Fernanda Astrid

texts.es:
Fernanda es una humilde costurera que día a día lucha por mejorar su negocio, es muy trabajadora, honesta y responsable tiene su taller de confección ubicado en su hogar donde realiza reparaciones y pequeños pedidos que le llegan.

Quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra  de una maquina fileteadora y tela con lo que mejorara la calidad de su trabajo, mejorar los tiempos de producción y le permitirá abrirse a nuevos pedidos que le generen a ella una mejor rentabilidad y hacer algo más por su vida. 

Tiene un hijo de 16 años de edad al cual ama de todo corazón y solo quiere lo mejor para él por tal motivo luchara en su negocio por el bien de su familia.
texts.en:
Fernanda is a humble seamstress who, day by day, struggles to improve her business. She is very hardworking, honest and responsible. She has her sewing workshop located in her home where she carries out repairs and small orders that arrive to her.

She wants to apply for a loan for the purchase of an overlock sewing machine and fabric, with which she will improve the quality of her work, improve her production time and will allow her to open herself to new orders that will generate better profitability for her and do something more for her life.

She has a 16 year old son, who she loves with all of her heart and only wants the best for him. For this reason, she will fight in her business for the good of her family.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Han Group

texts.en: Han is 34 years old, a farmer, and a married woman with two children. She has been a farmer since 2005. Her husband is a construction worker. Both of her children are students. They live in Prey Veng Province of Cambodia. They can earn approximately $12 per day. Now, Han would like to request a loan as a group of three and she will use her portion to build a latrine. This loan will help her and her family live in better conditions. In the future, she wants to run a grocery store, build a new house and support her children to go to university.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 35-year-old resident of Biafra in the Mbarara district of Uganda. He dropped out of school upon the death of his father, which left him with no means to raise fees for his education.

Pushed by the need as the elder son to support his aging mother and younger siblings, he settled at their home and started serious banana farming. This business grew and helped him to sustain his father’s family and support the education of his younger brothers.

He later obtained a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from UGAFODE which made the family stable and helped him to prosper and to begin constructing a semi-permanent house that is still under construction.  He is requesting a loan of $1925 (5,000,000 UGX) to help him finish the house.

loans.use: to buy building materials like cement, shutters, and paint to finish his family's home.

loans.name: Bayram

texts.en:
Bayram is 35 years old, unmarried, and lives with his parents. Bayram is a farmer. He raises fruits and vegetables on his own land, but he has a problem with irrigation because he has to borrow water from his neighbor in order to irrigate his land. 

Bayram needs your financial support. For this reason, he is requesting a loan in the amount of AZN 1200. With this money, he plans to buy tools to build a sluiceway. He is thankful to Kiva and the Aqroinvest organization for a loan.

loans.use: to buy tools to build a sluiceway.

loans.name: Ana Lorena

texts.es: Ana de 30 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo de 7 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que además de buscar superarse por medio del estudio desde hace 3 años decidió colocar su negocio de venta de productos varios en su vivienda lo que le permite ganarse la vida. Su compañero de vida la apoya en la economía familiar por medio de su trabajo como motorista de una empresa. Ana desea ampliar más su negocio esperando ver reflejadas las mejoras en sus ingresos. Es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de más productos para su tienda como: golosinas, jabón, detergente, paletas, aceite, bebidas, etc.
texts.en: Ana, 30 years old, lives with her life partner and her 7-year-old son. She is an entrepreneurial woman who, in addition to seeking to better herself through education, decided three years ago to invest in her business selling various products from her home, which allows her to earn a living. Her life partner supports her in the family economy through his work as a motorcyclist of a company. Ana wishes to expand her business further, hoping to see improvements reflected in her income. That is why she requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of more products for her store like: sweets, soap, detergent, ice-pops, oil, beverages, etc.

loans.use: to buy sweets, soap, detergent, ice-pops, oil, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy male and female underwear, pants, shirts, blouses, and lotions.

loans.name: Margarita Del Socorro

texts.es: Margarita del Socorro mayor de edad casada con tres hijos menores de edad, originaria de chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país, margarita se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos, no pudo cursar una carrera terminando solo su secundaria, debido a que se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar, es una microempresaria y administradora de su propios negocio el cual consiste en la venta de Zapatos de cuero,deportivos, tenis, chinelas, sandalias, etc en uno de los mercados de este municipio. sus compras y ventas las realiza al contado ya que se encuentra en un buen punto porque es muy concurrido por las personas que vienen de otros municipios hacer sus compras a Chinandega, inicia su jornada diaria desde muy temprano para aprovechar a las personas que llegan muy de mañana a realizar sus compras, uno de sus sueños es poder poder crecer en su negocio, estableciendo una tienda formal y lograr que sus hijos puedan culminar una carrera para que sean todos unos profesionales, el objetivo de este financiamiento es para capital de trabajo y surtir su inventario en la compra de calzados, como:sandalias, chinelas, sandalias, tenes y lograr cubrir unos pedidos que sus clientes le ha solicitado, al crecer la magnitud de de su negocio puede comprar a mejores precios, surtir productos que no tenga en existencia y también como salen nuevos modelos de sandalias y ofertar nuevos productos  a todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
Margarita del Socorro is an adult, married, with 3 underage children and originally from Chinandega, which is located in the west of the country. Margarita is a hard-working woman, responsible and eager for personal growth. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources, she could not go to college and finished only her junior high school education. She had to work from a young age in order to help with home expenses.

She is an entrepreneur and manager of her own businesses, which consist of the sale of leather shoes, sport shoes, slippers, sandals, etc. in one of the markets of this municipality. She makes her sales and purchases with cash since she is located in a good place where people from other municipalities come to shop to Chinandega. She starts her work day early to be able to sell to those who arrive early in the morning to shop.

One of her dreams is to be able to grow her business, to establish a formal shop and to help her children study to become professionals.

The purpose of this loan is being able to obtain work capital and to supply her inventory with the purchase of shoes, such as: sandals, slippers, sport shoes, and to be able to fulfil some requests that her customers have requested from her. As her business grows she can buy at better prices, supply products that she does not have available and those that are introduced, such as new models of sandals, and to offer these to all her customers.

loans.use: to buy diverse styles of sandals, shoes and slippers among others

loans.name: Erick Arnold

texts.es: Erick de 25 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida. Él es un joven emprendedor que hace 2 años decidió colocar su propio negocio de serigrafía en el cual elabora diferentes diseños de estampado. Gracias a su creatividad cada día son más los clientes que solicitan sus servicios. Es por ello que Erick deseando mejorar sus ventas solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra camisas, pintura, seda y marcos ya que estos materiales son materia prima para su pequeño negocio de serigrafía.
texts.en: Erick, 25 years old, lives with his life partner. He is an entrepreneurial young man who decided two years ago to make his own silk-screen printing business in which he produces different styles of prints. Thanks to his creativity, each day there are more customers who request his services. That is why Erick, wishing to improve his sales, requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of shirts, paint, silk, and frames since these materials are the raw materials for his small silk-screen printing business.

loans.use: to buy shirts, paint, silk, and frames for his silk-screen printing business.

loans.name: Aku

texts.en: Aku is a 38-year-old hairdresser. She is married to a pharmacist and the couple has two young children who are both already attending school. Aku is seeking her first loan from WAGES. She wants to use this loan to purchase hair extensions and other hairdressing supplies, both for resale and for use in her shop. Aku has been working as a hairdresser for 12 years, and she hopes that this loan will allow her to grow her business and thus allow her to better secure her family’s future.

loans.use: to buy extensions and other hairdressing supplies

loans.name: Nyantsimbo Tutungukye Group

texts.en:
Sulaiti is a 35-year-old, hardworking, married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in the selling of coffee. This is his main source of income though he also practices farming, from which he earns an extra income. He started this business to educate his children and to have a better standard of living. He faces challenges, such as weather changes that affect his produce business. He has a vision of owning a big, modern produce store and of educating his children. He is a member of the Nyantsimbo Tutungukye Group, where there is group guarantor for one to access credit..
 
He is requesting a loan to buy more coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy more coffee to sell

loans.name: Arevhat

texts.en:
Arevhat has been growing tomato, cucumber, and greens in the greenhouses that she owns. Arevhat supports her family with the profits from her farming. The farm that she runs also includes two oxen and some calves. 

Arevhat is requesting a loan to buy cucumber seeds and fertilizer so that she will have a good harvest. The loan will also help Arevhat to gather more income for her family. She lives with her husband and son; her elder son currently serves in the army.

loans.use: to pay for cucumber seeds, fertilizer, and the renovation of her greenhouse

loans.name: Lamulatu

texts.en: Lamulatu is a hardworking, 25-year-old lady from Kacence, a suburb in the Mbarara municipality. She dropped out of school to help her grandmother with farming because she couldn't afford to pay her tuition. Due to the fact that she is bright, she was selected by a humanitarian organization and enrolled in a nursing course. She then received a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from Ugafode Microfinance which helped her start a clinic; this loan was paid very well. She is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 UGX to complete the house to accommodate her grandmother.

loans.use: Tto buy building materials, such as iron sheets

loans.name: Nancy Gloribel

texts.es: Nancy de 23 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su hija de 3 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida trabajando como jornalera en una platanera, su compañero de vida también se desempeña como jornalero lo que le permite aportar económicamente a los gastos del hogar. Nancy desea reparar el techo de su vivienda, para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada y madera, además deberá pagar mano de obra necesaria para realizar la reparación del techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Nancy, is 23 years old. She lives with her companion and their 3 year old child. She is an enterprising woman who makes her living as a day laborer in a banana plantation. Her partner also works as a day laborer, which allows him to contribute economically to the expenses of the household. 

Nancy wants to repair the roof of their house and is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized roofing material and lumber. In addition, she will need to pay for the labor needed to complete the repair of the roof of the house.

loans.use: to buy galvanized roofing material and timber plus labor to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.en:
Gulsara is a kind woman. She lives in a small village with her husband. Her husband, Golibjon, is a pensioner. Their children are adults. Gulsara is a grandmother of two little boys. She cares for her grandchildren. She has requested loans from IMON several times and used her previous loans for developing her business. She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 20 years. 

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. She feeds cows and also grows crops. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. 

She wants to develop her business but she does not have the money to buy more cattle. This loan will help her increase her number of cattle and, from which, to profit and improve her living condition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle to increase her working capital

loans.name: Maria Felicita

texts.es: María de 57 años de edad vive con sus 2 hijos de 33 y 35 años de edad. Ella es una mujer tenaz que luego de perder a su esposo ha logrado salir adelante junto a sus hijos gracias a la venta de tamales de carne y frijoles, la cual realiza desde hace 6 años. María desea construir una pila con lavadero ya que como se observa en la fotografía no cuenta con un depósito de recolección de agua por lo que necesita construirla lo antes posible, además desea encementar el piso de la cocina por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro además deberá pagar mano de obra necesaria para realizar las mejoras mencionadas en su vivienda.
texts.en:
María is 57 years old and lives with her two children, who are 33 and 35 years old. She is a tenacious woman who, after losing her husband, has succeeded in moving ahead together with her children, thanks to the sale of meat and bean tamales, which she has done for six years.

María wants to build a laundry sink. As can be seen in the photo, she doesn't have a water collection reservoir, so she needs to build one as soon as possible. She also wants to cement the kitchen floor. 

For this, she's asking FUSAI for a loan to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron, as well as manual labor necessary to accomplish the mentioned improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron to build a sink and cement the kitchen floor.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa de 66 años de edad vive en compañía de su nieto de 18 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que presta sus servicios domésticos, además sus dos hijos tuvieron que emigrar al extranjero para apoyar a la economía familiar. Teresa desea construir un servicio sanitario en su vivienda por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: plancha de cemento, taza de inodoro, arena, cemento, ladrillo, grava y hierro, además deberá pagar mano de obra necesaria para realizar la construcción del servicio sanitario en su vivienda.
texts.en: Teresa is 66 years old and lives with her 18-year-old grandson. Teresa is hard-working. She works as a domestic servant while two of her children had to move abroad in order to provide the family with financial support. Teresa wants to build a lavatory in her home. She is therefore applying for a loan from "FUSAI" in order to buy a cement iron, a toilet, sand, cement, bricks, gravel and iron bars, and to pay labourers to build a toilet in her home.

loans.use: to buy a cement iron, a toilet, sand, cement, bricks, gravel and iron bars in order to build a toilet in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tubing, wire, switches, water pipes, and  faucets to install electricity and running water in her home.

loans.name: Tikarispa Group

texts.es:
La socia Rosa pertenece al banco comunal TIKARISPA, el banco está ubicado en Rumichaca Baja en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Urubamba.
La socia Rosa continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azcuar entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solictan, la socia a la vez continua vendiendo chicha de jora (estos a base de maíz),la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz,azucar,jora, cerveza entre otros.
Los demás socios se dedican a la carpintería, crianza de animales menores, maestro constructor albañil, mototaxi, agricultura.
La socia se siente agradecida con el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the TIKARISPA communal bank. The bank is located in Rumichaca Baja in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province and Urubamba department.

The member, Rosa, still has her convenience store business; she is a responsable, hard-working person. She continues to sell different kinds of products, such as rice, sugar, etc. that her clientele requests from her. At the same time, she continues to sell "chicha de jora" (corn-based beer). Rosa wants to be able to keep working so she can continue to support her family. The member is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, "jora" corn, and beer, among other things. Rosa is grateful for the loan granted and promises to comply with the established loan payments. 

The other members work in carpentry, raising small animals, as a construction foreman, mototaxi driver, and in farming.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, "jora" corn and beer, among other things.

loans.name: Ahoefa Julienne

texts.en:
Julienne, 37 years old, is a widow with three children ranging in age from 7 to 15 years old. Julienne has requested a second loan from WAGES in order to increase her stock of school supplies, juice, and water, which she sells at a school near Lomé, the capital of Togo. With the new school year fast approaching, Julienne hopes to take advantage of increased demand with a larger stock of merchandise. 

Julienne will use the extra profits to continue growing her business, and thus assure that she is able to pay for her children’s education. 

In the future, Julienne would like to open her own shop.

loans.use: To buy school supplies, juice, and water

loans.name: Sop Mame Diarra 5" Beug Manal Sa Bop" Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Sop Mame Diarra 5 « Beug Manal Sa Bop » est un sous groupe d’un réseau de femmes commerçantes et transformatrices de produits halieutiques. Il est composé de cinq femmes qui s’activent depuis plusieurs années et qui se sont regroupées pour bénéficier d’un appui financier qui leur permettra de renforcer leurs activités génératrices de revenus. Madame Aminata est la présidente ; elle est mariée et mère de famille. Aminata évolue dans la transformation et la commercialisation de produits halieutiques depuis maintenant 10 ans.  Elle achète des fruits de mer, qu’elle transforme elle-même pour le commercialiser. Avec les bénéfices réalisés, elle réinvesti dans l’activité et appuie aussi son mari dans la dépense quotidienne du foyer. 
Aminata veut créer son entreprise de transformation avec ses enfants dans le but de pouvoir exporter le produit.
texts.en: The Sop Mame Diarra 5 "Beug Manal Sa Bop" Credit Group is an affiliate group of a network of businesswomen and women who work with seafood. This group is made up of five members who have been working in this domain for many years and who have come together in order to benefit from financial aid which will allow them to reinforce their money-generating activities. Aminata is the group's president; she is a married mother. Aminata has processed and sold seafood for the past 10 years. She purchases her seafood which she then processes herself in order to resell it. She reinvests the profits back into her business and also supports her husband with their daily household expenses. Aminata wants to create her own seafood-processing facility with her children so that their goods can be exported.

loans.use: to purchase seafood for resale

loans.name: Koami

texts.en: Koami is 45 years old, married, and a father of seven children. His wife works in retail. Koami has worked as a bus driver for almost twenty years. He has requested a loan in order to pay for repairs on his bus, which will allow him to provide better and more consistent service to his customers. Koami plans to use the profits from his business to increase his savings, with the eventual goal of expanding his business through the purchase of a second bus. Through the success of his business, Koami wants to help make sure that his family continues to thrive.

loans.use: to pay for repairs of his bus

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 34 years old with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling cassava flour for the last five years. She began the business to have a source of income to meet her family's day to day needs. 

Grace is a hardworking woman dreaming of expanding her business. However, she is faced with a challenge of competition from people with the same business. 

Grace wants money to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Jennipher

texts.en:
Jennipher is a hardworking lady, aged 27, from Lugazi, a suburb in Mbarara municipality. She grew up with her grandmother after being neglected by her father, who impregnated her mother when they were both students in secondary school. All her needs were catered for by her grandmother, who was a peasant. She could not afford school fees for A’ level, so she then dropped out of school. Due to the fact that she was bright, she also learned how to make cakes and ended up starting her own bakery. 

She later got a loan of 3,000,000 from Ugafode Microfinance, which helped her to put up some small rooms around town which she is currently using as a guest house. This loan was paid very well. 

She is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 to renovate her house so that she can increase the charges of the rooms.

loans.use: To renovate her rooms

loans.name: Moreen

texts.en: Moreen is a resident of Rwabarata, in the Kiruhura district. She has four biological children and two other dependents, all in school. She started farming some 5 years ago, but could not yield anything because of the poor methods she was using. That is when she got to know UGAFODE Microfinance and acquired a loan of 1,000,000 UGX, which helped her farming business grow. Because of Moreen’s hard work, she continued expanding. And now she is requesting a loan 2,000,000 UGX to diversify her farming business by hiring labor and purchasing improved seeds.

loans.use: to buy improved seeds and hire labor to expand her farming

loans.name: Tsui-Shitoo Group

texts.en:
The Tsui-Shitoo group is made up of five women. They sell cloth, lining, foodstuffs, soft drinks, and plastic bowls.

The group's representative, named Edwina, is the woman standing second from the left in the photo. The members of the group all live in the same neighborhood. In order to boost their businesses, the group's members are requesting a total loan amount of 6,300 GHS from ID-Ghana.

Edwina is 33 years old and married to an information technology officer named Maclean. The couple has two children, both are in school and are their dependents. Edwina lives with her husband and children. The couple jointly takes care of the various expenses of the household. 

Edwina attended school to the secondary level. In order to cover some of the expenses of her household, she has been selling soft drinks in her region, for the past nine years. She buys her merchandise from the wholesalers in Accra. It is the sixth time that Edwina and the other members of the group are taking a loan from ID-Ghana. Thanks to this loan, they will be able to increase their stocks of merchandise and therefore boost their level of activity. This loan will also allow them to attract more customers and increase their income.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks to sell to customers

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 34-year-old, married Palestinian refugee. He had the chance to study computer science, but unfortunately he couldn't benefit from working in this domain, since Palestinians have limited access to several working sectors in Lebanon.

For this reason, Mohamad decided to help his father in his business and get the necessary experience and talent in this domain in order to start his own business and expand it in a well-managed way. Mohamad has 18 years of experience in the following areas: selling and fixing new and used van spare parts, fixing the necessary mechanical needs of vans, and renting vans when requested. He used this business experience from his father to start his own business in October 2009. Today, he has three employees, who work hard to help him in replying to his increasing number of customers. His workshop is located in a very attracting location, next to the regional parking for vans and buses. Because he is the only person in the region who provides such services, he has to make sure that he is always capable of replying to different customers' needs.

Mohamad developed his business properly. He started in the retail business and added maintenance services in order to provide his customers with everything they need at the same place, to save time. Today, Mohamad is working hard on developing his business properly, through an acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. Through this acquired loan, he will buy 12 car engines made in Korea, specialized for the vans he works on, in order to provide the necessary maintenance they need.

His mechanical capabilities were developed gradually. At the beginning, he only had one car lifter, which he used to make his work easier, until he bought the necessary tools requested for this business. Today, he owns his work place from the net profit he received through this business. He received weekly installments and now, his business capital is around $100,000. He hopes to keep on developing his business in a well-managed way, to make sure that he can provide his beloved family the necessary standards of living they need, especially now that his wife is pregnant with their first expected baby.

loans.use: to buy 12 car engines made in Korea, specialized for the vans he works on

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a single man born in 1994, with an elementary level of education since he had to quit school to support his family, which consists of five other members; he is the sole earner.

Six years ago he started working in a sawmill, but his limited salary isn’t enough to cover his family’s increasing needs. For this reason, he started his own wholesale stationary and school supplies business as an additional income. 

Today, Ali is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to increase his business merchandise with newly released, special offered school supplies, to get ready for the coming educational year.

Ali is working hard to develop his family’s living. He hopes that in the future, he can open a household products selling shop, to make sure that he can cover his beloved family’s increasing needs.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with newly released, special offered school supplies to get ready for the coming educational year.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 26-year-old, single man from Qalqilya city. He lives with his family in a very simple house. His father is a farmer and he plants seasonal crops. Mahmoud works in a workshop for auto repairs, which he owns. He has two years of experience in this field. Mahmoud took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy more repair parts and tools for his auto repair workshop. This will help him increase his productivity as well as his income. 
Mahmoud appears in the photo while he was working.

loans.use: to buy more repair parts and tools for his auto repair workshop

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
Abbass is a single man, born in 1993, with a vocational level of education. Life’s pressures and difficulties forced him to leave school in order to support his family of five. 

He started working in a concrete stone factory 3 years ago, but his limited salary wasn’t enough to cover his family’s needs and expenses, because living needs and expenses are increasing.  

Abbass is requesting a Youth Loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to buy a small truck he needs in order to support his own business (selling concrete stones) in parallel with the current existing job in the factory, to expand his work, and increase his income.

He has a future dream to open his own business, which he is working hard to support. Abbass is trying hard to improve his work, and this loan is very important for him to guarantee his family’s future and cover all their needs and expenses.

loans.use: To buy a small truck for his business selling concrete stones.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy textiles and thread for her business

loans.name: Francisco Alexander

texts.es: Francisco de 23 años de edad vive con su grupo familiar. Él es un joven trabajador que se desempeña como ayudante de albañil desde hace 2 años lo que le ha permitido aportar a la economía del hogar. Francisco desea construir un servicio sanitario en su vivienda, además desea reparar el techo de la cocina que como se puede observar en la fotografía se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar cemento, arena, ladrillo, grava, plancha de cemento, taza de inodoro, lámina, madera y clavos lo antes posible para hacer las reparaciones necesarias
texts.en: Francisco is 23 years old and lives with his family. He is a hard-working young man who has been working as a building site labourer for two years. This work has allowed him to support the household economy. Francisco wants to build a lavatory in his home. He also wants to carry out repairs to the roof above the kitchen which, as can be seen in the photograph, is not in good condition. Francisco is applying for this loan from "FUSAI" in order to buy cement, sand, bricks, gravel, a cement iron, toilet, metal sheeting, wood and nails to carry out repairs to his home as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, gravel, a cement iron, toilet, metal sheeting, wood and nails in order to carry out repairs to his home.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: María de 49 años de edad vive con su esposo. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a la venta de detergentes para la limpieza de la ropa tales como: cloro, rinso, jabón, etc. actividad que realiza de forma ambulante en los cantones cercanos a su localidad. Su esposo se dedica a la reparación de calzado y con el fruto de su trabajo aporta a la economía familiar. María desea cambiar la lámina de las paredes y del techo de  su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar la lámina de su vivienda dado que cuando es tiempo de lluvia el agua se filtra.
texts.en:
Maria is 49 years old and lives with her husband. She is a businesswoman who makes a living selling detergents for the cleaning of clothes such as: chlorine, washing powder, soap, etc. She works as a traveling saleswoman in the communities near her home. Her husband makes a living repairing shoes and with the success of his work he contributes to the household economy.

Maria wishes to change the sheeting of the walls and the roof of her house. For this reason she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood, and nails to change the sheeting of her house since when it rains the water leaks in.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood, and nails to change the sheeting of her house.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es: Ernestina de 28 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos una niña de 10 años y un varón de 3 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se desempeña desde hace 6 años como agricultora. Ernestina siembra en una manzana de tierra, semilla de maíz el cual después de cultivarlo vende en los alrededores de su cantón. Además su compañero de vida se desempaña como electricista logrando aportar a la economía familiar por medio de su trabajo. Ella desea repellas las paredes y ensementar el piso de su vivienda para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena y grava para  poder mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en: Ernestina, 28 years old, lives with her life partner and their two children, one a 10-year-old girl and a boy of three years of age. She is a hardworking woman who has worked for the last six years as a farmer. Ernestina plants corn on a plot of land, which after harvesting it she sells around her zone. In addition, her life partner works as an electrician being able to contribute to the family economy through his work. She wishes to plaster the walls and cement the floor of her home for which she requests a loan from FUSAI to buy: cement, sand, and gravel to be able to improve the conditions of her home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel to cement the floor and to plaster the walls of her home.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es: Alba de 34 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus 5 hijas de 15 años, 14 años, 13 años  y 8 meses de edad, además una hija mayor de edad que aporta a la economía familiar. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 9 años se gana la vida vendiendo quesadillas de manera ambulante en los cantones cercanos, su compañero de vida se desempeña como agricultor y justos mantienen la economía de la familia. Alba desea construir una galera en su propiedad para lo cual solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, cemento, arena y madera para poder construir la galera en su propiedad.
texts.en: Alba is 34 years old and lives with her partner and five daughters. The eldest daughter supports the family economy. The next three daughters are fifteen, fourteen, and thirteen years old, while the youngest is eight months old. Alba is an enterprising woman. For nine years she has made a living selling quesadillas as a street vendor. Alba's partner is a farmer and, together, the couple supports the family. Alba wants to build a shed on her property. She has come to "FUSAI" in order to apply for a loan to buy metal sheeting, cement, sand and wood so as to build a shed on her property.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, cement, sand and wood in order to build a shed on her property.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos de 28 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo de 5 años de edad. Él es un hombre emprendedor que se gana la vida como albañil desde hace 6 años, además su compañera de vida lo apoya económicamente con su pequeño negocio de venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado central. Carlos desea reparar el techo de su vivienda por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: teja y madera para hacer las reparaciones necesarias en el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: Carlos is 28 years old and lives with his partner and five-year-old son. Carlos is enterprising and has been earning a living as a builder for six years. His partner also supports him with her little business selling fruits and vegetables at the city market. Carlos wants to repair the roof of his home. Carlos is apply for this loan from "FUSAI" in order to buy roof tiles and wood in order to carry out necessary repairs to the roof of his home.

loans.use: to buy roof tiles and wood in order to carry out necessary repairs to the roof of his home.

loans.name: Sozhida

texts.en:
Sozhida lives with her son Azam and his family in the capital of Tajikistan. Her husband died some years ago. So, she is widowed. 

Sozhida is a businesswoman. She began own business selling women's clothes 20 years ago. Sozhida sells a variety of women's clothes. She has a selling place in a local market, and every season renews the assortment of her goods. She is going to buy goods for the new season, and in this way attract more customers. She wants to sell fashionable clothes and in this way to bring gladness to local people. 

She is asking for a loan of 2,000 USD to buy women's clothes for the new season. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy women's clothes for the new season

loans.name: Dédé

texts.en:
Dédé has been selling butane gas and mineral water for the past four years. She is 45 years old, and her husband works at the port in Lome, the capital of Togo. The couple has one child in school.  

Dédé has requested her fourth loan from WAGES, which she plans to use to buy further supplies of butane gas and mineral water for her shop. She wants to use her profits to reinvest in her business. In addition to further strengthening her business, her primary goal for the future is making sure that her child gets a good education.

loans.use: To buy butane gas and mineral water

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a 41-year-old married woman from Bethlehem city. She is a mother of six kids; three sons and three daughters. She works in a grocery store for the family. It has been open for the past five years. It is a good business, and the demand is high. 

Nadia took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more products for her grocery store to sell. This will improve the store, and increase its income. 

Nadia appears in the photo in the grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more products for her grocery store

loans.name: Botomabakouwe

texts.en:
Botomabakouwe is a retailer selling diverse products, primarily charcoal, corn, and honey. She has been in business for over 15 years, and she is seeking a second loan form WAGES in order to purchase more charcoal, corn, and honey to sell. 

Botomabakouwe is 48 years old, and married to a secretary. The couple has two children, ages 17 and 22, who are both still in school. She plans to use her additional profits to increase her savings, and she would eventually like to open a second shop. 

Botomabakouwe's primary goal for the future is to ensure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy charcoal, corn, and honey

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.en:
Akossiwa is a 40-year-old mother of four children ranging in age from 2 to 14 years old. Her husband works in retail at the port of Lomé, the capital of Togo. 

Akossiwa has operated a shop out of her home for the past 15 years, selling diverse products such as corn, dry beans, charcoal, and gari (manioc flour).

She is seeking her first loan with WAGES. She plans to use the money to increase her stock of merchandise. She hopes to continue growing her business in the future, and to use the proceeds to ensure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy corn, beans, and charcoal for resale

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es: María de 67 años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida con la venta de productos básicos en una tienda ubicada en su domicilio, además aprovechando la clientela de la  tienda coloco una venta de tortas para tener un ingreso extra. María desea terminar de construir un  cuarto en su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, madera, teja, arena, puertas y ventanas para terminar de construir un cuarto en su vivienda.
texts.en:
María is 67 years old and lives with her life's companion. She is an enterprising woman who makes her living through the sale of basic products in a store that is located in her home. In addition, taking advantage of the presence of clients in her store, she set up sales of sandwiches to bring in extra income. 

Maria wants to finish constructing a room in her house. For this reason, she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, lumber, roofing, sand, doors and windows to complete the construction of the room.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to finish construction of a room on her house.

loans.name: Osmaro Antonio

texts.es: Osmaro de 28 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos una niña de 4 años y un varón de 6 años de edad. Él es hombre muy trabajador que se gana la vida con la venta de verduras en el mercado central, además su compañera de vida lo apoya con la economía familiar con la venta de yuca que realiza en el mismo mercado. Osmaro desea terminar de construir el patio de su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: arena, ladrillo, cemento, teja y madera para terminar de construir el patio de su vivienda.
texts.en: Osmaro is 28 years old. He lives with his life partner and his two children: a 4-year-old daughter and a 6-year-old son. He is a very hardworking man who makes a living selling vegetables at the central market. In addition, his life partner helps him with the household finances by selling yucca at the same market. Osmaro wants to finish building a patio at his house. Therefore, he is requesting a loan from Fusai to buy sand, bricks, cement, tile, and wood to finish building a patio at his house.

loans.use: to buy sand, bricks, cement, tile, and wood to finish building a patio at his house.

loans.name: Alba Dalila

texts.es: Alba de 50 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su nieta de 5 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida con la venta de productos de primera necesidad tales como: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, maíz, etc. Además su compañero de vida se dedica a prestar sus servicios de seguridad lo que le permite dar un aporte a la economía familiar. Alba desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda ya que como se observa en la fotografía este se encuentra en malas condiciones por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: lámina galvanizada y madera, además deberá pagar mano de obra necesaria para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Alba, 50 years old, lives with her life companion and her five year old niece.  She is an enterprising woman who earns a living selling basic products that are always needed, such as rice, sugar, beans, and corn.  Besides this, her companion works as a security guard, which allows him to support the family finances. 

 Alba wants to change the roof of their home since as one can see in the photo, the roof is in bad shape.  This is why she has asked FUSAI for a loan to buy galvanized metal sheets and wood, and to also pay for the necessary labor to replace the roof of their living place.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets and wood, and also pay for labor needed to replace the roof of her living place

loans.name: God's Hand Group

texts.en:
This group of 6 members belongs to the group called God's Hand created in October 2010. This is their sixth loan cycle. The group is composed of members living in the same neighborhood and the surrounding area. The members get along very well. Their businesses are retail and they sell underwear, kids' wear, slippers, grocery, lubricants, vegetables and bags.

Elizabeth, the group’s star borrower, is standing far left in the picture. She is 55 years old. She is married and a mother of two. She plans to retail underwear and kids' wear. Specifically, she will purchase GHS 600 of underwear, and also GHS 600 of kids' wear, in order to resell to customers in the market. She has been doing this job for 12 years.

She uses her profits to take care of her family and herself, and she reinvests the rest.

loans.use: To purchase underwear and kids' wear and resell to customers in the market.

loans.name: Fathi

texts.en:
Fathi is a 28-year-old married man, and a father of two children. His oldest child is 3 years old and the youngest one is 1 years old. Fathi lives with his family in Sana'a, Yemen. 

Now, he is a student at Sana'a University. By financial support from his father, Fathi could purchase a taxi to work on it as a driver to earn money to help him in the costs of his studies. He started in this business two years ago. He works as a driver on the taxi. Unfortunately, most of what he earns from this business goes to the repair of the taxi. He spends most of his money and time in repairing the taxi. So, his taxi needs a weekly repair, but Fathi doesn't have enough money to do that. 

For this reason, he applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to buy spare parts for the taxi. These new spare parts will help him in saving a lot of money.

Fathi's vision is to purchase another taxi and rent it. He hopes to finish his studying at the University. He is a very active and vigorous young man.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the taxi.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna lives in Sisian town with her husband and daughter. Her daughter is a teacher working at a local school, and 
Anna and her husband are farmers. They learned how to farm when they were very young, and now the farm that they run makes enough to contribute to their family's income. 

Anna has now requested this loan of USD 3,000 to purchase six oxen and forage for feeding the livestock. The loan will be very helpful for this family, and they hope for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for six oxen and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es: Vidal de 39 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos de 15 y 11 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que desde hace 1 año y medio se dedica a prestar sus servicios de seguridad en una empresa. Vidal desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda ya que como podemos observar en la fotografía este se encuentra completamente deteriorado,  lo que tiene preocupado a Vidal quien desea cambiarlo lo antes posible, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada y madera, además deberá pagar mano de obra necesaria para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: Vidal is 39 years old and lives with his companion and their 2 children, 15 and 11 years of age. Vidal is a hardworking man who has been working for a security company for a year and one-half.  He wants to replace the roof of his dwelling which, as we can see in the photograph, has deteriorated badly. Concerned about the deterioration, Vidal wants to replace it as soon as possible. For this purpose he is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy galvanized sheet metal and lumber. In addition, he will need to pay for the labor necessary to replace the roof of his house.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal and lumber, plus labor, to replace the roof on his house.

loans.name: Wilber Alfredo

texts.es: Wilber de 34 años de edad vive con sus 2 hijos de 12 y 6 años de edad. Él es un hombre emprendedor que desde hace 18 años se gana la vida vendiendo tostadas de yuca, plátano y papas. Dicha venta la realiza de manera ambulante. Wilber desea colocar lámina nueva en la vivienda que está construyendo ya que por el momento le ha colocado lámina deteriorada por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada para cambiar el techo de su vivienda,
texts.en:
Wilber, 34 years old, lives with his two children, who are 6 and 12 years old.  He is an enterprising man who has earned his living for the past 18 years selling tostadas made of yucca, plantain and potatoes.   He makes his sales as a street vendor.  

Wilber wants to place new laminated sheets in the home he is building since for the moment he has had to use some in bad condition.   He is asking for a loan from FUSAI  to buy galvanized metal sheeting to replace the roof of his home.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheeting to replace the roof of his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes and bags for resale

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: María de 30 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos una niña de 11 años y un varón de 6 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos, su compañero de vida presta sus servicios de seguridad y gracias a ello aporta a la economía familiar. María desea construir su vivienda ya que actualmente vive en un cuarto hecho de lámina junto a su familia lo que le provoca inseguridad es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, ladrillo, arena, grava y hierro, además deberá pagar mano de obra para la construcción de su vivienda
texts.en: María is 30 years old. She lives with her life partner and her two children: an 11-year-old daughter and a 6-year-old son. She is an enterprising woman who makes a living as a domestic employee. Her life partner works as a security guard and as a result, he contributes to the household finances. María wants to build a house since she currently lives with her family in a room made of metal sheets, which causes insecurity. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from Fusai to buy cement, bricks, sand, gravel, and iron. She will also have to pay for labor to build the house.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand, gravel, and iron and to pay for labor to build her house.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Hello! Joshua, 49 years of age, is very hardworking, energetic, and visionary. He hails from the Nyamira area of Kenya, one of the best places on earth to do farming. He has a family and is blessed with seven lovely children, whom he really loves and adores. Joshua is a very dedicated farmer who farms with a lot of passion and has been practicing farming for the past 20 years. Having done farming for almost half of his life, he boasts a wealth of experience and is touted as one of the best farmers in his village.

Joshua loves dairy farming and has even nicknamed one of the dairy cows "nyaburati." Although Joshua makes so much money through milk selling, he faces a challenge of not having a good dairy unit where he can comfortably milk his cows and where his cows can rest. Because of this, he has been facing losses.

Poor weather condition have been affecting his cows and Joshua has been spending so much money on medicine. Also, there has been a low production of milk. But, through this loan Joshua will be able to save more money, that was used for medicine, and also his cow will produce the maximum amount of milk.
The dairy unit will be beneficial because Joshua will be able to collect cow dung that he will use in his farm, hence increasing productivity and also aiding in plastering his mud hut. Because of increased productivity and fertility of the land, he is going to make more money and hence improve living conditions.

loans.use: to build a dairy unit

loans.name: Esha

texts.en:
Esha has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She is grateful for the previous loan that helped her to boost her business.

Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she thanks Yehu and Kiva at large.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour

loans.name: Moneer

texts.en:
This is Moneer, who is 22 years old. He is a single man, living with his family in Dhamar, Yemen. 

Moneer is a very ambitious and dynamic young man. In order to improve the living standards of his family, Moneer decided to start his own business. 

In 2010, Moneer started the first step of his business. With financial support from his father and some of his friends, Moneer was able to open a call center. In order to improve his center, Moneer also sells phones, phone accessories, and phone card recharges because he realizes this business will be profitable due to a new settlement area. His business is located in a good area of town and his main customers are the public. He works 6 days a week and 15 hours a day. 

Moneer wants to improve his business more. Unfortunately, he doesn't have enough money to do that. As a result, he applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more phones, accessories, and phone card recharges for his center to strengthen his business more. He hopes that this loan will increase his stock, result in more customers, and earn higher profits.

In the future, Moneer plans to get a bigger center to supply larger quantities of goods.

loans.use: to purchase more phones, accessories and phone card recharges.

loans.name: Baha Eddien

texts.en:
Baha Eddien is a 21-year-old, single young man from a small village near Jenin. Baha works with his family on the agricultural land they own. They plant seasonal crops and resell them in the local market. 

Baha took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy a small car to transfer his crops to the local market. By taking this loan, Baha will be able to improve his business and also his income. 

Baha appears in the photo while he was working

loans.use: to buy a small car in order to transfer his crops to the local market

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married with four children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a broom-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of getting raw materials for use in making brooms, for which she has to travel far to go and buy. 

With the 35,000 KES she wants to purchase a stock of raw materials for making brooms as final goods for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase a stock of raw materials for making brooms as final goods for sale

loans.name: Agus

texts.en:
Agus runs a small stall, which sells phone accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Agus lives in Cianjur, a rural area about 4 hours from Jakarta.  Agus is married and living with four people in the family home. His wife is a housewife.

Agus begin working with Ruma because he wants to explore his business more. He feels really excited to expand his only business selling mobile phone and airtime credits as his only and major source of income for the family. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan in order to do more transactions.

loans.use: to process more airtime and bill payment transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Nilima

texts.en:
Nilima is 48 years old and a rural housewife.  She has a secondary education.  She is married to Rajanikanta, who is 52 years old and works as a home guard. He also passed 10th grade.  They are rearing three sons, who are grown up now but were deprived of education due to their parents' poverty. They did not get any jobs and are themselves engaged in agricultural activities. They live in the small village Khagrabari of Maynaguri town in Jalpaiguri district in their own house.

The total income of Nilima's husband and sons cannot cover the expenses of such a big family. Their expenses are increasing day by day, and they cannot earn much more because there are too many competitors in their area and they lack money to invest in their business. They want to cultivate tea plants.  It is a profitable crop, and the climate and soil of their area is most suitable for tea cultivation.

Nilima is asking for financial help from Kiva's partner Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS) to purchase tea saplings and manure to start tea cultivation.  She hopes that with this loan she will get over the financial hurdles which they are facing now and will earn more money to give the family financial sustainability. She thanks her Kiva lenders and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase tea saplings for starting a tea-planting business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy: shirts, pants, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, beans, chicken, cheese, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Kiran Bala

texts.en:
Kiran, 40 years old, is a hardworking housewife from the small town of Mayanaguri in Jaipaiguri District. She is illiterate, but just knows how to sign her name. She lives with her husband and two sons. Both are deprived of education due to their parents' poor economic resources. Now they are grown up and are engaged in their father's business.

Kiran's husband Krishnadeb, 42 years old, is involved in a business of painting colors on houses, and Kiran looks after her household and her husband and sons. Their sons are also engaged in this business. They paint colors on the houses of their locality, and they are famous for their efficiency in this field. Being the only source of income for the family, they strive hard to make the business successful. 

The business is a lucrative one and profitable, too. But the main challenge is capital. As they have an insufficient amount of capital, they can't invest much in the business and as a result, their earnings are not enough to cover the family's expenses. To increase the stock, she needs a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). After getting the loan, she wants to purchase branded colors and other tools, such as brushes, paint rollers, paint tray, etc.   

Her future dream is to develop this trade on a large scale, so they can earn much profit and cover the family’s expenses smoothly. 

Both of them are thankful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase colors and other necessary tools for her husband's house painting business.

loans.name: Sandhyarani

texts.en:
Sandhyarani is from Maynaguri. She is a strong, hardworking mother of one son. The 49-year-old woman is a well-known dairy farmer. She is married to Kshitish (aged 60 years), a fish seller by profession. Both are illiterate and can sign their names only. They are raising their only son, who is about to complete his graduation. They live in Mouyamari, a small village in Maynaguri.

Sandhyarani has been rearing animals for many years and developed a passion for dairy farming. To generate income, she sells dairy products from her farm, such as milk and milk products (butter, paneer, and curd), at the local market. 

Sandhyarani is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase a quality dairy cow. The cow breed she is going for produces more milk per day. Milk and milk products sold from this cow will provide Sandhyarani with a sufficient income to provide a decent lifestyle. Income from milk sales is preferable to a farmer like her, since it comes regularly. 

Sandhyarani's extra income that she will generate from the dairy cow will satisfy her family’s needs. Her first preference is her son's education. She wants to provide better education to their only son for his bright future.

She is thanking Kiva and BJS for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her animal husbandry.

loans.name: Purnima

texts.en:
Purnima is a 21-year-old married woman raising one son with her husband, Paresh. They are from a small village, Mouyamari, of Maynaguri in the district Jalpaiguri. She possesses a primary education, while her husband, aged 41 years, has an education up to grade eight. Their son is a mere child. They have a small kachha house (made of straw, bamboo and mud).

Purnima's husband is associated in a small business, which provides an inconsistent income. Purnima works in an animal husbandry, which she began a few years ago, that serves as a major source of income for the family. But, they need more money to give financial sustenance to their family.

Purnima came to know about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and has taken a loan from them to purchase a cow and start a new business of milk supply and making dairy products such as paneer (cottage cheese), butter and curd, which are in great demand in the present market.  She will sell her products to her neighbors.  She hopes to get an increase in the production of milk, which, ultimately, helps in generating more cash.

She dreams of giving better education to her son, overcoming the financial hurdles and purchasing more cows with the profit generated from her business, and making a cattle herd.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to start a business of selling milk and milk products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of fish to sell.

loans.name: Ayrton Maximo

texts.es:
Ayrton vive con sus padres en el populoso distrito de Carabayllo, en Lima, capital de Perú. Su padre es técnico soldador y trabaja eventualmente como obrero en Pucallpa, selva peruana. Su madre se dedica a la venta de pescado en un mercado de su localidad.
Ayrton es el menor de los hermanos y esta actualmente cursando su ultimo semestre académico con lo que estará graduándose a fines de año. El a seguido la misma carrera de su padre, soldador estructural. El estuvo realizando practicas pre-profesionales donde ganaba el sueldo mínimo y ayudaba con esto a casa ademas de pagarse sus estudios.
Actualmente su familia atraviesa por una grave crisis económica debido a que su padre actualmente no tiene trabajo y su madre se encuentra delicada de salud, esto sumado a que sus practicas concluyeron hace 2 meses, han hecho que la continuidad de sus estudios corran peligro y es muy posible que tenga que dejarlos de no contar con el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva.
El desea que por favor lo apoyen para pagar su ultimo semestre y así pueda concluir exitosamente los estudios que con tanto esfuerzo a podido cursar hasta hoy, por lo que agradece de antemano cualquier apoyo que le pudiesen brindar para lograrlo.
Ayrton desea culminar sus estudios para comenzar pronto a trabajar y así poder ayudar a sus padres y salir adelante todos juntos.
texts.en:
Ayrton lives with his parents in the crowded district of Carabayllo in the Peruvian capital, Lima. His father is a welding technician and works sporadically in Pucallpa in the Peruvian jungle. Ayrton's mother sells fish in a market in Carabayllo. 

Ayrton is the youngest child in his family. He is currently in the last semester of school and will graduate at the end of this year. He is following the same path as his father, studying structural welding. He recently finished an internship, which paid him the minimum wage, and used his earnings to pay for his studies. 

Ayrton's family is now facing serious financial problems as his father is currently out of work and his mother is in fragile health. Ayrton's internship ended two months ago, so he no longer earns that modest wage. With both parents unable to work and earn anything, Ayrton is facing the possibility of having to abandon his studies. The support of Kiva lenders, however, would make it possible for him to graduate. Ayrton is asking for your support in order to pay for his last semester and finish his program successfully. He's invested a great deal of effort to get this far, and would like to thank lenders in advance for any support they can provide and help him graduate. 

Ayrton hopes to finish his program and begin working immediately so that he can help his parents. The three of them can then face the future.

loans.use: to cover the cost of his last term in school.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies for the care and maintenance of her cucumber crop.

loans.name: Rumpa

texts.en:
Rumpa is a 36-year-old married woman, living in the village of Anandanagar at Maynaguri in Jalpaiguri district. She is the mother of a daughter who reads in grade two. Rumpa studied until grade nine, and her parents could not provide further education. Her husband is a small businessman, aged 40 years, who completed the higher secondary standard education.

Rumpa runs a small business to sell ladies' ready-made garments at home. She purchases garments from markets at a low price and sells them for a profit. The ladies of her area like her garment collection and selections. The demand for garments has increased because the summer weather has started, and people demand seasonal garments.

Her husband's income hardly covers all the expenses, and so her earnings play an important role in the family’s source of income. To strengthen her business, she has requested a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to buy more garments to meet the demand.

Rumpa wishes for a bright future for her daughter, and her dream is to provide better education in a renowned school and all facilities to her. She is very thankful to Kiva and the field partner, BJS.

loans.use: to purchase ready-made garments for her business.

loans.name: Las San Pablistas Group

texts.es:
Balvina (de blusa verde en la fotografía) tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos,  dos de ellos ya tienen familias diferentes, el tercero vive con ella e estudia primero básico en un colegio de su comunidad y todos ellos viven en Suchitepéquez.

La actividad principal que realizan es la venta de tortillas ya que es una buena actividad para tener un ingreso económico para poder satisfacer las necesidades de su familia, la segunda actividad que realiza doña Balvina es la venta de enchiladas en su comunidad para satisfacer las necesidades de las personas  que habitan por el lugar.

Los fines con que ella desea realizar un préstamo, es para  la ampliación de la venta de tortillas que ella tiene para así poder tener mejores ingresos económico para poder satisfacer las necesidades de su familia. 

En conjunto con un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras  que desean salir adelante decidieron formar parte del grupo de doña Balvina para tener un futuro mejor y de sus familias.

 Una de las más grandes aspiraciones de ella es ver que su hijo se convierta en un profesional en su comunidad y que tenga una vida mejor y un futuro de éxito.

alvina tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos,  dos de ellos ya tienen familias diferentes, el tercero vive con ella e estudia primero básico en un colegio de su comunidad y todos ellos viven en Suchitepéquez.

La actividad principal que realizan es la venta de tortillas ya que es una buena actividad para tener un ingreso económico para poder satisfacer las necesidades de su familia, la segunda actividad que realiza doña Balvina es la venta de enchiladas en su comunidad para satisfacer las necesidades de las personas  que habitan por el lugar.

Los fines con que ella desea realizar un préstamo, es para  la ampliación de la venta de tortillas que ella tiene para así poder tener mejores ingresos económico para poder satisfacer las necesidades de su familia.
