En conjunto con un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras  que desean salir adelante decidieron formar parte del grupo de doña Balvina para tener un futuro mejor y de sus familias.

 Una de las más grandes aspiraciones de ella es ver que su hijo se convierta en un profesional en su comunidad y que tenga una vida mejor y un futuro de éxito.
texts.en:
Balvina (wearing the green blouse in the photograph) is 45 years old. She is married and has three children, two of whom already have their own families. The third lives with her and attends primary school in the community. All of them live in Suchitepéquez.

Her principal business is the sale of tortillas, since it is a good business in order to have income to be able the satisfy the needs of her family. Doña Balvina's  second business is selling enchiladas in her community to satisfy the needs of the people who live in that place.

The goals that she wants to realize with this loan are to expand her tortilla sales so that she thus has better income to be able to meet the needs of her family.

Along with a group of entrepreneurial women who wanted to advance, they decided to form part of Doña Balvina's group in order to have a better future for themselves and their families.

One of her greatest aspirations is to see her son become a professional in their community and to have a better life and a successful future.

loans.use: to expand her tortilla sales

loans.name: Saradini

texts.en:
Saradini is 46 years old and a widow who hails from Dhupguri. Her family comprises her two children (one son and two daughters). Her daughter is a student of grade ten. They live in a small village, Baroghoria, in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is an illiterate woman who can only sign her name.

After her husband's sudden death, Saradini's son was compelled to become involved in their family business of cultivating seasonal vegetables. Saradini looks after her children and manages household work and simultaneously helps her son in his agricultural activities. She carries the vegetables to the local market for sale. She and her son have been in this activity for quite a few years and gained experience about cultivation. Their present income is insufficient for their family’s expenses. So, she and her son have decided to grow paddy, which is a profitable crop for cultivation, on their farmland, but she faces problems of limited capital.

For that reason, Saradini is asking for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase agricultural inputs such as paddy seeds, manure etc. She wants to start cultivation as soon as possible, preferably in this rainy season, and hopes to earn good revenue to give a healthy living to her children. In the future, she wants to purchase a plot of land with the profit generated from this business. 

She conveys her hearty thanks to her generous lenders, BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase paddy seeds and fertilizers for cultivating paddy.

loans.name: G.s Luchando Por La Vida Group

texts.es:
La señora Vilma es una mujer  emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio propio que es venta de productos por catálogo Avon y Arabela desde hace 5  años, este negocio lo atiende de forma ambulante contando con los clientes principales del municipio y otras personas que viven en diferentes aldeas.
Doña Vilma también atiende este negocio en su casa de habitación,  muy conocida en el municipio y es por eso que llegan hasta su casa para comprar el producto, también cuenta con la venta de granos básicos maíz y frijoles, necesita el préstamo para la compra de lociones, perfumes, cremas, champo, talcos, maíz y frijoles para su segundo negocio. Y con esta inversión espera tener la mercadería necesaria para satisfacer a sus clientes y lograr obtener las ganancias necesarias para mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia, está solicitando el préstamo de manera grupal con sus compañeras quienes al igual que ella esperan que esta inversión les sea de mucha ayuda a sus negocios.
Doña Teodora se dedica a la venta de ropa americana mixta desde hace 2 años.
Doña Francis se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 2 años.
Doña Edith se dedica a la venta de abarrotería desde hace 2 años.

Danlí, Honduras – Julio 2014
texts.en:
Señora Vilma is an enterprising woman who dedicates herself to her business selling Avon y Arabela products via catalogue, which she has had for five years. This is a mobile business and her main customers are from her town and surrounding villages. Vilma also has her business in her home, which is very well known in the town, which is why people go to her house to buy her products. She also sells basic grains sch as corn and beans.

She needs the loan to buy to buy lotions, perfume, creams, shampoo, talc, corn and beans for her second business. With this investment, she hopes to have the goods she needs to satisfy her customers  and obtain the income she needs to improve her and her family's quality of life a little. 

She is requesting the loan in a group with her fellow members, who, like her, hope that this investment helps them a lot with their businesses. Teodora has made a living selling mixed second-hand clothing for two years, Francis has made a living selling fruits and vegetables for two years, and Edith has made a living selling groceries for two years

Danlí, Honduras – July 2014

loans.use: to buy lotions, perfume, creams, shampoo, talc, corn and beans for her business.

loans.name: Sandra Del Carmen

texts.es: Sandra de 31 años de edad vive con su compañero. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de fruta partida, bebidas, dulces, etc. en diferentes puntos de recreación. Sandra desea pagar derecho de energía eléctrica y su posterior instalación, para la cual necesitara comprar materiales es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: alambre, interruptores, tubos, etc. Además deberá pagar derecho de instalación y mano de obra necesaria para la instalación de energía eléctrica en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sandra, aged 31, lives with her partner. She is a hard-working woman, who for two years has been making a living selling sliced fruit, beverages, candy, and the like at different recreation spots. 

Sandra wishes to pay for electricity fees and the subsequent electrical installation, for which she will need to buy materials. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to FUSAI to buy wire, switches, conduits, and the like. Moreover, she will need to pay for the installation fees and the labour needed to install the electrical wiring in her home.

loans.use: to buy wire, switches, conduits, and the like. Moreover, she will need to pay for the electrical installation in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new iron and a table for her business.

loans.name: Mampi

texts.en:
Mampi is a 24-year-old woman who attended high school but did not finish, and studied until grade seven. She is the mother of two children (one son and one daughter) who are too young for school. She is married to Malay, who is a 30-year-old farmer. They live in West Magurmari, a remote village in Dhupguri.

Mampi is a housewife, but the source of income for their family is agribusiness, which her husband has been doing for many years. With much work and sacrifice, he has bought a piece of land. He mainly grows paddy, which is a crop having much demand in the region. He works tirelessly to earn better for his family, but can't earn more. Due to the shortage of capital, he is unable to expand his agribusiness.

Mampi is asking for financial help from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy fertilizers and seeds to improve the yield from her farm. Her goals are to be able to give her children the opportunity to study further and have smoothness in life, to buy more land to enlarge her business, and also to strengthen her family economy. She aspires to purchase another piece of land for more cultivation.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to start her paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inputs and certified corn seeds.

loans.name: Yhon

texts.es:
Yhon es oriundo de Moquegua, departamento ubicado en la sierra del Perú, y vino a Lima con sus padres por motivos de estudio y trabajo.
Actualmente vive con sus padres y su hermana menor. Su padre es obrero en una fabrica y gana el salario mínimo.
Yhon estuvo estudiando en Arequipa, departamento cerca a su natal Moquegua, sin embargo por lo mencionado inicialmente tuvo que dejar sus estudios.
Al llegar a la capital estuvo trabajando para ayudar a su familia y ahorrar para poder iniciar sus estudios y así logro postular, ingresar y matricularse en la carrera de Ingeniería Electrónica, carrera que estuvo costeando con su trabajo a medio tiempo, pero al pasar al segundo semestre por cruce del horario con sus horas de trabajo tuvo que dejarlo y ahora no cuenta con los recursos económicos suficientes para poder continuar con sus estudios, por lo que le sera imposible seguir con su carrera de no contar con el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva.
El vino a la capital para estudiar y salir adelante, ese es su sueño, tener una carrera y poder ayudar a sus padres y hermanita, por esto es que esta muy agradecido con la oportunidad que pueden brindarle los prestamistas de Kivas, gracias al financiamiento de sus estudios, de terminar su carrera y ser profesional.
texts.en:
Yhon is originally from Moquegua, a department located in the mountains of Peru, and he came to Lima with his parents for reasons of education and work.

He now lives with his parents and his younger sister. His father is a factory worker and earns the minimum wage.

Yhon was studying in Arequipa, a department close to his birthplace of Moquegua. Nevertheless, for the reason mentioned initially, he had to leave his studies. On arriving in the capital, he was working to help his family and to save to be able to begin his studies, and thus he managed to apply, enter, and register in the course in Electronic Engineering, a course that he was covering with his half-time work. But on passing to the second semester, due to a scheduling conflict with his work hours, he had to leave it [his job], and now he doesn't have sufficient economic resources to be able to continue with his studies. For this reason, it will be impossible for him to continue with his studies without the help of the Kiva lenders.

He came to the capital to study and advance. This is his dream, to have a career and be able to help his parents and little sister. For this reason, he is very grateful for the opportunity that the Kiva lenders can offer him, thanks to the financing of his studies, to finish his course and be a professional.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition for a technical degree in Electronic Engineering

loans.name: G.s Bendicion De Dios Group

texts.es:
La señora Ramona es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio que es la venta abarrotería en general,  esta actividad la realiza desde hace 3 años, tiene su negocio ubicado en su casa de habitación, atiende personalmente a sus clientes de lunes a domingo y son las personas que viven en su mismo barrio.
Doña Ramona su negocio le ayuda de gran manera, ya que las ganancias le sirven para cubrir parte de sus gastos personales y de igual manera le ha ayudado a mejorar su nivel de vida familiar, nos está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de producto como maíz, frijoles, azúcar, arroz, queso, aceite, huevos, galletas, etc. y así poder obtener más ganancias que le permitan mejorar salir adelante en su negocio y con su familia, solicita el préstamo de manera grupal.
Don Carlos se dedica al comercio sus ingresos los obtiene de su negocio, venta de comida actividad que realiza junto a su familia, desde hace 3 años.
Doña María se dedica al comercio sus ingresos los obtiene de su negocio, venta de abarrotería,  actividad que realiza desde hace 8 años.
Don Milton se dedica al comercio sus ingresos los obtiene de su negocio, venta de mínimos, plátanos, actividad que realiza desde hace 3 años. Todos ellos no cuentan con el capital suficiente para surtir sus respectivos negocios.


Danlí, Honduras – Junio  2014
texts.en:
Ramona is an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her business which is selling groceries in general. She has been doing this for 3 years. Her business is located in her house. She attends to her clients in person from Monday through Sunday and her clients are the people who live in her neighborhood.

Ramona's business helps her in a big way as the profits pay part of her personal expenses and at the same time help to improve the family's standard of living. She is requesting the loan to buy corn, beans, sugar, rice, cheese, oil, eggs, biscuits, etc. and be able to make more profit which would allow her to progress with her business and her family.

This is a group loan. Carlos works in his business selling meals which he has done with his family for 3 years. María works in her business selling groceries which she has done for 8 years. Milton works selling bananas and plantains which he has done for 3 years. None of them have enough capital to stock their businesses.

Danlí, Honduras – June 2014

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, sugar, rice, cheese, oil, eggs, biscuits, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Amitie Group

texts.fr:
Les 2 membres du groupe AMITIE sont 1homme marié et 1 femme mariée ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des familles traditionnelles à FOH une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Il, elle  collabore avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Il, elle est à leur deuxième prêt de production de maïs avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de maïs  avec monsieur FOUSSEYNI debout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme et de femme AMITIE. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter  16 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 20 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  320 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part de contribuer  les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: The two members of the Amitie Group are a married man and a married women, with an average age of 38 and an average of five children each. They live within traditional family frameworks in Foh, a village found in Sikasso Cercle, the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution so that they can see through their agricultural activities during the winter period. This is their second loan with Soro Yiriwaso, with their previous loan paid back in full. Fousseyni, the man standing to the right of the photo, grows corn. With this loan, he is planning on purchasing 16 50-kg sacks of fertiliser and 20 containers of different herbicides, as well as paying for the labour costs to maintain two hectares of land. After the harvest, the produce will be sold on a village level and throughout Sikasso to a customer base made up of both men and women in exchange for cash and credit. He is planning on making a profit of 320,000 FCFA with each harvest, which will allow him to pay off the loan and contribute towards his family's daily living expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labour costs and fertiliser

loans.name: Gaby Nataly

texts.es:
Gaby Nataly tiene 30 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, con su menor hijo de 10 años de edad el cual cursa primaria en colegio nacional del distrito de Pucara - Jaén - Cajamarca - Perú Ella vive 30 años en el mensionado caserio, situado en la parte rural de este distrito contando con servicios de agua y luz.

La actividad que realiza es el transporte de pasajeros por mototaxi, cuenta con unidad propia, ademas se dedica a la venta de patos contando con clientela propia de la zona. El destino del crédito será para invertir en la compra de animales menores, y compra de un carrito salchipollero, ello le generara mayores ingresos y así podrá mejorar su calidad de vida. Para este rubro no hay mayores competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios.
texts.en:
Gaby Nataly is 30 years old. She lives in her own house, which is made of rustic materials, with her young 10-year-old son, who is in a primary grade in the national school of the district of Pucara, Jaén, Cajamarca, Peru. She has lived in this village for 30 years. It is located in a rural part of this district, which was water and electrical service.

Her business is transporting passengers by mototaxi. She has her own vehicle. In addition, she sells ducks, having her own clientele in the zone.

The purpose of the loan will be to invest in the purchase of small animals and the purchase of a salchipollero cart [a cart where salchipollos -- a chicken, sausage, and French fry dish -- are made and sold]. This will generate greater income for her and thus she will be able to improve their quality of life.

For this business, there are no larger competitors in this zone, and with this she will obtain better prices.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of small animals and a salchipollero cart in order to increase her income and thus improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Universitario Group

texts.es:
Melina es una mujer de 38 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene tres hijos y se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir.
Ella es emprendedora, luchadora, activa, inquieta, atenta, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora (de pie al centro, blusa a rayas). Su inquietud por lograr sus sueños la ha llevado a formar una banca de personas para solicitar un préstamo y cumplir sus metas. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio Universitario situado al sur de la ciudad.
Melina es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, estatura mediana. Su rutina diaria comienza con el diseño del modelo de la prenda para elaborar un molde de cartón, para luego extender la tela y colocar encima los moldes y remarcar con tizas de colores. Luego procede a cortar la tela utilizando una tijera, une las piezas y las cose a máquina o a mano, para darle el acabado continúa con los ojales y botones. Termina la prenda dándole el planchado para tener una superficie impecable. Esta rutina la realiza todos los días de la semana.
Ella desea expandir su negocio realizando la compra de tela por mayor para abaratar costos, su sueño es tener una tienda de ropa. Melina quiere mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
Es por esos motivos que Melina solicita un préstamo para la compra de tela por mayor y con los beneficios darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Melina is a 38 year-old woman who lives with her partner.  She has 3 children, and she works as a dressmaker.  She is an enterprising, tenacious, active, restless, thoughtful, kind, responsible, and very hardworking person (she is standing in the center of the photograph wearing a striped blouse).  Her impatience to achieve her dreams has led her to form a communal bank with other people so that she can request a loan and accomplish her goals.  She does her business in the Universitario neighborhood, located in the southern part of the city.  

Melina has a dark complexion, long dark hair, and is medium height.  Her daily routine starts with the design model of a garment made out of cardboard, which she covers with fabric and marks with colored chalk.  Later she proceeds to cut the fabric using scissors.  She puts the pieces together and sews them by machine or hand, and then puts the finishing touches on with buttonholes and buttons.  She finishes the garment by ironing it to give it a flawless surface.  This is her routine, which she carries out every day of the week.

Melina wants to expand her business by purchasing fabric at wholesale to lower her costs.  Her dream is to have a clothing store.  Melina wants to improve her family's quality of life and give her children a better future.

This is why Melina is requesting a loan to buy fabric at wholesale.  With her profits, she will give her children a better future.

loans.use: to buy fabric at wholesale

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For the past eight years, she has operated a mat-weaving sales business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding and establishing a poultry business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase paints and sewing materials. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase paints and sewing materials.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa María tiene 46 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo e hijos, en casa propia, en una comunidad grande en la zona rural de Cayalti y goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos. Ha tenido 5 prestamos con nuestra institución, los cuales han sido pagados puntualmete, el ultimo fue de s/ 1,000.00.

La señora se dedica a la actividad de venta de abarrotes en general, en su propio domicilio, desde hace más de 8 años de antigüedad en el negocio; y solicita este préstamo para la compra de mercadería como arroz, azúcar, aceites, etc. Ya que desea hacer crecer más su negocio, para poder obtener más ingresos y asi poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa María is 46 years old and married. She lives with her husband and children in their own house, in a large community in the rural area of Cayalti. She enjoys good personal and work references from her neighbors.

She has had five loans with our institution, which have been paid punctually. The last one was for 1,000 Peruvian new soles.

She earns her living selling general groceries in her own home, with more than eight years in business. She's seeking this loan to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, oils, etc. She wants to grow her business more to be able to earn better income and thus improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of merchandise, such as rice, sugar, oils, etc.

loans.name: Las Maxanijanil Group

texts.es:
Antonia (es la de segunda a partir de la izquierda con güipil gris con flores) tiene 29 años de edad, es soltera y tiene tres hijos, el hijo de 12 años es estudiante de un instituto de la comunidad, el segundo hijo tiene 9 años y estudia en una escuela que queda cerca de la comunidad y el tercero tiene 6 años y es estudiante de párvulo de  la misma escuela de la comunidad donde ellos viven.
	
La actividad principal que le ha venido abriendo campos a doña Antonia  en el área del comercio es la compra venta de berros y verduras en su comunidad donde ella vive, la actividad que ella realiza lo ha venido haciendo desde hace 6 años, porque por esa actividad que ella realiza puede obtener recursos económicos para sustentar a su familia.

El fin principal con que desea realizar el crédito es para la compra de 20 bultos de berros para luego a su respectiva venta en su comunidad a las personas que lo requieren y así mismo que le genere un ingreso económico.

En conjunto con un grupo de mujeres que tiene visión en el futuro se juntaron con doña Antonia para realizar dicho crédito con el propósito de poder superar en la vida.

 Uno de los más grandes sueños es obtener ganancias para poder compra más terrenos para poder cultivar la tierra para obtener un ingreso económico en el beneficio de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Antonia (is the second from the left wearing the grey traditional blouse with flowers) is 29 years old, single and has three children. Her son is 12 and studies in a school in the community, her second son is 9 and studies in school close to their community. The third son is 6 years old and is a preschool student at the same school in their community.

The main commercial activity which is opening roads for Antonia is the business of buying and selling watercress and vegetables in the community where she lives. She has been doing this for 6 years as through this activity she can obtain the resources she needs to sustain her family. The end reason she wants to get the loan is to buy 20 bundles of watercress to later sell in her community to people who need it which will generate economic income.

A group of women who have a plan for their future have joined together with Antonia to make this loan with the aim of improving their lives. One of the greatest dreams is to buy more land to be able to cultivate the land to obtain economic revenues for the benefit of their community.

loans.use: to buy watercress and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, beans, coffee, bread, milk, eggs, cheese, flour, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is married with three school-going children. They live in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

Tabu has operated a clothes selling business for the past two years. She sells in a shop to town dwellers, passersby, and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. With her KES 20,000 loan she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes such as lappa, blouses, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Kajumwa

texts.en:
Kajumwa is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For the past eight years, she has operated a mat weaving business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding and establishing a poultry business in the future. With the loan that she is requesting, Kajumwa wants to purchase paints and weaving materials. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase paints and weaving materials

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam appreciates the previous loan that helped her expand her business.

She operates a kerosene business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a rental house in the near future. 

With the 10,000 KES she wants to purchase gallons of kerosene. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of kerosene

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married with six children. She buys, packages, and sells hardwood charcoal. At first she used to buy the charcoal already packaged, but she was able to expand her storage area and she can now store up to 40 sacks of charcoal. She buys bags and polyurethane, packages the charcoal, and sells it to small businesses in the zone. 

Margaret needs this loan to buy charcoal because she is increasing her number of customers and needs to increase her amount of charcoal to meet their demands. Her greatest desire is to provide an education for her children, who attend school, so that she can guarantee them a prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is from Talin town where she lives with her husband. Their sons are living and working in neighbouring countries as migrant workers. Time after time they support their family financially.

Rita and her husband run a farm. It includes piglets and chickens as well as an orchard where different types of fruit trees are grown (apricot, peach, cherry, nut and plum).  Rita's husband sells the gathered harvest in the local market and earns income for covering daily costs. 

Rita has requested this loan of 1,500 USD to purchase 5 pigs and forage for feeding the livestock. The loan will help this couple to gather more income and make their life better.

loans.use: to pay for 5 pigs and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married woman with five children all under her care. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Kwekwe wants to start a vegetable and fruit selling business. Her major goal is to become a leading fruit vending business in the area to raise her profits.

For that reason, with the 35,000 KES she wants to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruit such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaw. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruit such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaw

loans.name: Luara

texts.en:
Luara is from Qaradzor village, where she lives with her husband and two sons. Luara's husband and son are herdsmen of the village. Luara herself takes care of their own farm. She keeps cows, calves and chickens, as well as wheat and some fruit trees. By means of this activity, she earns acceptable income that helps her support the family. 

The requested loan of USD 2,000 is very important for Luara to purchase agro machinery for transporting the gathered harvest to the market. Please help this hardworking woman to enlarge her farm and make it profitable.

loans.use: to purchase agro machinery for transporting the gathered harvest to the market.

loans.name: Yasmhin Gladys

texts.es:
Yasmhin vive en el populoso distrito de Comas, en Lima, capital del Perú, junto a sus padres y hermana mayor.
Su padre hace transporte publico de pasajeros en su mototaxi y su madre no labora, por lo que el dinero no alcanza y tanto ella como su hermana han que tenido que trabajar desde muy corta edad para poder ayudar en los gastos del hogar.
Yasmhin trabaja actualmente desde hace un mes a medio tiempo en una empresa textil, en el área de laboratorio y espera seguir trabajando a tiempo completo en la misma, ya que ella esta a punto de concluir sus estudios en Química textil y graduarse a fines del presente año.
Ella se a pagado sus estudios hasta este momento, pero lamentablemente problemas economicos en casa debido a que su hermana esta actualmente sin trabajo hacen que todo el dinero que gana vaya destinado a los gastos del hogar por lo que no cuenta con los recursos suficientes para poder pagar su ultimo ciclo de estudios con lo que no lograra graduarse de no contar con el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva.
Ella quiere decirles que la ayuden a terminar su carrera, que esta apenas a meses de concluirla y que sera muy cumplida en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que entiende que con ese dinero se ayudara a jóvenes como ella a culminar también sus estudios.
Yasmhin agradece de antemano el apoyo que puedan brindarle los prestamistas de Kiva para este ultimo impulso en su carrera a ser profesional.
texts.en:
Yasmhin lives in the heavily populated district of Comas, in Lima, the capital of Perú. She lives with her parents and older sister. Her father runs a moto-taxi transportation service, and her mother does not work. Because of this, they don't have enough money so, in order to help with household expenses, Yasmhin and her sister have had to work since they were very young.

For the past month and a half, Yasmhin has been working in the laboratory department of a textile companyf, and she hopes to continue working full-time for the same company since she is about to finish her studies in textile chemistry and graduate at the end of the year.

She has been able to pay her tuition until now, but unfortunately her sister is currently without work which has caused money problems at home and means that everything that Yasmhin earns goes to household expenses. She does not have sufficient income to pay for her last term, so she would not be able to graduate if it were not for the support of Kiva lenders. She wishes to communicate that they are helping her finish her schooling and that she is just months away from doing so; also that she will be very punctual in the repayment of her loan because she understands that her repayments will also help other young people finish their studies. Yasmhin is grateful in advance for the support that the Kiva lenders can offer her for this final push in her path to becoming a professional.

loans.use: to pay for her final semester of school and to graduate.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Madame MARIAM est née en juin 1967 à BAMAKO, mère de 4 enfants, elle réside avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une famille traditionnelle à SANOUBOUGOU I un quartier populaire dans la ville de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Cette brave femme après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, Madame MARIAM s’est initiée très vite des activités d’achat et de vente des habillements pour les femmes, mèches, pommade.
Elle est à son cinquième prêt  individuel commerçant avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Elle s’approvisionne à BOBO DIOULASSO dans la république de BURKINA FASO.  
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 40 complets de marque différente pour les femmes,  3 cartons de mèche, 2 cartons de pommade pour la revendre au marché à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 65 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariam was born in June 1967 in Bamako. She is the mother of four and lives with her husband and children in a traiditonal family in Sanoubougou I, a working-class neighborhood in the city of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. This persistent woman has tried a number of business activities without success before launching a business buying and reselling women's clothing, hair extension, ointments, etc.

 Mrs. Mariam is on her fifth individual entrepreneur's loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. Her goal is to better meet the expectations of her growing clientele. Her prior loans have been duly repaid. She stocks up in Bobo Ioulasso, in Burkina Faso.

This loan will allow her to buy 40 women's outfits of various brands, three boxes of hair extensions and two boxes of ointments in order to resell these goods at the market to a mixed clientele, for cash and on credit. She plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 65,000 West African francs, which  will allow her to pay off her loan with interest and reinvest the rest in her business.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing, hair extension, ointments, etc.

loans.name: Mgeni

texts.en:
Mgeni is a married woman with seven children all under her care. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mgeni wants to start a vegetable and fruit selling business. Her major goal is to become a leading fruit vending business in the area to raise her profits. For that reason, with her KES 20,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaw. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons, and pawpaw

loans.name: Malack

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Malack, a 34-year-old man who lives with his spouse and their child in the Nyamira area of Kenya, an area with wonderful weather patterns. 

Malack is very hard working and has fought to raise his child and his family alone since his wife does not have a job. He practices mixed farming (that is, crop and dairy farming) and has been able to sell the fruits of his labour to the markets within his area. Malack has been farming for the last 6 years and through all these years he has gathered so much experience.  All farming techniques are at his “fingertips”.

Although Malack has been making profits, he has a challenge irrigating his farm during dry spells and sometimes he suffers loses, so that is why he is kindly seeking a loan to buy a water tank. The Nyamira area has no piped water, so through the loan he will be able to harvest rain water to be used by the family for home consumption, hence reducing the time spent going to look for water. The water tank will be of much help because Malack will be able to store rain water that always goes to waste and store it for future use so during dry spells he will have water to irrigate his farm.

Malack plans to use drip irrigation on his farm and this water tank will be of much help. As Malack says, “water is a precious commodity”. Malack had almost lost hope of buying a good quality water tank but, because of good partners like Kiva, he believes his dream will be a reality and he will improve his living conditions through improved crop production and having clean water for consumption by his family.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a hardworking man aged 44 years and happily married with 3 children.

He grew up in a very humble family which had little assets and even without school fees to educate him. He opted to work in the nearby national park as a gardener to earn a living. Due to his hard work, he managed to save some money and bought a piece of land in a trading centre in Mbarara District where he put a banana plantation. This enabled him to make a living to the extent that he even managed to start constructing a house, which up to now he has failed to complete.

He is requesting for a loan of 4,500,000 UGX to finish his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Andrea Fiorella

texts.es:
Andrea vive en el populoso distrito del Agustino y todos los días viaja muy temprano aproximadamente 2 horas para llegar a su centro de estudios. 
Ella vive con su madre y sus hermanos, proviene de un hogar de padres separados y su padre no ayuda económicamente en la manutención.
Su madre labora atendiendo un baño publico y es el único sostén familiar y tiene cubrir ademas los gastos de colegio y estudios de sus otros dos hermanos, por lo que el dinero no le alcanza para poder financiar la carrera de confecciones textiles de Andrea, por lo que pronto deberá abandonar sus estudios y comenzar a trabajar de no contar con el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva.
Andrea desea que la ayuden para tener con el préstamo una cuota mas accesible que le permita poder cancelarla mes a mes y hacer posible que continúe estudiando, ella cumplirá fielmente y sin atraso con las mismas.
Ella quiere agradecer el valioso apoyo que le brindan los prestamistas de Kiva y quiere decirles que esto que hacen por los jóvenes es una gran tarea de amor al prójimo por la cual sabe bien que Dios los colmara de bendiciones.
texts.en: Andrea lives in the crowded district of Agustino and very early every day she travels two hours to her center of study. She lives with her mother and her siblings. She comes from a home of separated parents and her father does not contribute to her upkeep. Her mother works as an attendant at a public bath and is the only person sustaining the family. She needs to pay for the school and studies of her other two brothers so there is not enough money to pay for Andrea's textile sewing course. If she cannot count on the support of the lenders from Kiva she will have to abandon her studies and start to work. Andrea wants the support so that she has more accessible payments which will allow her to pay month by month. This would make it possible for her to study. She promises to pay promptly and without getting behind with her loan. She would like to thank the valuable support given by the lenders at Kiva and wants to tell them that what they are doing for these young people is a great work of love for others for which God will shower with blessings.

loans.use: to finish her professional studies and to help her mother.

loans.name: Candida Olivia

texts.en:
Candida is 45 years old. She is a widow and lives in her brother´s house with her two sons and her brother's family.

Candida works making clothes and occasionally she also sells retail to recurring clients. She is asking for a loan to buy a sewing machine. She has worked in the same trade for the last 10 years and considers herself hardworking and trustworthy. Her biggest achievement is providing financial stability for her sons by herself after the death of her husband.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Sorlimor Group

texts.en:
Lucy, in her early thirties, is married and the mother of two children who are in school. She supports her family by running a business. She buys groceries from the market and sells them from morning to 6 p.m. daily. Lucy is able to make a good profit each month. She is so happy with Kiva's support and she believes her business will grow more with it. Lucy is so thankful to everyone who supports her group. Lucy has been in this business for nine years. 

This will be Lucy's sixth loan request via ID-Ghana. She used the previous loans, which she repaid successfully, to buy more groceries for her business. Lucy earned profit, which she used to reinvest, build a house and to cover part of their school fees and household expenses. She will use her new loan to buy groceries to sell. 

Lucy and the other Sorlimor group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan amount of  7,700 GHS.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his daughter's education

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es:
Carlos vive en Lima junto a sus padres, su madre es el único sustento del hogar, debido a que su padre sufre de una enfermedad crónica y no puede laborar.
Ella trabaja como vendedora de ropa en un mercado y gana solo lo suficiente para sobrevivir, debido a los gastos en medicinas de su esposo, haciendo imposible que pueda solventar los estudios de Carlos por mas tiempo.
Carlos se encuentra a la mitad de su carrera en electricidad automotriz y aunque esta muy deseoso de poder continuarla, tendrá que dejarla y comenzar a trabajar de no contar con el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva.
El tiene muy buenas notas y esta entre los mejores de su clase, por lo que seria una lastima que no pueda seguir estudiando ya que seria un gran profesional.
Carlos es consciente que sin el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva no le sera posible continuar con su carrera, es por esto que invoca y agradece todo el apoyo que estos le puedan brindar para seguir estudiando y llegar a graduarse.
El piensa que el acceso a la educación es sumamente importante para poder salir adelante, siendo esto justamente lo que lo impulsa a continuar día a día en busca de un mejor futuro para el y su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in Lima with his parents.  His mother is the only support for the household because his father has a chronic illness and cannot work.  She sells clothing in a market and earns only what is necessary to make ends meet.  Because of the expenses for medicine for her husband, it's impossible for her to keep paying for Carlos's educational expenses.

Carlos is halfway through his program in automotive electronics and, although he very much wants to be able to continue, he'll have to leave school to work if he doesn't have the Kiva lenders' support.  He has very good grades and is among the best in his class, so it would be a shame if he couldn't continue in school because he would be a great professional.

Carlos is aware that without the help of Kiva lenders it won't be possible for him to continue with his program.  That's why he's appealing to and thanking them for all their support so he can continue his studies and be able to graduate.

He thinks that access to an education is extremely important for being able to get ahead, which is precisely what inspires him to keep going every day in search of a better future for himself and his family.

loans.use: to become a professional and to get his mother and sick father ahead

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for her son’s education

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an iron and renovate her workplace

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 34 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Lolita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 8,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, sugar, eggs, etc.

Lolita has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Marivic works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising chickens. Marivic is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Kiva field partner NWTF to buy materials needed like thread, fabric, etc. for her tailoring business.

Marivic has been sustaining her business activities with her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like thread, fabric, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a table and make a flex banner for his store.

loans.name: Grupo Chuachinup Sector Escuela Group

texts.es:
Mujer emprendedora de 31 años de edad residente en Sololá, casada con un hijo de 11 años que se dedica a estudiar en la escuela de la comunidad donde viven cursando cuarto primaria,  ella tiene que realizar un esfuerzo enorme para poder mantener a su familia y ver la forma de cómo mejorar el sistema económica de su familia, (Magdalena es la que esta vestida de un güipil color rojo se encuentra en la segunda a partir de la derecha a izquierda)
	
El actividad que realiza magdalena es la venta de ropa típica ya que para ella es una fuente importante de ingreso para su familia, para poder mejorar las condiciones de vida que actualmente viven  en su comunidad, ella realiza una segunda actividad que es la venta de incienso, siempre tratando la forma de cómo tener un ingreso económico extra para poder darle a su hijo el estudio que se merece y que algún día llega a ser un profesional en la vida.

El uso respectivo que doña Magdalena le dará al préstamo que ella está realizando es para la compra de más ropa típica para luego venderlas en su comunidad y vecinos para tener un mejor ingreso económico  para ella y su familia.

Magdalena y un grupo de mujeres más sueñan con alcanzar sus sueños en la vida que es llegar a superarse en la vida y ver por los demás que los necesitan para superarse.

Una de sus metas futuras es la compra de un local en su comunidad para que ella pueda realizar la venta de su mercadería y ver crecer a su hijo en la escuela y llegar a ser un profesional en la vida y que tenga una condición de vida mejor.
texts.en:
Magdalena is 31 years old and a resident of Sololá. She is married with an 11 year old son who studies in the local school where he is in 4th Grade. She has to make an enormous effort to sustain her family and see how to improve the family's economic system. (Magdalena is wearing the red colored traditional blouse and is second from the right.) Magdalena's business activity is selling traditional clothing as for her this is the principal source of income for her family to improve the conditions that her family live in. She also has a second activity which is the sale of incense. She always tries to have an extra economic income to be able to provide her son the education he deserves so that one day in his life he might become a professional. Magdalena will use the loan that she is undertaking to buy more typical clothing to later sell in her community and to her neighbors to have more income for her and her family.

Magdalena and a group of other women dream of fulfilling the dreams in their lives which is to get ahead in life and to help the others that need it to get ahead. One of her future goals is to buy a store in their community where she can sell her products and watch her son grow in school and become a professional in life and have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing.

loans.name: Mayas Group

texts.en:
San Pedro La Laguna is a picturesque town on the shores of the beautiful Lake Atitlán in the Western Highlands of Guatemala.  The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank's “Mayas” Group was formed here by seven Maya Tzutujil ladies who are seeking to create better lives for themselves, their families and their community. They are pleased to be able to participate in Friendship Bridge's “Microcredit Plus” Program that combines small loans and education. The Trust Bank's “Mayas” Group is beginning its second loan cycle with Friendship Bridge and the very first one with Kiva!

Doña María is a hard-working member of the group. She is 45 years old and married with six children. Her youngest child lives with her and is just beginning his formal education. Doña María is quite motivated to provide him with everything that he needs. She has a textile business and sells her traditional blouses, belts and aprons in three nearby locations. The loan that she is requesting will enable her to purchase supplies for her business including fabric, ribbon, buttons, thread and needles. Her business is growing and is proving increasingly profitable.
 
The ladies of the Trust Bank are happy to have just welcomed a new member to the group. The new member is very enthusiastic about Friendship Bridge's educational program. A Loan Officer from the organization attends the monthly meetings and facilitates the educational portion of the meeting. The program has been designed to strengthen the women with new knowledge about a variety of relevant subjects including women’s rights, self esteem and violence against women as well as hygiene, health and nutrition. The women also learn about the use of medicinal plants. To assist them in successfully managing their loans, they learn about accounting, budgeting, customer service, marketing and pricing.

The Trust Bank's “Mayas” Group is anxious to begin their new loan cycle. They are full of hopes and dreams. Kiva investors play a prominent role in the success of these women. Thank you, Kiva investors for your compassion and generosity.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her textile business including fabric, ribbon, buttons, thread and needles

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
From Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Mom, 49, is an experienced and industrious farmer. She is a lovely mother of two married children and one adolescent who is attending a high school in the village. By operating a farming business on a small rice field, she can earn around USD $4 a day to support her family's daily expenses. So far, Mom has been involved in this career for nearly 20 years.

To keep her rice growing well and more fruitful, Mom is going to use natural fertilizers in her farmland. Due to the shortage of money, she would like to get a Kiva loan via KHL to buy fertilizers to use in her farming process in this farming season. She also thanks all the lenders for their generous behaviors.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Rosenia

texts.en:
Rosenia is 57 years old, and is married with four children, one of whom in school. Rosenia works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 35,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee, and more.

Rosenia has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like, canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee, and more.

loans.name: Alegina

texts.en:
Alegina is 62 years old, and widow with four children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell like soft drinks, spices, soup, shampoo, and more.

Alegina has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soft drinks, spices, soup, shampoo, and more.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad works hard to support her family. She is married and owns a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines.

She requested a loan of 22,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Natividad has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Nieves works hard to support her family. Nieves is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

Nieves has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future, Nieves would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita works hard to support her family. Rosita is married and has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell.

Rosita has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Rosita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Jevero

texts.en:
As a widow parent of two children, Jevero works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Jevero is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Jevero has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Chita

texts.en:
Chita is 55 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Chita has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Chita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair sofas by buying yarn, glue, wood, sewing needles, and scissors.

loans.name: Olinda

texts.en: Olinda is taking a loan of $1000.00 to improve her business. She is running a mini shop that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as shirts with long sleeves and short sleeves, long pants, and shorts. She opened her mini shop in 2002 with her own working capital of $200.00. Olinda is a hard-working woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy shirts with long sleeves and short sleeves, long pants and shorts

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 25 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase household goods, such as shampoo, canned goods, sugar, soap, etc.

Catherine has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase household goods, like shampoo, canned goods, sugar, soap, etc

loans.name: Edelita

texts.en:
Edelita is 51 years old and has nine children. Edelita is married and all nine children are in school.

Edelita is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Edelita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Edelita has been buying and selling livestock for 3 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain these efforts.

In the future, Edelita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Juveline

texts.en:
Juveline works hard to support her family. Juveline is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing materials such as nets, gasoline, wood, etc.

Juveline has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future, Juveline would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as nets, gasoline, wood, etc

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell for her fruit and vegetable vending business.

Elvie has been in this business for 25 years. Elvie earns more income from a general store.

Elvie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Carla

texts.en:
Carla works hard to support her family. Carla is married and has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Carla has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Carla would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Estelita works hard to support her family.

She has a raising livestock business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Estelita is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her raising livestock business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Estelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 50 years old and married with two children. With one child still in school, Ester works very hard to provide for them.

Ester runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items such as detergent soap, shampoo, biscuits, snack foods, candies, etc. to sell.

Ester has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, shampoo, biscuits, snack foods, candies, etc. 

In the future, Ester would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items such as detergent soap, shampoo, biscuits, snack foods, candies, etc. to sell

loans.name: Mnyazi

texts.en: Mnyazi is a married woman with children who still attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. She has operated a retail kiosk for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying for long to repay loans. With the loan Mnyazi is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Hizel Babe

texts.en:
Hizel Babe is married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Hizel Babe is 36 years old and has four children who are in school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Hizel Babe requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for fishing such as gasoline, fishing nets, hooks, etc.

Hizel Babe has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Hizel babe would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for fishing such as gasoline, fishing nets, hooks, etc

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 59 years old and has three children.  Delia is married, and her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming flowers in the Philippines. Delia requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers, flower pots and other varieties of plants to farm.

Delia has been farming flowers for 6 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Delia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers, flower pots and other varieties of plants to farm

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos owns and operates a tricycle unit. He has been successful in this business for years, and he repaid his previous loan used for the business. He also finds ways to improve his income to provide for their everyday needs and necessities.

Relative to this, he would like to take a new loan to buy spare parts and accessories for their vehicle. He is requesting an amount of PHP 13,000 for the maintenance of the tricycle and to pay for the renewal of the franchise agreement/permit so he could continue his business operation.

Carlos wants to buy another unit of tricycle. He hopes for a prosperous life for his family. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle unit.

loans.name: Ventura Group

texts.en:
Chichicastenango is a well-known town in the Western Highlands of Guatemala and home to the traditional and proud “Maya-Kiché”  who have a rich cultural history. Their economy is based on agriculture, animal husbandry and traditional textile production. Fruit produced from this fertile area includes peaches, pears, plums and apples.

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank's “Ventura” Group was formed some time ago by 10 women who want to improve their standard of living and eliminate poverty in their lives. They are dedicated to their businesses and motivated to help support their families. The President of the Trust Bank is 32-year-old Manuela. She is married and has nine children. Manuela is quite pleased that five of them are in school as she understands the importance of education. She works hard two days each week selling chickens when the large local market is held. Her earnings enable her to support her nuclear family. Manuela is requesting a new loan in order to purchase additional chickens so she can expand her clientele. She is also looking forward to increased earnings.

The educational training sessions that are part of the monthly meetings with a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer are of great use to the women. The ladies enjoy learning and discussing topics like business administration and money management, women’s identity and leadership as well as self esteem. They learn a lot during this training and also from the experiences and opinions of their friends in the Trust Bank. Friendship Bridge has given the name “Microcredit Plus” to this combination of loans and education. It is a partnership that yields very positive results for the women.

The ladies of the Trust Bank's “Ventura” Group thank each Kiva investor who enables them to have access to a microcredit loan which not only benefits them and their families but also their community in Chichicastenango. Empowered with small loans and education, they step into a brighter future with confidence and determination. Thank you, Kiva investors!

loans.use: To purchase additional chickens so she can expand her clientele

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 44 years old and married with seven children.

Estrella works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Estrella has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Estrella aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 41 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a direct selling personal collection products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Vilma has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the direct selling personal collection products for 4 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 46 years old and has five children. Evangeline is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Evangeline is in the agricultural business, pig fattening, in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Evangeline has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her agriculture business and is now requesting a PHP 6,214.20 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Imelda will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 47 years old and has five children. Helen is married and has four children who are currently in school.

Helen is in the agricultural business, pig fattening, in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Helen has been in pig fattening for 4 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Helen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda has been engaged in the hog-raising business to help her husband in generating income. She is 54 years old and has three children. Being a responsible parent, she is responsible to educate their children and give them a better living. With this regard, she aimed to improve their business to generate a higher income. Having inadequate capital, Luzviminda wants to access financial assistance from Kiva lenders to buy the needed hog feeds, vitamins and additional pigs to raise. Being a hardworking mother, she believes that someday, she will further improve the business.

loans.use: to buy the needed hog feeds, vitamins and additional pigs to raise

location.town: Brgy. Bitnong, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn owns and operates a tricycle unit. She has been successful in this business for years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income to provide for their everyday needs and necessities.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to buy spare parts and accessories for their vehicle. She is requesting an amount of PHP 15,000 for the maintenance of the tricycle and to pay for the renewal of franchise agreement/permit so she could continue her business operation.

In the future, Marilyn wants to buy another unit of tricycle for business purposes. She dreams of a well-off living with her family and that her children will finish their studies. Every week, she meets with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration by studying the Word of God. 

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts, accessories, and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
This is Maria, 45, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Raul, a tricycle driver, and is mother of three children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Maria operates an ornamental plant business. She grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower, and dahlias in addition to varieties of hanging plants and other plants. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbors and the nearby community.  She earns a minimum of Php300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and garden inputs for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Maria dreams for her business to grow more in the coming years and for her children to finish their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and garden inputs for her business.

loans.name: Julesia

texts.en:
Julesia is 42 years old and has six children. Julesia is married and has four children who are currently in school.

Julesia is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Julesia requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her livestock.

Julesia has been raising livestock for 14 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Julesia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina works hard to support her family. Divina is married and has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Divina has been in this business for 5 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ma. Genelyn

texts.en:
Ma. Genelyn is 43 years old and married with four children.

Ma. Genelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Ma. Genelyn has borrowed and repaid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 18 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling school supplies.

Ma. Genelyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en: Magdalena is in her sixties. At her age, she still has a passion to succeed. Magdalena is engaged in the retail business. She is also engaged in the selling of cooked food, like menus for meals, but she temporarily stopped doing this, because of lack of capital. Magdalena patiently manages her business in order to meet her daily needs. Magdalena wants to extend the products she is selling and get a higher income. With this, she is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy more grocery items to sell in her village. She believes that she will earn higher income and use it as revolving capital to continue operating her food vending business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell in her village

loans.name: Laurencio

texts.en:
Laurencio is a Kubo Financiero’s client and this is his story:

Laurencio is 62 years old, married and has no children who are still dependent on him. He worked for 40 years in the automotive industry, where he gained expertise in blacksmithing and was able to save money towards his future.

Nowadays, he has his own workshop at home where he does some jobs from time to time and has an extra income by renting out some warehouses that he was able to purchase throughout his life. Laurencio is requesting this loan to buy primary materials necessary for some orders (for desks, tables and windows) that he has received.

For Laurencio, being still in business is a matter of pride and he appreciates the fact that clients still approach him. He aspires to continue growing his business and to buy more warehouses to rent.

loans.use: to buy primary materials needed to fulfil orders that he has received

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita, who is 53 years old and married with three kids. She is involved in selling products in her community. She is a very accommodating person and she loves to talk  to her costumers when they buy her products. Teresita is asking for a loan amounting to 25,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, candies, and rice for her store.

In the future, Teresita hopes that she can expand her business so that she can meet all of the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, candies, and rice for her store

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en: Mbeyu is a married woman with children who still attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. She has operated a retail kiosk for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying for long to repay loans.  With the loan she is requesting, Mbeyu wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Luis Samuel

texts.es:
Luis proviene de un hogar de padres separados y vive actualmente con su madre que labora de secretaria y percibe el sueldo mínimo. Ella a sido padre y madre para el y sus 4 hermanos menores ya que no sabe nada de su esposo y este no aporta económicamente en los gastos del hogar.
Luis esta cursando actualmente el 4to ciclo de su carrera en electrónica industrial, carrera que le apasiona y anhela terminar con el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva, ya que su madre no puede seguir ayudándolo en el pago de sus pensiones.
El desea terminar sus estudios y comenzar a trabajar para así poder ayudar a su madre y sacar adelante a sus 4 hermanos menores, esperando que como el, puedan estudiar y llegar a ser profesionales.
Luis desea agradecer por todo esto el apoyo que pueden brindarle los prestamistas de Kiva para hacer esto realidad,a la vez que les da un agradecimiento especial en nombre de todos los jóvenes a nivel mundial que han sido beneficiados de una u otra forma por su tan desinteresada labor.
texts.en:
Luis comes from a home with separated parents and lives with his mother who works as a secretary and receives a minimum salary. She has been mother and father to him and her four other children. They know nothing of their father and he doesn't help support the household expenses.

Luis is presently studying in his 4th cycle of industrial electronics, a career that he loves and hopes to complete with the help of the lenders at Kiva. His mother cannot continue to help him with the payment of his schooling.

He wants to finish his studies and begin to work so that he can help his mother and get his four siblings ahead. He hopes that they, as he has done, can study to become professionals. Luis wants to thank all the support that the lenders at Kiva provide to make this a reality. At the same time he would like to give a special thanks on behalf of all the youth worldwide who have been beneficiaries in one form or another of this impartial labor.

loans.use: to pay tuition for to finish his technical degree in electronics

loans.name: Manolo

texts.en:
Manolo has been operating a service based business for more than four years, earning well for the family. He had successfully repaid his previous loan used for accessories and tires. 

He wants to secure the services to continue to serve his customers. So, he took a new loan to buy a new set of tires to replace the used tires. He’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business before long.
