loans.use: to buy new set of tires.

loans.name: Marianne

texts.en:
Marianne is 28 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. Marianne works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

Marianne has been in this business for three years. 

In the future Marianne would like to save enough money so that she will be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 46 years old, married, and works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice as well as a general store. Gemma is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of dry goods to sell for her buy and sell dry goods business.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of dry goods to sell

loans.name: Merideth

texts.en:
Merideth, a 38-year-old married mother of two, works hard to provide for her family. For four years she has been operating a general store in the Philippines, and also earns an income from food vending. 

Merideth, who has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF, has requested a new one for PHP 12000 to buy additional stocks such as snack foods, canned goods, juice, coffee, sugar, dried fish, etc. to resell. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks such as snack foods, canned goods, juice, coffee, sugar, dried fish, etc. to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Marilou has been in this business for 25 years. Marilou earns more income from firewood vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling fertilized duck eggs in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional duck eggs to sell.

Melissa has been in this business for six years. Melissa earns more income from buying and selling rice.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional duck eggs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy quality items to make meals.

loans.name: Arianne

texts.en: Arianne is 25, married, and has one child. She is engaged in buying and reselling footwear within the local community to help her husband gain income. Due to financial hardship, she aims to improve the business and increase her income to sustain the necessities of her family. Having inadequate capital, she wants to access financial support from KIVA lenders through ASKI an amount of PHP50,000 to buy more stock of rubber shoes, sandals, slippers and shoes to resell. Through hard work and strong determination, she believes that she will make her business more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rubber shoes, sandals, slippers and shoes to resell.

location.town: Brgy. Malasin Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Walter

texts.en: Walter is a 48-year-old, father who is raising his family in a rural community. He earns their living through farming and hog raising. He planned to improve this business so that he will increase his income. Due to capital insufficiency, he would like to ask for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy hog feed, vaccines, and vitamins for his hogs. Having this financial assistance, he is hoping that someday, he will increase the number of his pigs as well as his income and sustain the necessities of his family.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds, vaccines, and vitamins for his hogs

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en: Luzminda has been operating a general store in her village for many years to make a living. She earns so well that she has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. Improving her business becomes easier with her access to GDMPC micro-finance services. To offer more goods, she took a new loan recently to buy more grocery goods to sell. She hopes that this will help to pay for her children’s education and for a better life in the future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Jelar

texts.en:
Jelar has been helping her husband by tending their farm and harvesting corn for sale. Aside from this, she also sells barbecued food in their village to earn additional income.

Jelar earns well from these activities so that she has successfully repaid her previous loans used for this. She finds ways to improve their business for her plans of building their own house. Recently, she took a new loan to buy organic fertilizer.

She plans to cultivate the unused land on their farm in order to earn more income for the future of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Prescilla

texts.en:
This is Prescilla. Her previous loan was a big help for her business, as she was able to purchase products for her direct selling business. The loan is also useful in the education of her child. Her income from the loan assisted with their everyday expenditures at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan. It will be used to buy additional supplies and merchandise, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her child's education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Prescilla hopes that her business will continue to progress and will become stable. She only dreams of good health and a happy living for her family. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional merchandise, such as clothing and health products, to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Michelle is 31 years old and has two children who are in school.

Michelle has a fishing business in the Philippines. Michelle requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials and gear for her fishing business.

Michelle has been in this business for five years. In the future, Michelle would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her fishing business

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell of candles business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of candles to sell. 

Elena has been in this business for five years. Elena earns more income from raising pigs.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of candles to sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 40 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, beers, dried fish, cooking oil, noodles, biscuits, etc.

She has borrowed and paid back 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Nenita aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, beers, dried fish, cooking oil, noodles, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is 50 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school. Diana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like shampoo, sugar, salt, noddles, eggs, groceries, etc. 

She has borrowed and paid back 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from selling vegetables, food vending and raising livestock. Diana aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: buy additional items to sell, like shampoo, sugar, salt, noddles, eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Vladimir Maximo

texts.es:
Vladimir es un joven muy inteligente y con muchos deseos de salir adelante. El se independizo de su hogar y actualmente vive en un cuarto alquilado cerca a su instituto, donde estudia la carrera de Matriceria en el rubro textil.
Su padre es obrero y su madre ama de casa y apenas gana  para poder sobrevivir ellos, por lo que el mismo paga sus gastos de manutención y estudios trabajando como cobrador en una linea de buses de transporte publico de pasajeros.
Vladimir a sabido salir adelante pese a muchas dificultades y a podido pagar su carrera hasta hoy y ya cursa la mitad de la misma, sin embargo su horario de clases dificulta que el pueda trabajar a tiempo completo, por lo que deberá dedicarle mas tiempo al estudio y trabajar solo por horas, lo cual no le permitiría ganar lo suficiente para seguir pagando sus estudios y mantenerse, por lo que no podría continuar con ellos de no contar con el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva.
El desea que los prestamistas de Kiva lo ayuden mediante el financiamiento, ya que las cuotas que pagaría serian menores a las que actualmente paga en el instituto y podría cancelarlas con lo que ganaría trabajando a medio tiempo y podría seguir estudiando.
Vladimir confía que nuevamente pueda salir adelante de este difícil momento como antes lo a hecho en otras situaciones,por lo que agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por confiar en el y por todo el apoyo que pueden brindarle para seguir estudiando hasta el termino de su carrera.
texts.en:
Vladimir is a very intelligent young man and he has a strong desire to get ahead. He became independent from his home, and currently lives in a rented room close to the institute where he studies the profession of dye-stamping in the textile industry. His father works and his mother is a homemaker. His father barely earns enough to sustain his family. For this reason, Vladimir pays for his own schooling and living expenses by working as a ticket collector on a bus line for the transport of the general public. 

Vladimir has known how to get ahead despite many difficulties and has been able to pay for his studies to this point and has completed half of the courses. However, his class schedule now makes it difficult to work full-time because he has to dedicate more time to studying and he can only work a few hours. This does not allow him to make enough money to keep paying for his studies and maintain his living. So he would not be able to continue with his studies without counting on the support of the Kiva lenders .

He hopes that the Kiva lenders will help him with the financing. Since his loan payments would be less than what he currently pays for school, he would be able to make the payments with what he will earn at his job working part-time, and he could continue studying.

Vladimir is confident that yet again he can come out ahead of this difficult moment as he has done in other situations. He is grateful for the Kiva lenders for trusting in him and for all of the support they provide him so he can continue studying to finish his degree.

loans.use: to pay tuition for a technical degree in textiles

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en: Marcela is 48 years old and married with four kids. Marcela is engaged in selling through a food market. With the help of her husband, they have together run the business for ten years. To have additional income she is asking a loan amounting to 30,000 PHP to buy meat, vegetables and chicken to grow her business. Marcela hopes that she can save enough money for her children's future.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, and chicken to grow her business

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is a farmer who is raising his family in a rural community. He is 36 years old and has three schooling children. He plants and harvests various fruits and vegetables within his community. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, he aims to improve and expand his plantation to ensure a high production. Having limited capital, he would like a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy herbicides and fertilizers needed in vegetable production.  Being patient and industrious, he believes that he will increase his production and income.

loans.use: to buy herbicides and fertilizers needed in vegetable production

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her variety store. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for years and she earns well from this. She focuses now on making peanut butter and coco jam, which are famous food pastes in the Philippines. She sustains all her needs through her business while ably helping her family at the same time. She also works hard with the determination of having a better income.

To improve sales, Gemma would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell, and also supplies and raw materials that are needed in her food production business. With PHP 10,000, she could purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Gemma hopes that her business will continue to flourish. She dreams of financial freedom and success in life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their lives and businesses every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and raising pigs. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, sugar, coffee, etc. for her general store business.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business of raising livestock in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Rodelyn requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock and supplies for her business.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock and supplies for her business.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet works hard to support her family. She is married and has a bakeshop business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like yeast, flour, milk, sugar, etc.

Juliet has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Juliet would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like yeast, flour, milk, and sugar

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 39 years old, married, and has three children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Rosita has been in pig fattening for 6 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Rosita requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 58 years old and has 12 children. Teresa is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Teresa is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Teresa requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Teresa has been in this business for three years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

Teresa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Hồng

texts.en:
Hồng works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle.

 She is 29 years old and married with two children.  Hồng lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hồng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for eight years.

The main hardship that Hồng faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet and bathroom.

With her business profit, Hồng hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet and bathroom

loans.name: Hải

texts.en:
Hải works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for five years. She is 30 years old and is married with one child.

She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

The main hardship that Hải faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet and bathroom.

With her business profit, Hải hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet and bathroom

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
To make a living, Nena operates a farm and at the same time has a swine fattening business. She has been doing this for more than seven years and she earns enough for their daily living. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for feeding supplies. Improving lives for Nena is easier with her access to GDMPC who helps clients to improve their lives. Recently, she took a new loan to buy feeding supplies.

Nena wants to improve her piggery and to be able to earn more income to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity uses her motorcycle to collect payments from her clients. She sells beauty products to make a living. Her previous loan, used to buy motor accessories and tires, was successfully repaid with her generated income. To offer more products, she took a new loan to purchase more cosmetics to sell.

She wants to improve her business and be able to save her profit for the future needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila has been working with her husband on their own farm for many years to make a living. With her generated income from farm produce, she was able to repay successfully her previous loans used for farming. She also sells some farm products, especially peanuts, in their community and it earns a better income for their daily expenditures. Her production of peanuts is not enough to be sold and that is why she took a new loan to buy more peanuts to resell.

Leonila hopes to increase her harvest so as to take care of her family’s daily needs and to purchase additional farmland as well.

loans.use: to buy more peanuts to resell

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia has owned and operated farmland, planting and harvesting pineapple and other crops for sale, for thirty years. She was able to provide for her family and has successfully repaid her previous loan used for farming. She earns well from her investments.

She wants to improve her farm because she wants to ensure a better and greener farm. She would like to apply for a new loan, this time for 10,000 PHP, to purchase organic fertilizer to improve the farm.

In the future, Florencia hopes to gain more buyers of her farming products. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and it is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and farm supplies for her business

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 6,350 through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Mildred is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en:
Liezl works hard to support her family. Liezl is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Liezl requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Liezl has been in this business for 5 years now.

Liezl would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ngọc

texts.en:
Ngọc works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle.  She has been involved in this business for nine years. She is 29 years old and married with two children. Ngọc supports her two dependents with her business in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Ngọc's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Ngọc faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to buy equipment to repair her toilet.

In the future, Ngọc hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to buy equipment to repair her toilet

loans.name: Thiện

texts.en:
Mrs. Thiện has a retail business selling dry food. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

She is 38 years old and married with two children. She lives with her two dependents in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thiện's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Thiện faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet and bathroom  .

With her business profit, Thiện hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet and bathroom

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie works hard to support five children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rosalie requested a PHP 6,350 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a backup light in case of emergency.

Rosalie is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Amelia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Amelia is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fish net, plastic wire, and gasoline for her fishing business.

Amelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish net, plastic wire, and gasoline

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Narcisa has been in this business for 18 years. Narcisa earns additional income from raising pigs.

Narcisa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en: Muhabbat is 39 years old. She is married and has five children. Muhabbat’s husband is a farmer. One of their children is an adult and four of them are non-adults. Muhabbat has been busy with animal sales and growing potatoes and crops for more than eight years. She lives in an agricultural region, so she has a good opportunity to develop her business. Muhabbat is going to increase her business with animal husbandry as the main family income is from animal husbandry. She is asking for a loan of 1,500 USD to buy cattle to increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Phanna

texts.en:
Phanna (in the photo), age 23, is single and lives with his parents and sister in a suburb of Phnom Penh. His parents are rice farmers. 

Phanna is a fourth year student, majoring in banking and finance. This is his last year of university. He hopes he will have the professional skills to work in the microfinance or banking sector.  

Phanna wants to continue his study so he decided to apply for a loan in order to pay for his school fees.

loans.use: to pay for his school fees

loans.name: Hezel

texts.en: Hezel has been helping her husband grow coconuts and bananas to sell and has been doing this for more than seven years to make a living. Her previous loan, used for farming, was successfully repaid. She finds ways to sustain their farm and to ensure a better source of income for the family. She took a new loan recently to purchase organic fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilzer

loans.name: Precil

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Precil works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from food vending.  Precil is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell. 

Precil has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia owns and operates an ornamental plant business to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for years, and she was able to repay her previous loan. She also has found ways to boost her income and to provide for the everyday needs of her family.

She would like to take out a new loan to buy additional gardening materials and supplies. She is requesting an amount of 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy greater quantities and varieties of ornamental plants such as ylang-ylang, golden shower, dahlias, and various hanging plants.

Aurelia only desires to earn just adequate or even more profit from her business. She also dreams to make improvements on her general living condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15-30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials and supplies, such as seeds and fertilizer needed in her business

loans.name: Mae

texts.en: Mae owns and operates an agricultural farm, growing rice for a living. Mae has been engaged in this business for many years, helping her husband work on it. She earns well from these activities. Her farm is doing well and yet, she needs financial assistance to improve it. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her farm to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Amy works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Amy is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like pork, beef, chicken, oil, etc. for her restaurant business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Amy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she will be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like pork, beef, chicken, oil, etc

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
De 36 años de edad don Antonio en su estado civil  casado con dos hijo residentes en el departamento de Sololá siendo el primero de 9 años de edad estudiante en la escuela de la comunidad y el segundo de 1 año de edad por los cuales tiene ese deseo de superarse.  

La actividad que dignamente desempeña para poder obtener ingresos y ganancias económicas es la realización de compra de abarrotería y venta de productos de abarrotería que se encuentra ubicado en su comunidad, eligió dicha actividad porque a tenido la oportunidad  de haber trabajado 6 años en dicha actividad y que si deja buena ganancia económica.

El motivo principal de la realización del préstamo es para poder comprar productos de abarrotería para poder obtener un ingreso económico y así mismo el ingreso de las ganancias para mantener un sistema económico y apoyar el desarrollo de su comunidad y la de su familia.

Sus metas personales en la vida y en los años próximos es obtener ganancias que estima de su negocio y en ampliar su negocio en la compra de más locales en el centro de su comunidad y en darle una educación mejor a su hijo para que llegue a ser un buen profesional en el futuro.
texts.en:
At the age of 36, Don Antonio is married and has two children. All are residents of the department of Sololá. The first child is 9 years old and attends the school in their community; the second is 1 year old. Because of them, he has the desire to achieve.

The business activity that he carries out respectably is the sale of grocery products. In order to obtain income and economic earnings, he has completed the purchase of a grocery store that is located in his community. He chose this activity because he had the opportunity to work in this business for 6 years and because it gives good economic earnings.

The principal motivation for this loan is to be able to buy grocery products [to sell] in order to obtain an economic income, and at the same time the income from the earnings will maintain an economic system and support the development of his community and that of his family.

His personal goals in life and in the next few years are to obtain the earnings that he estimates from his business, to expand his business by buying more locations in the center of his community, and to give a better education to his son, so that he can be good professional in the future.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock his store.

loans.name: Isahac

texts.es:
Isahac es originario de Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan, de 32 años de edad,  tiene dos hijos de 6 y 1 años de edad por quienes tiene que luchar para poder satisfacer sus necesidades y la de su familia.

La actividad principal que realiza es la compra y venta de materiales de construcción por medio de ello puede tener un ingreso económico para el sustente de su familia, esta actividad  lo aprendió de su hermano que estuvieron trabajando por un tiempo de 4 años por lo cual el tomo esa iniciativa de poner su propio negocio para tener mejores ingresos económicos.

El uso respectivo que le dará al crédito que el requiere es para un capital que necesita para la compra de mas materiales de construcción para su respectiva venta e distribución de su materia prima por toda su comunidad.

Una de las metas de don Isahac es obtener ganancias para poder comprar un camión para el transporte de los materiales que el pone a disposición de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Isahac is from Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan.  He is 32 years old, and he has two children, ages six and one.  It is for them that he has to struggle in order to meet their needs and those of his family.

His primary business activity is buying and selling construction materials.  By doing so he is able to have income to support his family.  He learned this business activity from his brother.  They were working for four years, and then he took the imitative to set up his own business in order to have better income.

He will use the loan to buy more construction materials that he needs.  He will then sell and distribute the raw material throughout his community.

One of Isahac’s goals is to get profits to be able to buy a truck to transport the materials that he will make available to his community.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to sell.

loans.name: Maria Sofia

texts.es: María de 35 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su grupo familiar. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida con la venta de tortillas que realiza de lunes a domingo desde hace 3 años. Gracias a su visión emprendedora María desea ampliar su negocio de venta de tortillas y ofrecer a sus clientes otros productos además de tortillas. Por lo anterior  solicita a FUSAI un crédito para invertir en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de pupusas como: queso, repollo, tomates, frijoles, maíz, etc. Además desea reparar el chalet en el cual vende sus productos y así lograr un ambiente agradable para sus clientes, esperando así mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en: Maria, who is 35 years old, lives with her life companion and her family group. She is an entrepreneurial woman who earns a living with the sale of tortillas that she has been making from Monday to Sunday for three years. Thanks to her entrepreneurial vision, Maria wants to expand her business of selling tortillas and offer her customers other products besides tortillas. To do this, she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in the purchase of materials to make pupusas, such as cheese, cabbage, tomatoes, beans, corn, etc. In addition, she wants to repair the snack bar where she sells her products and thus have a pleasant atmosphere for her customers, hoping in this way to improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy cheese, cabbage, tomatoes, beans, corn, and so forth, to prepare pupusas

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María de 30 años de edad vive con sus 3 hijos de 12, 10 y 4 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que luego de perder a su esposo ha visto la manera de sacar adelante a sus hijos prestando sus servicios en el chalet de la  escuela de su cantón, además los fines de semana presta sus servicios domésticos para lograr un ingreso extra. María tiene la visión de poner su propio negocio  de venta de pupusas y tortillas por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para invertir en la compra de los insumos necesarios como: maíz, chicharrón, queso, frijoles, tomates, etc. Además desea mejorar un poco las condiciones del lugar donde venderá sus productos ya que como se observa en la fotografía no tiene las condiciones adecuadas para un negocio por lo que espera hacer las reparaciones lo antes posible.
texts.en:
María, age 30, lives with her three children, ages 12, 10, and 4.  She is an enterprising woman who, after losing her husband, has seen the way to get her children ahead.  She provides her services at the snack bar at the school in her canton.  Also, on the week-ends she provides domestic services in order to earn an extra income.

María has a vision of setting up her own business selling ‘pupusas’ [stuffed tortillas] and tortillas.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to buy the needed supplies like corn, ‘chicharrón’ [fried pork rinds], cheese, beans, and tomatoes, etc.  She also wishes to improve a little the conditions of the place where she will sell her products.  As seen in the photo, it is not in good enough condition for a business.  Consequently, she hopes to make the repairs as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy corn, ‘chicharrón’ [fried pork rinds], cheese, beans, and tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Grupo San Juan Pabayal 1 Group

texts.es:
Florinda(es la que se encuentra en la tercera con el güipil de color café de la izquierda a la derecha) es originario Suchitepéquez de 41 años de edad, cuento con cuatro hijos: el primero es de 23 años de edad y es casado, el segundo es de 20 años de edad  es dibujante y albañil, el tercero es de 17 años de edad estudiante de quinto P.C en la comunidad donde viven y el cuarto es de 14 años de edad estudiante de segundo básico en su misma comunidad.

Su actividad productiva la cual le genera ganancia en su sistema económica es la compra y venta de ropa típica en su comunidad ya que es la única forma que ella a podido encontrar para poder tener ingresos económicos para su familia, su segunda actividad es servir de mesera en un café y por medio de esa actividad ella puede tener otro ingreso extra para poder mantener a su familia y darles una condición de vida apropiada  para sus hijos y que sean buenos profesionales en el campo laboral de la vida.

Ella es muy emprendedora en la vida y es por ello que ella se decidió a la realización de un préstamo para la compra de más ropa típica, para tener a la disposición de la clientela más mercadería para su respectiva venta.

Ella se ha convertido en un claro ejemplo para las mujeres en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se decidieron a emprender el negocio junto con ella para poder satisfacer sus necesidades. La aspiración más importante de doña Florinda es la construcción de una mejor vivienda y darles un buen estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Florinda (from left to right, she is the third one with the coffee-colored dress) is from Suchitepéquez, and she is 41 years old.  She has four children; the first is 23 and married, the second is 20, and is a designer and builder, the third is 17, and is a student at “P. C. Quinto” in the community where they live, and the fourth is 14, and is in eighth grade in the same community.  

In her financial situation, she generates income through her business, buying and selling "guipiles" [traditional clothing] in her community.  It is the only way she has been able to find to able to have income for her family.  Her second activity is serving as a waitress in a café, and through this activity, she can have additional other income to be able to support her family and provide her children with appropriate living conditions and enable them to be good professional in their field of work.

Florinda is very enterprising in life, and for this reason she decided to apply for a loan to purchase more typical clothing so that she would have more merchandise available for her customers for respective sale.

She has become an excellent example for the women in her community, and it is for this reason that a group of women decided to establish the business along with her to be able to meet their needs.  Florinda’s most important desire is constructing a better home and providing for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase "guipiles" [traditional clothing].

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María de 46 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos de 22, 14 y 10 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida elaborando manualidades tales como: arreglos florales, tejas decoradas, etc. Además María posee una pequeña granja de  gallinas ponedoras lo que le permite tener un ingreso extra. María desea ampliar su negocio dado que es una de sus principales fuentes de ingresos. Por lo anterior solicita a FUSAI este crédito para invertir en la  comprar de los materiales necesarios como: tejas, flores, pintura, papel y concentrado para las gallinas. De esta forma espera mejorar sus ventas al igual que sus ingresos.
texts.en: Maria, who is 46 years old, lives with her life companion and their three children, ages 22, 14, and 10. She is an entrepreneurial woman who earns a living making crafts such as flower arrangements, decorated tiles, etc. In addition, Maria has a small farm for laying hens, which allows her to have an extra income. Maria wants to expand her business, given that it is one of her principal sources of income. To do this, she is applying to FUSAI for this loan to invest in the purchase of the necessary materials such as tiles, flowers, paint, paper, and concentrated feed for the hens. In this way, she hopes to improve her sales and her income.

loans.use: to buy tiles, flowers, paint, paper, and concentrated feed for chickens.

loans.name: Nur Laela

texts.en:
Nur is a housewife who manages smaller Ruma agents. She sells mobile phone airtime credits and serves bill payments. Nur lives in Tasikmalaya, a rural area about four hours from Jakarta.  She is single and living with three persons in the family home. 

Nur began working with Ruma because she believes that she can grow her business with Ruma.  She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business runs, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan in order to do more transactions.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payments transactions on a weekly basis.

loans.name: Johanna Margarita

texts.es: Johanna de 28 años de edad vive con su hijo de 3 años de edad. Ella es una mujer visionaria que se gana la vida con la venta de diversidad de productos en su pequeña tienda que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado establecer.  Johanna desea ampliar su negocio por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para invertir en la compra de más productos para su negocio como: arroz, frijoles, golosinas, fruta partida, dulces, etc. y así tener más variedad de productos para su clientela, además desea mejorar la fachada del mismo para lo cual desea encementar el piso y repellar las paredes.
texts.en: Johanna, who is 28 years old, lives with her 3-year-old son. She is a visionary woman who earns a living with the sale of a variety of products in her little store, which she managed to establish with great effort. Johanna wants to expand her business, for which she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in the purchase of more products for her business, such as rice, beans, candies, cut-up fruit, sweets, etc., and thus to have a greater variety of products for her customers. In addition, she wants to improve the facade of the store, for which she wants to cement the floor and plaster the walls.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, candies, cut-up fruit, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Ateng

texts.en:
Ateng lives in Tasikmalaya, about four hours from Jakarta. He manages a small shop selling snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credit.
This small stall that he has is his main source of income. Ateng is married, and he lives with his wife, his only daughter, and only son in the family home.  His children are all in school. As you could see in the picture, there are Ateng and his only son holding a Ruma banner and a customer on the right side of the picture.

Ateng joined Ruma because he believes that he can grow his business with Ruma. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Ateng sees improvements in his shop. He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions. His goal for his business is to add more products and grow fast so that he can pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to process more airtime and bill payment transactions on a weekly basis.

loans.name: Sularmi

texts.en:
Sularmi runs a small stall which sells mobile phone airtime credits. She lives in Depok, a semi-urban area about one hour from Jakarta. She is married and living with five persons in the family home. 

She is interested in exploring her business with Ruma.  She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business runs, Sularmi hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends. Our field staff believe that her spirits make her a very potential agent that hopefully will grow fast.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payments transactions on a weekly basis.

loans.name: Wiwin Eka

texts.en:
Wiwin lives in Indramayu, about four hours from Jakarta.  Indramayu is known as a mango city.  Wiwin manages a small shop selling phone accessories and mobile phone airtime credit.  As a way to increase the family income, Wiwin is married and living with his housewife wife and four of his family members in the family home.

Wiwin joined Ruma because he wants to expand his business opportunities, especially in serving bill payments. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Wiwin sees improvements in his shop. He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions so that he would gain more income to fulfill his wife and family needs.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payments transactions on a weekly basis.

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es: José de 24 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos. Él es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios de seguridad desde hace 10 años. José desea repellar las paredes de su vivienda ya que como se observa en la fotografía está hecha de adobe lo que además de provocar focos de anidación de plaga permite que corra el riesgo de derrumbarse por la humedad del invierno por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento y arena para hacer la mejora antes mencionada a su vivienda.
texts.en:
José is 24 years old and lives with his life companion and their two children. He is a hard-working man who has been earning his living as a security guard for 10 years. 

José wishes to plaster the walls of this home, since as one sees in the photo, it is made of adobe, which besides providing places for pests to nest, presents the risk of collapse because of winter dampness. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to buy sand and cement for doing the above-mentioned improvement to his home.

loans.use: To buy sand and cement for plastering his home.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 26-year-old single man, living in the house of his parents. Now, he is a student in the University of Taiz. He is a very dynamic and vigorous man. He works very hard in order to prepare his house to get married soon. His house is not completed and not renovated from the inside. His parents supported him very much to complete the renovation of his house. The house needs cement, flagstones, and paint to become ready to live. 

The building of the house cost Mohammed a lot of money. Now, he doesn't have enough money to finish the renovation. As a result, Mohammed is requesting a loan of 220,000 YER from AMB. He will use the loan to purchase construction materials such as cement, flagstones, and paint in order to renovate the house from the inside.

Mohammed's dream in the future is building more of one floor and renovating them. He hopes to get married soon.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, flagstones, and paint.

loans.name: Yaneth Del Carmen

texts.es: Yaneth de 33 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijas de 4 y 7 años de edad. Ella es una mujer tenaz que desde hace un año se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos, su compañero de vida aporta a la economía familiar con su trabajo. Yaneth desea reparar el techo de su vivienda por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: lámina galvanizada, además desea construir un corredor frente a su vivienda ya que como se observa en la fotografía no cuenta con uno lo que provoca que la lluvia entre en su vivienda.
texts.en: Yaneth, who is 33 years old, lives with her life companion and their two daughters, ages 4 and 7.  She is a tenacious woman who has earned a living for a year by offering her domestic services. Her life companion supports the family economy with his work. Yaneth wants to repair the roof of their home, for which she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to buy galvanized metal sheets. In addition, she wants to build a corridor at the front of her house, since, as can be seen in the photograph, it doesn't have one, and this causes the rain to enter their home.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheeting and wood to repair the roof and to construct a corridor for her home.

loans.name: Patricia Carolina

texts.es: Patricia de 28 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su hija de 7 años de edad. Ella es una mujer solidaria que trabaja en una institución cerca de su cantón, su compañero de vida aporta a la economía con su trabajo. Patricia no cuenta con el servicio de agua potable en su vivienda por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para invertir en la introducción del vital líquido en su vivienda.
texts.en: Patricia, who is 28 years old, lives with her life companion and their 7-year-old daughter. She is a supportive woman who works in an institution near her canton. Her life companion supports the economy with his work. Patricia does not have potable water service in her home, and so she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in introducing this vital liquid into her home.

loans.use: to invest in the introduction of potable water into her home

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en:
The Unity group is on their seventh loan cycle with ID Ghana. This group consists of seven members and is led by Rosemary. The members of this group engage in various businesses such as selling fish, general goods, polyethylene bags, shoes and foodstuff. 

The loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Rosemary. She says that she joined ID-Ghana four years ago after receiving an invitation through a mass promotion held by the organization. Rosemary currently has a business in which she sells general goods such as padlocks, hangers and scrubbing brushes. She has been learning the business since starting it three years ago and works independently. This is the seventh loan that she has obtained from ID Ghana.  

The loan she is receiving now will be used to buy more padlocks, hangers and scrubbing brushes to sell to customers. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family. Rosemary is a single mother of three children. 

When asked what she likes about ID Ghana, Rosemary said that she enjoys the health insurance offered by the organization.

loans.use: To buy more padlocks, hangers and scrubbing brushes to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install running water and buy galvanized tin sheeting and wood to repair her roof.

loans.name: Enma Aracely

texts.es: Emma de 41 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 18 y 9 años de edad. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de antojitos típicos como: atol de maíz tostado, yuca frita y  pastelitos de carne, su esposo también aporta a la economía familiar. Emma desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda ya que actualmente se encuentra deteriorado por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada y madera para cambiar el techo de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Emma, 41, lives with her husband and two children, ages 9 and 18. She is very hardworking and for 8 years has worked selling typical snacks like toasted corn atol, fried yucca and beef empanadas. Her husband also supports their family economically.

Emma wants to change the roof of her home because it is has deteriorated. She asks for a loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized tin sheeting and wood to repair her roof as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized tin sheeting and wood to replace her roof.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is a hard working farmer who lives with her husband. Her husband is a teacher working at the local school. Marine alone runs her farm with great love and pleasure. She keeps two cows, calves and cultivates some potatoes. Marine uses the gathered milk in cheese production and sells it in the neighbouring open market.

The requested loan of USD 2,200 is very important for Marine to purchase one more cow and pay for renovation of the barn. Please help this woman from Kurtan village to improve her farm.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and renovation of the barn.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es: Ismael de 41 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos de 19, 17 y 14 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida como operario en una empresa desde hace 4 años, su esposa apoya a la economía familiar con su negocio de venta de pupusas. Ismael desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda ya que actualmente se encuentra deteriorado lo que provoca que sus pertenencias se mojen con la lluvia. Por lo anterior  solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada y polines para cambiar el techo de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Ismael is 41 years old and lives with his wife and their three children, ages 19, 17 and 14. He is a hard-working man who has been earning his living as a worker at a company for four years. His wife contributes to the family income with her business selling pupusas (Salvadoran grilled stuffed tortillas).

Ismael wishes to replace the roof of his home, as currently it is in poor condition, which causes his belongings to get wet when it rains. For this reason he is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to buy sheet metal roofing and lumber in order to replace the roof of his home as soon as possible.

loans.use: To buy sheet metal roofing and lumber for replacing the roof of his home.

loans.name: María Virginia

texts.en:
María Virginia is a Kubo Financiero client and this is her story:

María is 56 years old, is married and has no economic dependents anymore. She makes a living by confectioning leather articles, specifically cosmetic bags and pencil cases which she sells in downtown Mexico City.

She started to be involved in this business when three years ago her son unfortunately passed away; he ran the workshop so she took over. She asks for this loan to buy more commodities to work more merchandise and be able to supply the demand that the return to school season will bring.

With the effort she puts into her work María likes to decorate her house with articles she likes and aspires to keep on growing the business and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy commodities for confectioning leather articles.

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es: Mirna de 32 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus 4 hijos de 18, 14 10 y 3 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora quien se dedica a la  venta de tortillas en su localidad desde hace seis años. Gracias a su experiencia y  carisma ha logrado ganarse la confianza de muchos clientes que casa cada día la prefieren más. Mirna desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda. Por lo que solicita a FUSAI este crédito para comprar lámina galvanizada y madera para cambiar el techo de su vivienda dado que en tiempo de lluvia el agua se filtra.
texts.en:
Mirna is 32 years old and lives with her life partner and their 4 children aged 18, 14 10 and 3 years old. She is an enterprising woman who has been selling tortillas in her community for six years. 

Thanks to her experience and charisma, she has managed to gain the trust of many customers, who with each passing day prefer her products even more.

Mirna wants to replace the roof of her home. Therefore, she requests a FUSAI  loan to buy galvanized steel and wood to change the roof of the house since in rainy weather the water leaks through.

loans.use: purchase galvanized metal and wood to replace the roof of her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a bartender training course.

loans.name: Marilyn Marissa

texts.en:
Marilyn Marissa is a Kubo Financiero client and this is her story:

Marilyn is 28 years old and is a single mother of one son. She makes a living by selling hair and personal hygiene products, a business in which she has been for 10 years now.

Her stand is located inside a market in her neighborhood, which guarantees her traffic and potential customers. She asks for this loan to stock up her business, specifically to buy cosmetics, perfumes, hair dying products and many more.

Marilyn puts a big effort into her business every day to keep it up and going, and her main goal is to make it grow and have more customers.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, cosmetics and hair treatment products.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Reyna de 28 años de edad vive con sus tres hijos y su madre en casa propia. Ella es una mujer laboriosa que se dedica desde hace mucho tiempo a la venta de diferentes verduras como: zanahoria, chile verde, coliflor, cebolla, lechuga, etc. La venta la realiza en el mercado central. Reyna desea construir un cuarto ya que como se observa en la fotografía su vivienda actualmente está hecha de lámina, por lo que desea cambiarla para hacerla un poco más segura para su familia. Es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar ladrillos, arena, grava, cemento  y pagar mano de obra necesaria para la construcción de un cuarto en su propiedad.
texts.en:
Reyna is 28 years old and lives with her three children and her mother in her own home. She is a hardworking woman that has earned a living for many years selling different vegetables such as carrots, green chilies, cauliflower, onions, lettuce, etc. She sells these in the central market.

Reyna wants to construct a room. As you can see in the photo, her home is currently made of sheet metal. She wants to change this, and make her home a little more secure for her family. For this reason she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy bricks, sand, gravel, cement and to pay for the labor needed for the construction of a room on her property.

loans.use: to buy bricks, sand, gravel, cement and to pay for the labor needed for the construction of a room.

loans.name: Barbra

texts.en: Barbra is a resident of Kiswahili in Mbarara District with four biological children and two other dependents, all in school. She started farming some five years back, but could not yield anything because of the poor methods she was using. That is when she got to know UGAFODE Microfinance and acquired a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings, which helped her to start a salon in Mbarara town. Because of Barbra’s hard work, she continued expanding. And now she is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 shillings to buy a hair dryer and hair gels for her salon business.

loans.use: To buy a dryer and hair gels

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Lawrence, who is 23 years of age and a very aggressive, hardworking and ever smiling farmer from the Nyamira area of Kenya, an area with good weather patterns that favor farming. Because of the high unemployment rate, Lawrence never secured any white collar job, but that never killed the inspiration he had of getting out of the poverty bracket, and he started farming one year ago. He has been making great strides. His personal source of income is milk, tea and some small personal business that he does to make ends meet. Although this dedicated and hardworking farmer makes profits, he is faced with one challenge, and that is a lack of funds to start poultry farming.

Nyamira area is a highly populated region and has a ready market for eggs and poultry products; that is why Lawrence wants to take full advantage of the situation. Through the loan, Lawrence will be able to sell his poultry in the nearby market and also to his neighbors, and he will be assured of reaping more profits and achieving his desire of succeeding.

Lawrence is very visionary, and he believes in developing his business into a large enterprise, where he will not only be selling eggs to the nearby market, but also to other markets in different towns.

Lawrence has the attribute of being very honest with finances, and through the accumulated profits, he will be able to repay back the loan and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Olinda

texts.en:
A loan of $800 is offered to Olinda to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as body lotion, eggs, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, coffee, shampoo and soap. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2008. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Olinda independent because she can be responsible for herself and also helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy body lotion, eggs, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, coffee, shampoo and soap.

loans.name: Franzesco Yohanes Gregory

texts.en: Franzesco is a prospective student at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara (AMN), a program of procedures taking commerce and harbor administration. Franzesco wants to become an expert in the field of shipping and administration so he can work at the port. He is the second child of four children from the village of Alok East, East Nusa Tenggara. He lives with his aunt because his parents have been separated for two years. His mother works as a seamstress in a clothing factory, and has very minimal income. Due to his mother being a single parent, she is worried Franzesco can not continue his education. With the student loan program of Kiva and AMN, he is very excited. The hope of Franzesco is by obtaining a loan from Kiva investors, he can complete college smoothly and can lighten the burden of his aunt and especially his mother, who has been working hard to finance his life. He wants to quickly get a job to make his mother, aunt and siblings happy. Franzesco is very grateful to Kiva investors who will help finance his studies.

loans.use: to pay his education fees for three years

loans.name: Grasiela

texts.en:
An $800 loan is offered to Grasiela to improve her business. She opened her secondhand store in 2014 with her own working capital of $180. She will use the loan to buy long sleeves, short sleeves, long pants and shorts. She is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. Grasiela is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy long sleeves, short sleeves, long pants and shorts

loans.name: Rutchell

texts.en:
Rutchell is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her business buying and selling rice.

Rutchell has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from farming rice and selling rice bran.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is a repeat client of UGAFODE Microfinance who applied for a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings. She runs a small shop dealing in old shoes in Markansign, and has been doing this for more than five years. 

The purpose of the loan is to restock her business with daily household items like soap, sugar and flour, among other items, so that she can increase her earnings to maintain her family, pay tuition for her siblings and develop herself. Zainabu is an honest and very hardworking lady, but is always limited by capital. 

She intends to shift from a smaller room to a bigger room in Mbarara town, where she says turnover and profit margins are higher than where she is currently operating. She is greatful to Kiva lenders for the job well done.

loans.use: To buy retail stock to sell to her customers

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine lives in Brnakot village with her husband, son and daughter. Marine works at a local factory as a milkmaid, and her husband and son are herdsmen.

The family also runs their own farm, which includes cows, calves and chickens, and cultivates wheat, barley and potatoes. The gathered harvest they sell in the local markets to earn income for a living.
 
The requested loan of USD $2,600 will be a great support for Marine to pay for forage for feeding the livestock. 

This hardworking family hopes for Kiva lenders' support and goodwill.

As this is Marine's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance-loan program provides loans to people who didn't have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Marlene Janeth

texts.es: Marlene: Es originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 27 años de edad, casada, tiene 1 hijo, menor de edad. Con el propósito de brindarle a su familia una vivienda digna y segura desde hace 4 años ha iniciado poco a poco la construcción de su vivienda de minifalda de concreto y madera. Solicita financiamiento para comprar materiales de construcción: hierro, cemento, arena, bloques y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es tener  una vivienda que le brinde las condiciones necesarias.
texts.en: Marlene is a native of Puerto Cabezas. She is 27 years old. She is married and has one son, who is a minor. With the goal of offering her family a worthy and secure home, she began the construction of her minifalda home [a house with a cement base and wooden walls] little by little four years ago. She is applying for financing to buy construction materials: iron, cement, sand, and blocks, and to cover the cost of labor. Her dream is to have a home that offers her the necessary conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials: iron, cement, sand, and blocks, and to cover labor costs

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
Delfina is applying for a loan of $800 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 29 years old. She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as water, body lotion, milk, eggs, oils, shampoo, soap, bread and fish. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.

Delfina is living in a town near by the school; her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy including students.

loans.use: to buy water, body lotion, milk, eggs, oils, shampoo, soap, bread and fish.

loans.name: Yansi Elisa

texts.es: Yansi de 22 años de edad vive con su grupo familiar conformado por su madre y hermanos. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida como empleada en un vivero, su madre presta sus servicios domésticos y sus hermanos también aportan a la economía familiar. Yansi desea construir un corredor en su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, lámina y madera para construir un corredor en su vivienda.
texts.en: Yansi, 22, lives with her mother and siblings. She is an entrepreneurial woman, making a living working in a nursery. Her mother works as a domestic employee and her siblings also contribute to the household finances. Yansi wants to build a hallway in her home, so she has asked FUSAI for a loan to buy cement, sand, gravel, tin sheeting and wood.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, tin sheeting and wood to build a hallway in her home.

loans.name: Xiomara Mercedes

texts.es:
La joven Xiomara Mercedes, es madre de 2 hijos pequeños, labora como enfermera en unos de los centros hospitalarios de la Ciudad de León desde hace 4 años, inicia sus labores desde las 07:00 am finalizando a las 03:00 pm como este mismo horario de lunes a sábado, ella realiza esta labor para llevar el sustento a su hogar.

La joven Xiomara, solicito este crédito a Ceprodel para la  compra de cerámica, cemento y pago de mano de obra, para la remodelación de su humilde vivienda, lo cual le permitirá mejorar el nivel de vida de ella como de sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Xiomara Mercedes is the mother of two young children. She works as a nurse in one of the hospitals in the city of Leon. She has done this work for 4 years, beginning her day at 7am and ending at 3pm, Monday through Saturday. She works to take care of her household.

Xiomara asks for a loan from Ceprodel to buy tile, cement and pay labor for a remodel of her humble home, which will allow her to improve the quality of life for herself and her small children.

loans.use: to buy tile and cement and pay for labor.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Analie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell fertilizer business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear.  Analie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer to sell for her fertilizer business.

Analie has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer to sell

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 53 years old and married with nine children, two of whom are in school. 

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Catalina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feeds for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from fish vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Endang

texts.en:
Endang lives in Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta.  Bogor is known as a rain city. Endang manages a small shop selling snacks, drinks, household utilities, and mobile phone airtime credit.  

This small shop that he manages happens to be his main source of income. Endang is married and living with his two wonderful daughters and a very cute son in the family home.  His children are not yet going to schools.

Endang believe that Ruma could help him improve his business.  With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Endang sees improvements in his shop. He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions so that he will be able to increase his income in order to send all his children to school.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payments transactions on a weekly basis.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy enough coal to sell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina: Es originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 37 años de edad,  madre soltera de 3 hijos, en edad escolar. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 18 años se dedica al acopio de langosta. Solicita financiamiento para comprar langosta y venderla aprecios accesibles. Su sueño es establecer una pulpería.
texts.en: Marian is a native of Puerto Cabezas. She is 37 years old. She is the single mother of three children of school age. With the goal of having her own source of income, she has worked for 18 years in the bulk buying of lobsters. She is applying for financing to buy lobsters and sell them at affordable prices. Her dream is to establish a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy lobsters.

loans.name: Sataya

texts.en:
Sataya is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending  business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food business like flour, oil, sugar, milk, etc., for her food vending  business.

Sataya has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from selling charcoal.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food business like flour, oil, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 34 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

She has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from vegetable vending.  Vicenta aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Zenaida works hard to support her family.

She has a  jewelry-making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Zenaida is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like gold, silver, etc., for her making jewelry business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requests an additional loan to further build her business.

Zenaida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like gold, silver, etc.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Fatuma has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Idalco

texts.es: Idalco: Es un hombre trabajador, originario de Waspam, , tiene 66 años, tiene  5 hijos, mayores de edad. Con el propósito de mejorar su vivienda de tambo de madera desde hace 3 años poco a poco ha iniciado el proceso de mejoramiento. Solicita financiamiento para comprar materiales de construcción: postes de madera, clavos, zinc, madera cepillada y cubrir costos de mano de obra.  Su sueño es acondicionar su vivienda de madera.
texts.en:
Idalco is a working man, originally from Waspám, aged 66, with 5 children, all of them grown up.

To improve his wooden house, over the last three years he has bit by bit begun the process of improving it. 

He requests a loan to buy building materials including wood, nails, zinc, sanded timber and to cover labor costs. 

His dream is to renovate his wooden house.

loans.use: To improve his home made of woode planks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animals to sell.

loans.name: Darwin Antonio

texts.es: Darwin de 27 años de edad vive junto a su grupo familiar. Él es un joven emprendedor que se gana la vida como motorista de un camión en el cual distribuye diferentes granos de la canasta básica como: frijol, maíz, arroz, azúcar, maicillo, etc. Darwin desea mejorar las paredes y el piso de su vivienda, además desea reparar el techo de la misma por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo de piso, teja y madera, además deberá pagar mano de obra necesaria para realizar dichas mejoras.
texts.en: Darwin is 27 years old and lives with his extended family. He is an enterprising young man who earns a living as a truck driver delivering various staple supplies, such as beans, corn, rice, sugar, millet, etc. Darwin hopes to make improvements to the walls and floor of his home, as well as repair the roof of the same. So he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, floor tiles, roof tiles and wood, and also pay for the manpower needed to make these repairs.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, gravel, floor tiles, roof tiles and wood, and also pay for the manpower needed to make improvements to his home.
