loans.name: Sop Mame Diarra 2" Beug Manal Sa Bop" Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Sop Mame Diarra 2 « Beug Manal Sa Bop » est un sous groupe d’un réseau de femmes commerçantes et transformatrices de produits halieutiques. Il est composé de cinq femmes qui s’activent depuis plusieurs années et qui se sont regroupées pour bénéficier d’un appui financier qui leur permettra de renforcer leurs activités génératrices de revenus. Madame Amy, la présidente s’active dans la restauration où elle a acquis une expérience de 9 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants dont l’ainé, une fille, est âgée de 20 ans et le benjamin, 5 ans. Amy vit dans la maison de son père où elle a construit une cantine pour exercer son activité de restauration. Elle dépense chaque jour 20 000f et a un bénéfice de 5 000f par jour pour le déjeuner et 8 000f pour le diner. Elle est active 7j/7. Son mari travaillant dans une autre ville, c’est pourquoi il s’est installé chez son père où elle donne sa participation dans la dépense quotidienne en achetant un sac de riz et en donnant quinze milles francs par semaine.
Elle a comme projet d’agrandir et d’aménager son restaurant pour attirer plus de clients.
texts.en:
The loan group Sop Mame Diarra 2 “Beug Manal Sa Bop” is a sub-group of a network of women who process seafood. The group is composed of five women, who have been active for several years and who have come together to benefit from financial support enabling them to bolster their revenue-generating businesses. 

Ms. Amy, the president, has been active in the restaurant business in which she has acquired nine years of experience. She is a married mother of five children, of whom the oldest, a girl, is 20 years old, and the youngest is 5.  

Amy lives in her father’s house, where she built a place to operate her restaurant. Each day, she spends 20,000 francs and has a profit of 5,000 francs a day from lunch and 8,000 francs from dinner. She is active seven days a week. Her husband works in another town. This is why [she] is set up at her father’s place to help cover day-to-day expenses by buying a sack of rice and by giving 15,000 francs a week. Her plans include expanding and fixing up her restaurant to attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase condiments for making restaurant meals

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les 4 membres du groupe BENKADI sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans et ont en moyenne 6 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des familles traditionnelles à DOGONI une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils  collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur sixième prêt de production de maïs avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de maïs  avec monsieur BAKARY debout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme BENKADI. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter  16 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 20 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  320 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part de contribuer  les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The four members of the group BENKADI are married men, who average 46 years of age and six children each. The men live for the most part in traditional families in DOGONI, a commune in Cercle de SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The men are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan for producing corn with the institution. The past loans were correctly paid back. 

The crop grown is corn, as is the case with Mr. BAKARY, who is standing first from the left in the photo of this men’s group BENKADI. With his loan, he intends to pay for sixteen 50-kg sacks of fertilizer, 20 containers of herbicide of different qualities, and plowing to maintain 2 hectares. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village and in SIKASSO. He hopes to make an average profit of 320,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable him in part to pay back his loan with interest, as well as to help cover day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for fertilize and plowing

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Charito has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Charito would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Tugumane Group

texts.fr:
Rémy  fait partie du groupe  Tugumane et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il  a 45 ans et est marié à Ngabireyimana, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 3 à 12 ans dont 3 étudient.

Il fait le commerce de  bière de banane depuis  25 ans. 

Il est son  deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bananes pour la préparation de la bière de banane à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  acheter un moulin, et voir se enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Rémy is part of the group Tugumane and lives in Bujumbura. He is 45 years old and married to Ngabireyimana, a farmer. Together they have five children, from 3 to 12 years old, of whom three are students. 

Rémy has been doing commerce in banana beer for 25 years. 

He is on his second Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and to purchase a large amount of bananas to make banana beer, so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, he would like to buy a mill (grinder) and to see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of bananas to make banana beer to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 38 years old and married with three children, who are all attending school. Judith works very hard to provide for them.

Judith's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Judith has restarted her food-vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Judith has taken a 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Judith is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in the future, would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 50 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Estelita is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and rice barn.

Estelita has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and rice barn

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her food vending business and is now requesting a PHP 9,171 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help Jonalyn will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future Jonalyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is 65 years old and widowed with three children.

Deborah works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 26,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like diapers, canned goods, detergent, soap, shampoo, cereals, milk, etc., to sell.

Deborah has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 40 years and also earns an income from house rental.

Deborah aspires to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like diapers, canned goods, detergent, soap, shampoo, cereals, milk, etc., to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 64 years old, married and has three children. 

Josephine and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Josephine is taking out a housing loan amounting to 9714.20 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Josephine has been an NWTF borrower since 2011. She plans to recover through her food-vending business.

With your help, Josephine can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Dzine

texts.en:
Dzine is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water.

She has operated a food-vending business for the past three years, cooking chapati (flat bread), mahamri rice and beans. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for her food-vending business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for her food-vending busines

loans.name: Deolfa

texts.en:
Deolfa is 54 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Deolfa works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

Deolfa has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma works hard to support her family. Vilma is married and has a buy and sell livestock business in the Philippines.

Vilma requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Vilma has been in this business for 5 years now.

Vilma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es:
La señora Mayra, es madre soltera de 1 hijo el cual está en edad escolar, labora como responsable de estadísticas en unos de los centros hospitalarios de la ciudad de León, se dedica a esta labor desde hace 26 años, inicia sus labores de 07:00 am y finalizándolas a las 04:00 pm de lunes a viernes en este mismo horario, el realiza esta labor para la mantención de su hogar.

Doña Mayra,  se acercó a Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito el que utilizo  para gastos médicos como es la realización de exámenes especiales, lo cual le permitirá recuperar su salud en el menor tiempo posible.
texts.en:
Mayra is a single mother to one school-aged son. Mayra is a statistician at a local hospital in the city of León. She has been doing this work for 26 years, starting work at 7am and finishing at 4pm. She works Monday to Friday, all to look after her household. 

Mayra has come to Ceprodel in order to apply for a loan that she will use to cover medical expenses, such as pay for special tests. This will allow Mayra to recover to full health in as short a time as possible.

loans.use: to pay medical expenses (special tests).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise (fizzy drinks) and make improvements to her premises.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia es una mujer madre de familia dedicada a sus 4 hijos. Tiene 39 años de edad y vive en Ica junto a su esposo e hijos.
Su familia es su mayor motivación en la vida, es por ellos que siempre se ha esforzado en todo lo que hace para poder brindarles un futuro mejor.
Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación y con la ayuda de su esposo pudo abrir una pequeña bodega y vende diversos productos a los clientes, le va muy bien porque es responsable, trabajadora, honesta y sobre todo porque siempre trabaja con ética.
Celia está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para implementar el negocio, de esta manera sus ingresos incrementará y podrá sacar adelante a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Celia is a mother who is dedicated to her four children. She is 39 years old and lives with her husband and children in Ica.

Celia's family is her greatest motivation in life. It is for them that she puts in so much effort to everything that she does, so that she may offer them a better a future.

With a lot of effort and dedication, and with the help of her husband, Celia was able to open a small shop. There she sells various products to her customers. Her business is going very well because Celia is responsible, hard-working, honest and, above all, because she is ethical.

Celia is very grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to their support, she will be able to buy merchandise for her business. With this loan, Celia's income will increase and she will be able to move forward with her family and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is married with eight children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. 

Mwaka operates a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 15,000 KES, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 58 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Emma is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase vaccines, feed and vitamins for her business.

Emma has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, feed and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 57 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Jesusa is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jesusa has been in pig fattening for 23 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a widow with four children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. 

Fatuma operates a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 10,000 KES, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for higher education costs (payment of university modules).

loans.name: Shiela Mae

texts.en:
Shiela Mae works hard to support her family. She is married and has a personal products business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like body lotion, perfume, soap and other personal items. She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Shiela Mae would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like body lotion, perfume, soap and other personal items.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Marites works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling roasted whole pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Marites is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to buy more pigs and ingredients for her business.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and ingredients for her business

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 42 years old, married and has two children who are both in school.

Mary Ann is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Mary Ann has been farming rice for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane, aged 45, is married and has two children, one of whom  is still in school. Mary Jane is in the agricultural business, and has been raising livestock in the Philippines for the past three years. 

Mary Jane has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She is now requesting a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, feed and other supplies for her business.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, feed and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: Jose es casado tiene dos hijos y vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a su familia y tiene casi todos los servicios basicos Jose es emepleado de un Banco y necesita un prestamo para pagar un curso de actualizacion Jose es la unica fuente de ingresos en el hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Jose is married and has two children. He lives in La Paz, in a house made with cement and bricks that belongs to his family. He has access to basic utilities.

Jose works for a bank and needs a loan to pay for a course to update his knowledge. Jose is the family's only source of income, which is why he needs help.

loans.use: to pay for a course to update his knowledge.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Nida works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from farming corn. 

Nida has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She is now borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her fishing business. 

Nida hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Reyhana

texts.en:
Reyhana is 33 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines which she has been doing for 11 years. She earns additional income from her general store.

Reyhana is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Melvit

texts.en:
Melvit is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns additional income from raising cattle.

Melvit has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She is now borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishing net, fish containers, etc. for her business.

She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fishing net, fish containers, etc. for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new collection of children's clothes for the new season.

loans.name: Joey

texts.en:
Joey, aged 49, is a very hard-working man. For financial reasons, he wasn't able to continue attending school: he only managed to finish the second year of basic education. Joey is married and his wife runs a store and takes care of the home. He has children.

Joey has always worked in agriculture, both on his own and for others. His work day is from 5 a.m. until 1 p.m. In the afternoon, he collects firewood and takes care of a couple of pigs that he is fattening.

Joey needs the loan to buy fertilizers because it's time to fertilize his rice field. Currently, he doesn't have the money that he needs: he decided to request the loan so his crop will grow properly.

Joey's dream is for his children to be able to go to college and become true professionals, because they'll have better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers because it's time to fertilize his rice field

loans.name: Slivestre

texts.en:
This is Slivestre. He previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that he used to pay for spare parts, accessories and the maintenance of their Jeepney unit. His earnings were a big help for his children's education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

Slivestre would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan so he can pay for spare parts and the maintenance of their Jeepney unit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and his children's educational expenses. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Slivestre hopes to operate another Jeepney unit and he also dreams for his children that they will finish their education. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of his Jeepney unit.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert, aged 23, is still single. He sells assorted candies for a living: in this business, he earns a net income of PHP 6,000 weekly. Albert's income is usually spent on his daily expenses and those of his parents.

Due to insufficient capital in his business. Albert would like to take out a loan amounting to PHP 13,000 to  purchase sugar, tamarind, sweet potatoes, food colorings, milk, and vanilla to use in candy making. He is hoping that his business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, tamarind, sweet potatoes, food colorings, milk, and vanilla to use in candy making.

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en:
Arthur, aged 45, is married and has five children. They currently live in a rural community and make their living through farming. 

Due to financial constraints, Arthur aims to improve his pig-raising business to generate a higher income. He is planning to acquire more piglets to raise but he has inadequate capital. For this reason, Arthur would like to take out a loan of PHP 36,000 to buy pig feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. 

Being a hard-working father, Arthur believes that someday he will improve his business as well as his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pig feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

location.town: Brgy. Sto. Domingo, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
For more than twelve years, Lilian has run a retail store that brings increasing cash inflows that support daily expenditures. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, which was used for buying additional inventory of goods to sell. 

To improve her business is her desire, for she always wants to ensure a better source of income for her family's future security. To offer more goods, she took a new loan to purchase additional goods to sell. She is determined to provide a better living for the family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Valleza

texts.en:
Valleza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling ready to wear in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of ready to wear to sell to her customers for her business selling ready to wear.

Valleza has been in this business for 11 years. Valleza earns more income from food vending.

Valleza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready to wear to sell to her customers

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 65 years old and widowed with six children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Victoria is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Victoria has been raising pigs for 10 years, and also earns additional income from food vending.  She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Eleonora

texts.en:
Managing a retail store is the primary activity of Eleonora who helps her husband with generating income to sustain the necessities of their family. She is 43-years-old and blessed with five children. Due to the high cost of school fees, she aspires to make her business more profitable in order to support the education of her children. She plans to acquire more grocery items to sell, but she has insufficient capital. 

For this reason, she would like to request a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy additional stock of frozen foods, soft drinks, canned goods, soaps, beverages, seasonings, noodles, junk foods and assorted candies to resell. She hopes that her loan will enable her to improve more of her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of frozen foods, soft drinks, canned goods, soaps, beverages, seasonings, noodles, junk foods and assorted candies to resell

location.town: Brgy. Sto. Domingo, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en: Edgar, 45-years-old and married, lives in Delfin Albano where the main crop is rice. He has been engaged in a farming business for ten years. Farming is the only way to get their daily needs. Every crop he earns PHP 50,000 where he divides it for his obligation.  And some of his money he saves it to sustain the needs of his children. Edgar hopes that he can give a higher education to his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to grow

loans.name: Aloice

texts.en:
Aloice is 30-years-old and married to Nancy, who is a saloonist and helps with additional income for the family.  They are blessed with one child who is one and a half years old.

He has been in the transport business for the last five years and earns a monthly income of KES. 17,000.  He has applied for his second loan of KES 20,000, which he will use to buy more fuel and spare wheels to repair his motorcycle.

He will use the anticipated profits to provide for his family's basic needs.  In the future, he plans to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more fuel and spare wheels to repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Paskalia

texts.en:
Paskalia is 52 years old and married to Obure, who also helps to bring in additional income for the family.  They are blessed with seven children, who are between the ages of two and 28 years.

She has been selling clothes for the last 17 years, and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. She has applied for her fourth loan of KES 40,000, which she will use to buy more stock of clothes for sale.

She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.  In the future, she plans to grow her business, give her children a good education and also open another stall.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Gemalyn

texts.en:
Gemalyn works hard to support her family. Gemalyn is single and has a beauty parlor business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items like hair wax, conditioner, shampoo, etc.

Gemalyn has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Gemalyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items like hair wax, conditioner, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 48-years-old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Gemma has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling ready to wear.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Honesto

texts.en:
Honesto has faithfully paid back his previous loan which he used for his business. He has been engaged in a pharmacy business for years now, and he earns well from this. He sustains all his needs through his business while ably helping his family at the same time. He also works hard with the determination of having a better income.

To improve sales, Honesto is requesting a new loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase additional merchandise to sell, specifically more quantities and varieties of medicine products to expand his inventory. He sincerely expresses his heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

Honesto hopes to become financially stable someday so that he could help more people or even hire his own employees. He dreams that he will have enough savings for he desires to travel around the world before he chooses to retire. He meets with his co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy medicines, groceries, and other products, to stock both his pharmacy and his variety store

loans.name: Nelsy

texts.es: Nelsy se dedica a la venta de almuerzos y comidas desde hace 14 años, cuando inició su negocio en el año 2014. Ella es una mujer viuda y madre de 3 hijos en edades de adulta y muy conciente de las oportunidades de mercado que existen a su alrededor, pues habita en una zona industrial y sus principales clientes son los empleados de gramndes, meianas pequeñas y microempresas, que muy cerca a ella trabajan y necesitan alimentarse a un precio ajustado a sus posibilidades.Ella trabaja diariamente y solo descansa los domingos, pues su meta es adecuar la terraza de  su casa con un buen techo y adicionar abanicos,para hacer de la estadia de su clientela u espacio agradable u tranquilo. Su mayor desafio de vida lo vivió aql quear viuda, pero poco a poco y con mucho esfeurzo ha salido adelante. En la actualidad está aplicando aunc redikiva, primer financiemiento qeu hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará sillas y mesas plásticas, insumos para aumentar su producción de almuerzos y realizar adecuaciones a su local pondiendo una cubierta.
texts.en:
Nelsy has been selling lunches and dinners for fourteen years. She is a widow, mother of three adult children. She is aware of the business opportunities around her, since she lives in an industrial area. Her customers are mainly employees from all the companies in the area, both large and small, who are constantly looking for affordable food.

Nelsy works every day and rests on Sundays. Her goal is to refurbish the terrace of her house, installing a new roof and some electric fans in order to create a comfortable and calm place for her customers. Becoming a widow has been her biggest challenge so far. However, step by step and with a lot of effort, she has been able to get ahead.

She is requesting a CrediKiva, which is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will buy plastic chairs and tables, and ingredients to prepare more food. She will also make some improvements, like hanging a canopy over the terrace.

loans.use: to buy plastic chairs and tables, and ingredients to prepare food. Also, to hang a canopy over her terrace.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Florence a very industrious, honest and hardworking woman who hails from Chuka area of Kenya, an area that is near the famous Mount Kenya. She is 44 years of age and has been doing farming for the past 22 years and through those years, she has gathered so much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village.  She has been practicing mixed farming and her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, tea, crops and some small businesses that she does so that she can make ends meet.

Florence is very passionate about farming and she loves cultivating her farm.  That is why everyday she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plow.  Although Florence makes profits through farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income through selling of cereals.  That is why she is seeking a loan to buy cereals. Chuka area is one of the regions that is populated and has a high demand for cereals.  That means that Florence will make more profits and be able to satisfy the demand that is there.

Accessing funds has been a challenge for Florence, but she feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing.  Florence believes that this loan will be of much help and she will be able to satisfy the demand that is there for cereals and she believes that the extra income will allow permanent change to her life and increase her business.

Increased profits will allow Florence to repay back the loan and secure the future of her school going children.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is a widowed mother of four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mila is 45 years old and has two children who are in school.

Mila's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her agriculture business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Mila is taking out a 7,342 PHP housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Mila has been with NWTF since 2011 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Mila would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Porferia

texts.en:
Porferia is 47 years old, married, and has six children, three who are in school.

Porferia and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Porferia is taking out a housing loan of 9714 PHP to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Porferia has been an NWTF borrower since 2011. She plans to recover through her business of buying and selling fish.

With your help, Porferia can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Wajeda Al-Wadi Group

texts.en:
Wajeda Al-Wadi is a group which is comprised of four women members who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 110,000 YER from AMB.

Wajeda is the leader of the group. She is a 54-year-old married woman with six children living in their own house in the capital city of Sana'a. Wajeda is a very active and dynamic woman, and she works as a housewife while her husband  is the sole breadwinner of the family. His income varies. Due to the variable income of the father, the family deals with  financial crisis constantly. That financial difficulty makes them lack of most types of food. As a result, Wajeda applied for a loan of 30,000 in order to purchase food for the house such as flour, sugar, meat, potatoes, tomatoes and other food  to meet the family's needs inside the house and to make delicious meals for them.

Wajeda looks forward to preparing the the food at her house. She hopes to build a second floor and rent the first one.

loans.use: to purchase food for the house such as flour, sugar, meats, potatoes, and tomatoes, and other food in order to meet all the family's needs inside the house.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is 42 years old and married with two children. 

Bernadeth is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Bernadeth requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Bernadeth has been in pig fattening for seven years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Bernadeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sop Mame Diarra 3"beug Manal Sa Bop" Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Sop Mame Diarra 3 « Beug Manal Sa Bop » est un sous groupe d’un réseau de femmes commerçantes et transformatrices de produits halieutiques. Il est composé de cinq femmes qui s’activent depuis plusieurs années et qui se sont regroupées pour bénéficier d’un appui financier qui leur permettra de renforcer leurs activités génératrices de revenus. Sokhna est la présidente ; elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle évolue dans la vente de tissus et divers comme bijoux, pochettes…Elle a démarré son activité il y a plus de 10 ans avec une tontine qu’elle avait reçu ; depuis lors elle développe son commerce. Sokhna s’occupe de la garde robe de ses enfants ; c’est comme cela qu’elle se voit participer à la gestion de son foyer.
Elle aimerait dans l’avenir, ouvrir un grand local, continuer à exercer son activité mais aussi chercher un ou deux tailleurs pour confectionner des ensembles, exposer pour vendre.
texts.en: The Sop Mame Diarra 3 "Beug Manal Sa Bop" Credit Group is an affiliate group of a network of businesswomen and women who work with seafood. This group is made up of five members who have been working for many years and who have come together in order to benefit from financial aid which will allow them to reinforce their money-generating activities. Sokhna is the group's president; she is a married mother. She sells fabrics and various other products, such as jewellery and handbags. She has been doing this for over 10 years with the support of money she received as part of a tontine. She has since developed her business. Sokhna is in charge of clothing her children. This is how she contributes to running her household. In the future, she would like to open her own shop and carry on her business there. She would also like to hire a couple of tailors to create whole outfits, which she could then resell.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and various other items, such as handbags and jewellery, which they will then resell

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel, se ha mantenido generando ingresos con la facilidad que le dio el crédito anterior de comprar los materiales para enjuncar camas y sillas, su situación económica ha mejorado positivamente y las condiciones de vida de su familia son más favorables.
Se ha decidido a solicitar un nuevo crédito que en esta ocasión le será de utilidad para comprar junco, clavos, masera e insumos agrícolas, seguirá realizando los trabajos de carpintería y tendrá todo los materiales básicos para cultivar maíz con lo que mejorara la alimentación de su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel has kept on earning an income with the gift of the previous loan, for buying the materials to cane beds and chairs.  His financial situation has improved and his family's living conditions are more favorable.

He decided to request another loan, which this time will be useful for him for buying rush, nails, wood, and agricultural inputs.

He will keep on doing carpentry work and will have all the basic supplies for growing corn to improve his family's nutrition.

loans.use: to buy rush, nails, wood, and agricultural inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and soil amendments to prepare the land for planting

loans.name: Roy

texts.en:
This is Roy. He is 45 years old and married. 

He is engaged in farming in the Philippines where he can meet all the needs of his family. 

Roy is asking for a loan amounting PHP 19,000. He plan to use his loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and seed to grow.

Roy's dreams is to see his children finish their studies to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide and seed to grow.

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
Generosa works hard to support her family. Generosa is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years now.

She requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase a bundle of fishing net.

In the future, Generosa would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a special barber chair

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn, 36, is a married woman with four children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jenelyn has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Jenelyn requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase groceries to sell in her general store.

In the future, Jenelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 34 years old and has two children. She is married, and her children are in school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her business.

Jocelyn has been raising pigs for one year now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma, 45 years old, is married with three kids. She is a very loving and diligent person. She and her husband are engaged in a farming business. 

To have additional income, she is requesting a loan amounting Php 18,000 to buy additional farm products such as fertilizer and seeds to grow.

Vilma hopes that she can provide for all the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional farm products such as fertilizer and seeds to grow.

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher is a 22-year-old single man from Beddya, a village near Nablus city. He lives with his family in a small house. 

Maher has a store for selling shoes in the city. It has been open for the past one year. It is a good business and the income is high.
 
Maher took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new collection for his shoe store. By taking this loan, Maher will be able to increase his sales and improve the store.
 
Maher appears in the photo in his store.

loans.use: to buy a new collection for his shoe store.

loans.name: Mayolita

texts.en:
Mayolita, is aged 43, widowed and has three children. She has been into a retailing business in their village for almost 22  years, and earns a net income of PHP 5,000 weekly. 

Due to insufficient funds, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 50,000 to purchase dried fish and mungbeans to sell. 

She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish and mungbeans to sell.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is very thankful for the assistance extended to her, as she was able to purchase products for her direct selling business. Her income from the loan assisted with her everyday expenditures. She is also working hard to provide for the everyday needs of her family.

She would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan. It will be used to buy additional supplies and merchandise, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Sandra hopes to grow her business and to attract more customers. She dreams of having her own house and good health for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business, and also to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 38 years old and has three children. She is married, and her children are in school.

Josephine is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Josephine has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 45 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. Cecilia works very hard to provide for them.

Cecilia runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, diapers, sanitary pads, toothpaste, soft-drinks and other groceries.  

Cecilia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like noodles, diapers, sanitary pads, toothpaste, soft drinks and other groceries to sell.

In the future, Cecilia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like noodles, diapers, sanitary pads, toothpaste, soft drinks and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Geresomu

texts.en:
Geresomu lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is aged 44, married, and has nine children and seven of them attend school. 

He owns a produce store where he sells mainly maize, and he makes extra income through farming. His major problem is competition. 

His future plan is to build a good house for his family. 

He is hardworking and will use the loan to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Leonora is 44 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

She has a weaving native mats business in the Philippines. Leonora requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for her business.

Leonora has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her business

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 56 years old and has four children.  She is married, and has children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Joyce requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Joyce has been for 15 years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 46 years old and married with three children.  With two children in school, Gloria works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Gloria has been in this business for five years.

In the future she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a married father of two, born in 1982. He is a Palestinian refugee who puts so much effort into developing his family’s living, especially since most of the Palestinians have limited access to several working sectors in Lebanon.

Mahmoud has a small supermarket (grocery store) which he established in November, 2007, with 12 years of experience in this domain.

He is a hard worker, well known in his region for the special products he displays in addition to the affordable prices he sets.

Mahmoud is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua in order to increase his business merchandise with new released products, special offer products and summer beverages. 

He hopes to keep on expanding and developing his business in a well managed way, and to open another branch in the future.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with new released products, special offer products and summer beverages.

loans.name: Enerson

texts.en:
Enerson is 37 years old, married, and blessed with five children. Enerson is a high school graduate who found it hard to find a good job to sustain the needs of his family. That's why he decided to focus on his business. 

He is simple farmer in their community. He is a very responsible father. 

Enerson is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 18,000 to buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticide for his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticide for his business.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
A very responsible mother, Josie is 40 years old and has three kids. She has been engaged in a farming business for almost 10 years. 

Josie is asking a loan amounting Php 19,000 to buy insecticide, fertilizer and seed so that they have additional income and she can sustain all the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, 50, is a married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Elizabeth has a bag-making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years.

Elizabeth requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy materials for her bag-making business. 

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her bag making.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is 36 years old and married with six children. With three children currently in school, Ma. Teresa works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Ma. Teresa has been in this business for 10 years, and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, shampoo, canned goods, beers, soft drinks, cereals, coffee, etc. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 30 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Julieta is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

Julieta has been pig fattening  for five years, and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Savoern's Group

texts.en:
Savoern, aged 44, lives in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district and has four children. She and her husband are farmers who have been growing rice to make a living; sometimes she works for others for a fee. She has been in this business for 15 years. 

This is the micro loan for Savoern’s group of two members who are both female. She is a first cycle client with VisionFund. Now requesting a loan, Savoern, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. 

She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 54 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Liza has been in this business for 12 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona was born in 1966 and has an elementary level of education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is an employee, but his salary is not enough for him to cover his family’s expenses, which made Mona 20 years ago decide to stand beside her husband and start working as a tailor from her house.

Hand in hand with her husband, Mona succeeded in improving her family’s financial situation. Today, she is acquiring a loan to open her own tailoring shop, which will help her increase her income, and thus, provide her children with a better future.

This loan will help Mona own the tailoring shop she always dreamed about and guarantee the future of her beloved children.

loans.use: To open her own tailoring shop, which will help her increase her income, and thus, provide her children with a better future.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 39 years old and married to Maurice, who also helps bring in additional income to the family. They are blessed with four children aged between 17 and 7 years old.

She has been running a restaurant for the last 17 years and earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). She has applied for a fourth loan of 55,000 KES, which she will use to buy more stock of cooking oil, flour and salt for use in the restaurant.

Judith will use the anticipated profits to provide for her family's basic needs. In the future, she plans to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cooking oil, flour and salt

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 46 years old and has five children. Alma is married, and all five children are in school.

Alma is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Alma requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Alma has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Hermenia

texts.en:
Hermenia is 42 years old and married. She has two children. 

Hermenia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been in the pig-fattening business for eight years now, and she has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Hermenia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Hermenia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Om Al- Mas Group

texts.en:
Om Al-Mas is a group which is comprised of four women members who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 130,000 YER from AMB.

Kaima is the leader of the group. She is a 40-year-old married woman, living with her spouse in their own  house in the capital city of Sana'a. Kaima is a very active and dynamic woman; she works as a housewife, and her husband is the breadwinner of the family.  He has immigrated outside the home in order to provide his family with a better future. He sends money for his family monthly. Some months, Kaima's husband doesn't send money for her because of some circumstances of his business. That thing affects negatively the living standards inside Kaima's house. As a result, Kaima applied for a loan of 40,000 to purchase food materials for the house such as flour, sugar, meats, potatoes, tomatoes, and other food materials in order to face all the demands of the family's needs and to make delicious meals for her family.

Kaima looks forward to preparing the house with all of the food materials inside the house. 

She hopes to build a second floor, and rent the first one in order to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase food materials for the house as flour, sugar, meats, potatoes, tomatoes, and other food materials in order to face all the demands of family's needs

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio owns and operates a Jeepney unit. He has been successful in this business for 25 years, and he repaid his previous loan used for the business. He also finds ways to improve his income to provide their everyday needs and necessities.

Relative to this, he would like to take a new loan to buy spare parts and accessories for the vehicle. He is requesting an amount of PHP 30,000 for the maintenance of the Jeepney unit, and to buy other materials needed in his business. He sincerely expresses his heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Virgilio hopes to buy another Jeepney unit, and desires to improve their financial status. He meets with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his work. That is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of his Jeepney (public transport vehicle).

loans.name: Idah

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders, the above picture presents to you Idah, a woman who is 40 years of age and a dedicated farmer and a mother of four lovely school-going children. She hails from the Chuka area of Kenya, an area that is at the slopes of the famous Mount Kenya. 

Idah is a very dedicated farmer who does farming with a lot of passion and has been practicing mixed farming for the past 12 years. Through those years, she has raised her family by providing for them the basic needs they require. Her primary sources of income are eggs, milk and a small personal business that she does to make ends meet.

Idah loves dairy farming, and an animal on her farm has been given the name of Gatune (from a person’s name). Her biggest challenge in farming has been a lack of funds to increase her business.

Idah is seeking a loan to buy cereals to be able to sell them to the nearby market and to her neighbors. The Chuka area has a high population, and the demand for cereals has been so high, but the supply is low; that is why Idah, who is having an entrepreneur's mind, wants to take advantage of the ready market and be able to make more profits.

Idah is very visionary, and she plans that through the increased income from selling cereals, she will allow permanent change of her life and increase her business to other markets.

Idah has gone through training from Juhudi Kilimo, and she is more disciplined with finances. She hopes that through accumulated profits, she will pay back the loan and improve her living conditions permanently. Idah waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Naim

texts.en:
Naim was born in 1988, has intermediate level of education, and is married and has one child.

Six years ago, he started working as a furniture painter, and his income wasn’t enough to cover his family’s expenses. So he thought of buying additional equipment for his shop that will help him expand his work and increase his income; that’s why he is a acquiring a youth loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua.

This loan is very important for Naim. He will be able to live with his family in better conditions and plan for a better future for his child.

loans.use: To buy additional equipment for his shop that will help him expand his work and increase his income

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a business selling native mats and brooms in the Philippines.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Soledad requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more native mats and brooms to sell.

She has been in this business for 24 years now.

Soledad would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more native mats and brooms to sell

loans.name: Melagros

texts.en:
Melagros works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing net.

Melagros has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net

loans.name: Ruyanja Group

texts.en:
Penninah operates a restaurant alongside a retail shop in Hoima, Uganda. She stared business so as to develop her family. Penninah desires to educate her children. However, price flactuations affect her profitability thus hindering her dream.

She is a member of Ruyanja nigina where members guarantee each other in order to access credit.

She is acquiring credit to buy materials such as cement and sand to build her house.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cement and sand to build her house.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 43 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Wilma runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries like feed, rice, shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell.

She has been in this business for five years, and sells a variety of items such as feeds, rice, shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, etc. 

Wilma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like feed, rice, shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Porlina

texts.en:
Porlina is 60 years old and widowed with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Porlina has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Porlina would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jose Adin

texts.es:
José, opta por un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de madera y lámina para reparar el techo de su vivienda, así evitara riesgos para su familia y podrá conservar en buen estado las pertenencias familiares, su aspiración es mejorar la vivienda.
Para José el crédito anterior le ha sido de ayuda para cultivar maíz, mejorando así la alimentación de su familia y comercializando otra parte. Su familia le apoya para seguir trabajando y mejorando su estilo de vida, en este momento José ya cuenta con un empleo de vigilante, lo que le da ingresos más estables.
texts.en: José is opting to take out a new loan to invest in the purchase of wood and sheet metal to repair the roof of his house in order to avoid risks to his family. It will allow them to keep the family belongings in good condition. Their aspiration is to improve their housing. For José, the previous loan was helpful to grow corn, thereby improving his ability to feed his family and sell in the market. His family supports him in continuing to work and improve their life conditions. Currently, José has a job as a caretaker, giving them a more stable income.

loans.use: to repair his roof

loans.name: Dong

texts.en:
Dong works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Dong has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Dong is 56 years old, and she is married with four children.

Dong supports no dependents with her business in Nong Cong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Dong's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bathroom.

With her business profit, Dong hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bathroom

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling peanuts in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of peanuts to sell.

Salvacion has been in this business for 5 years. Salvacion earns more income from raising pigs.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams that she can build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of peanuts to sell

loans.name: Yerelin Carolina

texts.es: Yerelin Carolina, tiene la edad  de 22 años, está soltera, vive con sus padres y hermanos  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras, esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Yerelin Carolina, age 22, is single.  She lives with her parents and siblings, who are her greatest priority.  With her loan she plans to buy fertilizer and fungicides and to pay for the labor in caring for the coffee.  She will also buy some nursery plants to re-seed.

Her objective for doing this is to increase the density of the plants in the area.  She will also take advantage of the ground’s good fertility, the climate conditions, and other factors that favor the coffee crop.  With these crop improvements, she hopes to get a little profit.  This way she will improve her family’s living conditions.  She will also invest a little more in the crop area and also fulfill some goals.

This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR.  She has not had any other loans from state banks.  FUDECOSUR has provided a loan with easier terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to care for the coffee crop.

loans.name: Olimpiada

texts.en:
Olimpiada is 54 years old. She lives with her pensioner brother in a small village of Tetritskaro district. 

Olimpiada has a cow and produces dairy products to sell. She has a small commercial space near her house and wants to open a food market. Olimpiada needs money to finish the started renovation of market. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 2,200 Gel (Georgia lari). With the received credit, she will finish the renovation, as well as purchase all the stock to open a market. She will run the market and will be able to increase her income. Olimpiada awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to finish renovation of the shop and purchase stock of goods to open a market

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena has been running a cafeteria for many years, and she earns well enough to bring a good cash inflow to her family. 

This cafeteria and her husband's business as a driver are their only sources of income, but they work hard and are determined to improve their standard of living.

With her generated income, her previous loan used for her cafeteria was successfully repaid. To improve sales, she took a new loan again to purchase more raw ingredients in order to cater to more customers.

She wants to improve her business in order to gain more profit to spend on improving her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients in order to cater to more customers

loans.name: Mohamad Ali

texts.en:
Mohamad Ali is a single man, born in 1987. 

His family’s financial situation wasn’t good, so twelve years ago he started working in the construction business, specializing in concrete work, so he could cover the expenses and needs of his family of six.

Life’s pressures didn’t affect Mohamad Ali’s education; he kept on attending school in addition to his work until he reached university level. Now Mohamad Ali is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to pay his university fees.

Mohamad Ali hopes to continue his studies and obtain a university certificate to build his future, which will help him find a better job with better income.

loans.use: To pay his university fees.

loans.name: Nam's Group

texts.en:
Nam, who is 61 years old, is married and has five children, three sons and two daughters. Nam and her husband make soybean products to sell to people in their community. They have run this business for 30 years.

Nam is the group leader of a five-member loan group that reside in Ho Chi Minh City. 

In the picture, Nam is in the middle wearing a blue blouse and trousers. The other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities. After many years of running a very small business, Nam would like to take a loan to increase the size of her business by buying a larger quantity and higher quality of soybeans to make better products to sell. 

Nam hopes that her business will run smoothly and she will be able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy soy beans to make soybean products to sell.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
"Mariam's group is comprised of  hard working women. Mariam is 16 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Mariam has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand  business, Mariam has requested a loan of 300000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more fresh food for sale, and will help Mariam to generate greater profits and take care of her parents. Mariam hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Mariam is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to stock for more fresh food for sale,

loans.name: Carole Cristina

texts.en:
This is Carole Cristina. She is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She has utilized the previous 14,000 PHP loan to purchase more supplies needed in furniture making, like bamboo, nails, varnish and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. She will also use portion of the loan to buy items needed for her other business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Carole Cristina hopes that her business will thrive. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for materials needed in furniture making, like bamboo, nails, varnish and materials for her other business, such as soaps and processed foods.

loans.name: Chau

texts.en:
Chau is 37 years old and is married. She has two children and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She is running a food stall to sell beef soup with  noodles. Her husband works for a local company.

She intends to use her loan to buy new furniture, bowls, chop sticks and spoons for her food stall. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy new furniture, bowls, chop sticks and spoons for her food stall.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a widowed woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Imelda is 46 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Imelda has a abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Imelda requested a PHP 23000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more raw materials for her business.

Imelda has been in this business for 8 years. In the future Imelda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her business

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel is 31 years old and single. Due to lack of job opportunities, she put-up a small eatery within her community to generate income. She aims to strengthen her business and make it profitable in order to help her parents in gaining income and support the education of her younger brother and sister. She plans to prepare a greater variety of recipes to sell, but she doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, she wants to avail a loan of PHP 25,000.00 to buy rice, meat, vegetables, fish, seasoning, soft drinks and more grocery items to be cooked and sold in her eatery. She is hoping that someday, she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, vegetables, fish, seasoning, soft drinks and more grocery items for her eatery

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace is 16 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past two years, Peace has been working hard to manage a clothing business where she sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Peace has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more new clothes for sale and will help Peace to generate greater profits and take care of her young siblings. Peace hopes that in the future she will be able to open a very big clothes shop. 

Peace is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more new clothes for sale.

loans.name: Ma. Marilyn

texts.en:
Ma. Marilyn is 55 years old, windowed with one child still in school.

Ma. Marilyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening, in the Philippines. Ma. Marilyn requested a PHP 24000 loan through NWTF to purchase piglets, feed and vitamins for her business.

Ma. Marilyn has been in pig fattening for 20 years and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.
