In the future Ma. Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Sen is 38 years old and is married with two daughters. Her husband is a tailor. They lives in Ho Chi minh City.

Sen has operated a beauty salon for six years. Now she is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying materials to repair and improve her beauty salon to better meet her customers' needs. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair and improve her beauty salon

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai, 41, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income as a driver for hire. She earns an income running a general store in front of her house. 

She started this business five years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products to sell at her general store.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
"John Robert is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Soroti region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 6 years John Robert has been working hard to manage his retail shop. 
 
To help expand his business, John Robert has requested a loan of 3,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy  sugar, soap, bread, eggs, juice, blue band and cakes, and will help John Robert to generate greater profits and boost his working capital. John Robert hopes that in the future he will be able to become a big supplier in the area. 




"

loans.use: buy sugar, soap, bread, eggs, juice, blue band and cakes to resell

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang, 42, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including two children and her husband. Her husband is a driver for hire. Hang earns money through her business making clothes and embroidering traditional dresses. She started this business for seven years ago. 

Hang would  like to get a loan to buy an over-sewing machine and embroidery materials to meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To buy an over-sewing machine and embroidery materials.

loans.name: Nguyet

texts.en:
Nguyet, 52, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a turner. She earns an income running a general store in front of her house. 

She started this business six years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, such as food and beverages, to sell from her store.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products such as food and beverages to sell from her store

loans.name: Yeredeme Group

texts.fr:
Les 4 membres du groupe YEREDEME sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 49 ans et ont en moyenne 7 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des familles traditionnelles à DOGONI une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils  collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur cinquième prêt de production de maïs avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de maïs  avec monsieur SEYDOU débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme  YEREDEME. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter  8 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 10 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  160 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part de contribuer  les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: The four members of Yeredeme Group are married men with an average age of 49 and seven children.  They mostly live in traditional families in Dogoni, a commune in the area of Sikasso, the third largest administrative region in Mali.  They work with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso to better carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season.  They are on their fifth loan for the production of corn.  The previous loans were all fully repaid.  Mr. Seydou, who is standing at the far right of the photo, grows corn.  With his loan, he plans to buy eight 50-kg bags fertilizer, 10 containers of different quality herbicide, and to pay the labor costs of maintaining one hectare of land.  After the harvest, the output is sold at the village level in Sikasso to a clientele of men and women for cash and credit.  Mr. Seydou expects to earn an average profit of 160,000 FCFA per season.  This profit will allow him to repay his loan and interest as well as contribute to his family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu, 36, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with two daughters and her husband, who is a driver for hire.

She earns an income running a general store in front of her house.  She started this business six years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better meet her customers needs.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food and beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Salvacion works hard to support her family.

She has a blacksmith business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear.  Salvacion is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials such as iron, charcoal etc. for her blacksmith business.

Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials such as iron, charcoal etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his work vehicle.

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es: Doña Olga, tiene 65 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos y reside en el municipio de Yoro con el esposo y una hija. Ella tiene 14 años de tener su propio negocio para ayudar al sustento de la familia, en su cas vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como ser azúcar, arroz, manteca, frijoles, maíz, huevos, café, golosinas, refrescos, productos de aseo, cereales, pastas y otros abarrotes. El préstamo que solicita es el tercer ciclo y es por 25,000 lempiras con el cual va surtir de productos de abarrotería como frijoles, azúcar, manteca, café, churros, refrescos y otros que le ayudara a aumentar el inventario y las ventas. Su plan es mantener el negocio para darle un mejor futuro a toda su familia.
texts.en: Olga, 65, is married with four children.  She lives in Yoro with her husband and one daughter.  For fourteen years, she has had her own business to help support the family.  In her home, she sells basic consumer products such as sugar, rice, butter, beans, corn, eggs, coffee, candy, soft drinks, toiletries, cereal, pasta, and other groceries.  She is in her third loan cycle and she is requesting 25,000 lempiras, which she will use to stock grocery products such as beans, sugar, butter, “churros” [long fritters made with flour and water], soft drinks, and other items that will help her to increase inventory and sales.  Her plan is to maintain the business in order to provide her family with a better future.

loans.use: to stock grocery products such as beans, sugar, butter, “churros” [long fritters made with flour and water], soft drinks, and other items for sale.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les huit membres du groupe DANAYA  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles  à  AMIDEF-HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers populaires dans la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles sont à leur dix-huitième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame AMI assise à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes  DANAYA , fait la vente  des   savon noire.
Elle compte acheter des matières première au grand marché de SIKASSO plus des bois de chauffe achetés à dans les villages environnants de SIKASSO.
Après cette incorporation des matières premières pour donner un produit fini (savon noire) qui sera livré à la clientèle d’où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits pour la revendre en détail  au marché à une clientèle composée d’ homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 31 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en: The eight members of Danaya Group are married women with an average age of 43. They have an average of four children.  They mostly live in traditional families in Amidef-Hamdallaye, one of the working-class neighborhoods in the city of Sikasso, the third largest administrative region in Mali. To better satisfy their customers' needs, they are on their 18th loan with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso. Ms. Ami, who is sitting second from right to left in the photo, sells black soap.  She plans to buy raw materials in the main market of Sikasso and firewood in villages near Sikasso.  After the raw materials are used to make the finished product (black soap), it will be delivered to the market where she sells to a clientele of men and women for cash and credit. She is very sought-after for the quality of her products. She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 31,000 FCFA, part of which will be used to repay her loan and interest, while the remainder is added to her savings.

loans.use: to buy the raw materials for making soap.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is 43 years old, married and lives in Solana. She and her husband manage a farming business, planting and harvesting rice to sell. She generates a minimal income from the farming business but does manage to sustain her family's needs. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy fertilizer, insecticide and pesticide to use in farming. These farm inputs will help maintain good crop nutrition to produce a fruitful harvest someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide and pesticide to use in farming.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 53 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Soroti region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, one currently in school. For the past 18 years, John  has been working hard to manage his health clinic. 

To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy syringes, medicine, beds, and bedding, and will help John  to generate greater profits and improve his service. John  hopes that in the future, he will be able to increase his working capital.

loans.use: to buy syringes, medicine, beds, and bedding.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe DANAYA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles  à HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers populaires dans la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles sont à leur septième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame AMINATA debout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes DANAYA, fait la vente  de bazin.
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  8 pièces de bazin au grand marché d’où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits pour la revendre en détail au marché à une clientèle composée d’ homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 36 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en: The four members of Danaya Group are married women with an average age of 41. They have an average of three children. They mostly live in traditional families in Hamdallaye, one of the working-class neighborhoods in the city of Sikasso, the third largest administrative region in Mali. To better satisfy their customers' needs, they are on their seventh loan with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso. Ms. Aminata, who is standing second from right to left in the photo, sells damask cloth. With her loan, she plans to buy eight pieces of damask cloth in the main market where she is very sought-after for the quality of her products.  She resells at the market to a clientele of men and women for cash and credit. She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 36,000 FCFA, part of which will be used to repay her loan and interest, while the remainder is added to her savings.

loans.use: to buy damask cloth.

loans.name: Ederlina

texts.en: Ederlina is 55 years old, married and does farming with her spouse. They live in Solana. On one hectare of farmland, they plant and harvest rice to sell to traders. She usually earns about PHP 20,000 each harvest season twice a year. She uses her earnings as revolving capital in the farming business and to pay bills at home. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy fertilizer and pesticide used in farming to keep away pests and insects that harm her crops. The farm inputs will help maintain good crop production and will gain a fruitful harvest someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide used in farming.

loans.name: Yairo

texts.en:
Yairo is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Soroti region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, four currently in school. For the past six years, Yairo has been working hard to manage his spare parts business, which sells tubes, rings, oil and other items. 

To help expand his business, Yairo has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy tubes, rings, oil and other spare items and will help Yairo generate greater profits and boost his working capital. Yairo hopes that in the future, he will be able to expand his shop.

loans.use: to buy tubes, rings, oil and other spare items

loans.name: Darlin Maricela

texts.es:
Darlin es una mujer de 18 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos y su negocio es una tienda de barrio que atiende todos los días de Lunes a Domingo.
Ella es emprendedora, soñadora luchadora, perseverante y muy trabajadora, su negocios es la venta de artículos de primera necesidad para el hogar y también la venta de utensilios de cocina, como ser; ollas, cubiertos, cuchillos entre otros.
Darlin es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, estatura media y viste a la moda. Su tienda abre a partir de las seis y media de la mañana, hora que es cuando llega el panadero, y cierra a las nueve de la noche, toda la jornada se ocupa de atender su negocio y casi nunca cierra. Poco a poco su negocio está incursionando en la venta de nuevos productos, porque sus clientes le hacen pedidos de artículos y utensilios para el hogar. Su deseo de superación la ha llevado a invertir en la venta de nuevos productos y de esa manera ofrecer a sus clientes mayor cantidad de productos y de esa manera mejorar sus ventas. Ella desea poder independizarse y ahorrar para pagar un anticrético (forma de alquiler).
Es por esos motivos que Darlin solicita un préstamo para la compra de artículos de cocina por mayor y con los beneficios ahorrar para pagar un anticrético (forma de alquiler).
texts.en:
Darlin is an 18-year-old woman, single, without children, and her business is a neighborhood store that she opens every day Monday through Sunday.

She is an enterprising, determined dreamer, persistent and very hard-working. Her business is the sale of basic necessities for the home and also the sale of kitchen utensils such as pans, silverware, and knives among others.

Darlin has tan skin, long black hair, is of average height and dresses fashionably.  Her store opens at six-thirty in the morning, the time when the bread seller arrives, and closes at nine at night. She works all day long taking care of her store and almost never closes it. Little by little, her business is making inroads into the sale of new products, because her customers are asking for items and utensils for the home. Her desire to improve herself has brought her to invest in the sale of new products and in this way offer her customers better quality products, and in this way improve her sales.  She wants to be able to become independent and save to pay an anticrético (a type of rent which functions as a loan to the landlord in exchange for housing). 

For these reasons, Darlin asks for a loan to purchase kitchen items in bulk and with the profits save to pay an anticrético (a type of rent).

loans.use: to purchase kitchen items in bulk, and with the profits, save to pay an anticrético (a kind of rent)

loans.name: Juán José

texts.es: Juán José, tiene la edad  de 43 años, está casado, vive con sus hijos y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de labores culturales como lo son curvas a nivel para tratar de evitar la erosión del suelo por la lluvia y principalmente en la partes de más pendientes y darle una mejor asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo de una mejor variedad para hacer resiembras,  esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Juán José is 43 years of age. He is married and lives with his children and his wife, who are his top priority. 

With his loan, he is planning to purchase fertilizers and fungicides. He will also pay for manual labor for cultivation tasks like terracing to try to prevent soil erosion from rain, especially in the steepest parts, and providing better care for the coffee crop. In addition, he will buy some seedlings of a better variety to do replantings. His objective is to increase the density of plants  in each area as well as to take advantage of the good fertility of the soil, the climate, and other condition that are well-suited for coffee cultivation. 

With these improvements to his crop, he  hopes to obtain some earnings with which to improve his family's living conditions, invest a bit more in his crops, and also to fulfill some goals. 

This is the first loan that Juán José has received from FUDECOSUR. He had never taken out a loan before with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him with a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and fungicides, and to pay for manual labor for cultivation tasks

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Mary, 54 years of age. She is a very dedicated and hard-working woman who is a mother of four lovely children. She resides in the Kitale area of Kenya, a region always referred to as the 'bread basket region' of Kenya because half the food that Kenya consumes comes from that region. She has four lovely and adorable school-going children that she really values and treasures and she always refers to them as 'her heartbeat.'

Mary has been practicing farming for the past 15 years and, through hard work and determination, she has been able to support her family and always provide a plate of food for them. Her main sources of income are milk, crops, and some small, personal business that she does to make ends meet.

Because of the harsh living conditions and the lack of employment, Mary plans to increase her farming output, so that she can improve her income and, hence, her living conditions. That is why she is seeking a loan of KES 30,000 (Kenya shillings) to buy farm inputs. Through buying farming inputs, such as good quality seeds and good fertilizer and pesticide, she will be able to increase her crop production output and, hence, improve her income.

Mary is very visionary and enterprising and she hopes that, through improved income, she will be able to save more money and she plans to buy more land and increase her farming in the future.

Through the loan, her business will continue to flourish and she will assure her school-going children of uninterrupted learning because she will pay tuition fees on-time and also improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie, 41 years old, is married and has eight children, three currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Margie has had a fish vending business in the Philippines for the past 4 years. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers. In the future, Margie would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 26 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past 3 years, Betty has been working hard to manage her grocery shop. 

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more grocery items, and will help Betty to generate greater profits and increase her daily sales. Betty hopes that, in the future, she will be able to own a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is a single woman, born in 1982, and has a secondary level of education. Marie started working in a clothing shop to help her family.
Marie is now requesting a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to support her brother's wedding expenses. 
As Marie is trying hard to help her family and cover their expenses and needs with modest finances, this loan will help her brother’s marriage.
She is hoping that in the future, she will open her own clothes-selling shop.

loans.use: To support her brother in his wedding expenses.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 50 years old and lives in the town of Najjera in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, one currently in school. For the past six years, Alice has been working hard to manage her bar, which sells both alcoholic and soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Alice has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more alcoholic and soft drinks, and will help Alice generate greater profits and expand the business. Alice hopes that in the future, she will be able to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more alcoholic and soft drinks

loans.name: Jackeline Marisol

texts.es: Jackeline de 42 años de edad  es madre soltera y vive con su hijo de 25 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos de manera domiciliar, su hijo trabaja como panificador y aporta a la economía familiar. Jackeline se encuentra actualmente construyendo su vivienda pero no ha logrado comprar los materiales para el techo por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar: lámina, madera y cemento para terminar de construir lo antes posible.
texts.en: Jackeline is 42 years old, a single mother, and lives with her 25-year-old child. She is a hard-working woman who earns her living offering her domestic services in the home. Her son works as a baker and supports the household economy. Jackeline is currently building her home but she has not been able to purchase the materials for the roof, for which she asks FUSAI for a loan to purchase metal sheeting, wood, and cement to finish its construction as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase metal sheeting, wood, and cement to finish the construction of the roof on her home.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Gerardo, tiene la edad  de 56 años, está casado, vive con su esposa  la cual es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo de una variedad que se adapte mejor a las condiciones del suelo y clima de la zona y así realizar una resiembras, esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área y con esto mejorar la producción, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Gerardo is 56 years old, married, and lives with his wife, who is his highest priority. With this loan he intends to purchase fertilizers, fungicides, to hire laborers to help with his coffee farming, and to buy a variety of seedling plants that are suited to the soil and climate conditions of the area. With these investments he aims to increase the density of plants per area, thereby improving production, while taking advantage of good soil fertility, climate conditions, and other favorable conditions for coffee cultivation. With these improvements to the crop, he expects to increase his income, and improve his family’s living conditions. This is the his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He has not previously had the opportunity for loans in state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given opportunities for loans with better facilities and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to hire laborers to help with his coffee farming.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John deals in buying and selling maize alongside a school in Hoima, Uganda. He is a hard-working married man responsible for two children ages 2 and 4. The older child attends school. He started business in 2004 to generate income that enables him to take care of his family's needs. He desires to grow the produce business despite price fluctuations.
Paskali will use the loan to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima works hard to support her family. Prima is married and has a abaca weaving business in the Philippines.

Prima requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her weaving business.

Prima has been in this business for 10 years now.

Prima would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Grupo Sector Candelaria Group

texts.es:
Es bueno saber que mujeres emprendedoras en la vida sostienen una decisión de poder superarse y que no importa el trabajo que realiza siempre lo realizan con mucho esmero y dedicación tal es el caso de doña Dorotea de 45 años de edad que cuenta con 6 hijos dos de ellos ya tienen familias y uno trabaja para ayudar a su mama y los últimos tres son estudiantes de la comunidad donde ella vive.( El líder del grupo es el de blusa rosada que se encuentra en medio del grupo.)

La actividad que ella realiza es la venta de comida en su comunidad por los que se dedica a servir a la gente que llegan con ella para disfrutar de la delicias que doña Dorotea realiza con mucho esmero y esfuerzo esta actividad que ella realiza lo aprendió de su madre ya que ella también se dedica a la misma actividad y genera un buen ingreso económica y ganancias impresionantes por lo que vale la pena realizarlo.

El uso que le dará al crédito que ella quiere realizar es para la compra de una refrigeradora para su comedor y otros artículos que ella necesita para bridar un buen servicio a las personas que lleguen a visitarla.

Ella y un grupo de mujeres se decidieron a unir esfuerzo para tener una menor vida y desarrollo en su comunidad.

Unos de los más grandes sueños de doña Dorotea es en la compra de un local en su comunidad para instalarse mejor y que tenga más clientela y que le dejen buena ganancia y así tener una buena caza y que sus hijos tengan una mejor vida y que sean profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
It is good to know that there are entrepreneurial women who take the decision of improving themselves and that always work with great care and dedication, no matter what the job is. That is the case of 45-year-old Dorotea, who has 6 children. Two of her children already have families of their own, another one works to help his mother, and the remaining three are students in the community where they live. (She is the leader of the group, with the pink shirt in the center of the photo). 

Her occupation is the sale of food in her community. Dorotea serves people that go to her to enjoy the delicious food that she prepares with great care and effort. She learned this occupation from her mother, who works doing the same and earns a good income and impressive profits, which makes this job worth it.

She will use the loan to buy a refrigerator for her dining room and other items that she needs to provide a good service to the people who visit her.

Her and a group of women decided to unite their efforts to have a better life and to help with the development of their community. 

One of Dorotea's biggest dreams is to buy an establishment in her community to have better business conditions and a larger clientele. She wants better profits, which would allow her to have a better house and for her children to have a better life and become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to invest in her dining room.

loans.name: Jennipher

texts.en:
Jennipher is 49 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, none currently in school. For the past two years, Jennipher has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Jennipher has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes, and will help Jennipher generate greater profits and have a variety of choices. Jennipher hopes that in the future, she will be able to operate a bigger shop.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes

loans.name: Zam

texts.en:
Zam is 42 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who do not attend school. For the past five years, Zam has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells curtains, jewelry and clothing. 

To help expand her business, Zam has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more curtains and clothing, and will help Zam generate greater profits and increase her weekly capital. Zam hopes that in the future, she will be able to open another shop.

loans.use: to buy more curtains and clothing.

loans.name: Dina Sarai

texts.es: Dina de 34 años de edad vive con su esposo y su hijo de 8 años de edad que se encuentra estudiando. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace 10 años cuenta con un local de venta de ropa en el cual tiene diversidad de prendas de vestir tales como: blusas, faldas, camisas, pantalones, etc. Además vende cosméticos y sandalias en el mismo local. Dina desea reparar el techo de un cuarto de su vivienda el cual se encuentra deteriorado. Para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI  para comprar lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para hacer la reparación necesaria en su vivienda.
texts.en: Dina, 34 years old, lives with her husband and her 8-year-old son who is a student. She is an enterprising woman who, for the past 10 years, has had a clothing store which has a variety of clothing articles such as blouses, skirts, shirts, pants, etc. In addition, she sells cosmetics and sandals in the same store. Dina wants to repair the roof of a room in her home which is deteriorating.  For this, she asks FUSAI for a loan to purchase galvanized metal sheeting, purlins and pins to make the necessary repairs to her home.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized metal sheeting, purlins and pins to make repairs on the roof of a room in her home.

loans.name: Erica Leticia

texts.es:
Érica es una mujer de 37 años de edad, casada, madre de dos hijos y su negocio es el servicio de cafetería.
Ella es una persona humilde, luchadora, de buen humor, puntual, ordenada y muy trabajadora, su negocio lo realiza en un pequeño salón ubicado en la zona de bajo Pampahasi.
Erica es de tez morena, cabello negro largo amarrado, utiliza lentes de aumento y es de estatura mediana, su idioma es el español pero habla aymara con sus abuelos. Su trabajo lo realiza de lunes a domingo; cada mañana Érica se despierta temprano a comenzar su labor de servicio de café, la primera tarea del día es servir el café matutino a sus clientes diarios que trabajan en sus negocios y al igual que ella trabajan desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana como son; el vendedor de diario de la esquina, la panadera del frente, la librería de la otra cuadra, los cerrajeros de la vuelta.., a los cuales ella les lleva hasta su negocio una taza de café caliente y un pan preferiblemente marraqueta (pan de batalla) con un trozo de queso, luego retorna a su cafetería y abre las puertas para dar paso a sus clientes casuales y acostumbrados. Esta labor la realiza hasta medio día, se apresura en lavar todas sus tazas y platos y se apresura a su domicilio, pues tiene que preparar el almuerzo a sus hijos, que también la ayudan con el café, para retornar a las cuatro de la tarde y ocuparse de la misma labor hasta las ocho de la noche. Ella desea mejorar su negocio realizando una refacción para atraer más clientes y generar mejores ingresos económicos, para el bien de su familia.
Es por esos motivos que Érica solicita un préstamo para la refacción de su cafetería y con los beneficios pagar los gastos escolares de sus hijos.
texts.en: Erica, 37, is a married mother of two children.  Her business is cafeteria service.  She is humble, feisty, good-humored, punctual, organized, and very hard-working.  She conducts her business in a small dining room located in the zone under Pampahasi.  Erica is medium height, has dark complexion, long black hair that she wears tied back, and wears glasses.  Her primary language is Spanish but she speaks Aymara with her grandparents.  She works from Monday to Sunday.  Every morning, she wakes up early to begin work at the café.  Her first task of the day is to serve morning coffee to her daily customers that work in their businesses from the very early hours of the morning as she does: the daily seller on the corner, the bakery in the front, the bookstore on the other block, the locksmiths around . . .  She goes to their businesses and takes them a cup of hot coffee, and preferably a “marraqueta” (kneaded bread) [a South American bread made with flour, salt, water and leavening] with a piece of cheese.  Then, she returns to her café and opens her doors to let in her casual and usual customers.  She works until midday, hurries to wash all the cups and plates, and then hurries home, where she has to prepare lunch for her children, who also help her with the café.  She goes back to the café at four in the afternoon and performs the same job until eight in the evening.  She wishes to improve her business and refurbish it to attract more customers, for her family’s good.  For these reasons, Erica is requesting a loan to refurbish her café and, with the benefits, pay for her children’s education costs.

loans.use: to refurbish her café and, with the benefits, pay for her children’s education costs.

loans.name: Paskali

texts.en:
Paskali sells sugar, salt, soap, and other items in Hoima Uganda. He is a hardworking married man charged with the responsibility of taking care of five children aged between 33 and 13, two of whom attend school. 

He started his business so as to generate income to enable him to take care of his family's needs. He desires to grow his business in spite of limited capital.

Paskali will use the loan to buy more sugar, soap, rice, and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, soap, rice, and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 35 años de edad, casada, madre de dos hijos y se dedica al horneado y venta de pan.
Ella es luchadora, fuerte responsable, capaz, soñadora, emprendedora y muy trabajadora, su negocio lo realiza en el barrio Guapurú de la zona ‘plan 3000’ un lugar caracterizado por el crecimiento poblacional y emprendimientos de productores de todas las áreas.
María es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, ojos marrones y viste a la moda, su labor la realiza con un pequeño horno industrial en una pequeña habitación dispuesta como panadería en su domicilio, todos los días se dedica al horneado de pan para luego salir con su canastas llenas y venderlo en la calle. Las necesidades de su negocio es la harina como materia prima. Ella desea realizar la compra por mayor para abaratar costos y tener material disponible para trabajar. Su sueño es tener una panadería con tienda donde guardar y exponer el pan.
Es por esos motivos que María solicita un préstamo para la compra de harina por mayor y con los beneficios pagar los estudios escolares de sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is 35 years old, married, mother of two children and works baking and selling bread.

She is a tenacious woman, strong, responsible, capable, entrepreneurial, with dreams and very hard working. Her business is located in the neighborhood of Guapuru in the "Plan 3000" area, a place that is characterized by population growth and business ventures in all sectors. 

Maria has olive skin, dark black hair, brown eyes and is fashionable. She works with a small industrial oven in a small room used as a bakery in her home. She bakes every day and then goes to the street with baskets full of bread for sale. The main raw material she needs for her business is flour. She wishes to buy it in bulk to lower her costs and to have more material available to work. Her dream is to have a bakery with a store where to keep and exhibit the bread.

For these reasons, Maria is requesting a loan to buy flour in bulk and with the profits pay for her two children's school.

loans.use: to buy flour in bulk and with the profits pay for he children's school.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kasangati in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has no children. For the past 10 years, Peter has been working hard to manage his bar business, which sells beer, spirits, soda, and water. 

To help expand his business, Peter has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy beer, spirits, soda, and water, and will help Peter to generate greater profits and expand the business. Peter hopes that in the future he will be able to increase his daily income.

loans.use: to buy beer, spirits, soda, and water

loans.name: Maria Milagro

texts.es: María de 35 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus 5 hijos de 18, 15, 14, 11 y 3 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica desde hace 15 años a la venta de verduras tales como: pipían, ayote, ejote, güisquil y elote, esta actividad la realiza de forma ambulante en el mercado central. Su esposo le aporta a la economía familiar por medio de su trabajo de albañil. María desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda ya que como se observa en la fotografía este se encuentra deteriorado. Es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para reparar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: María, 35 years old, lives with her husband and their 5 children, 18, 15, 14, 11, and 3 years old. She is an enterprising woman who, for the past 15 years, has worked selling vegetables such as squashes (pipían, ayote), green beans, chayote, and corn. She does this as a vendor in the central market. Her husband supports the family economy by means of his work as a bricklayer. María wants to replace the roof of her home since, as can be seen in the photo, it is deteriorating. For this reason, she asks FUSAI for a loan to purchase galvanized metal sheeting, wood, and nails to repair the roof of her home.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized metal sheeting, wood and nails to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Santos Veronica

texts.es: Santos de 26 años de edad es madre soltera y vive con su hijo de 9 años de edad al cual con gran esfuerzo le esta apoyando para que estudie. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida desde hace 9 años con su venta de productos de primera necesidad es su vivienda, además 3 días por semana prepara pupusas para vender en su domicilio, esta laboriosa mujer es también la encargada de un chalet escolar. Santos desea reparar su cocina por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar los materiales (cemento, arena, ladrillo, grava, etc.) y pagar mano de obra necesaria para la reparación de su cocina.
texts.en: Santos, 26 years old, is a single mother and lives with her 9-year-old child who, with her great efforts to support him, is going to school.  She is an enterprising woman who has earned her living for the last 9 years by the sale of basic necessities from her home. In addition, 3 days per week she prepares pupusas in her home for sale. This hard-working woman is also in charge of a school food stand.  Santos wants to repair her kitchen, for which she has asked FUSAI for a loan to purchase materials (cement, sand, bricks, gravel, etc.) and pay labor costs necessary for the repair of her kitchen.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, bricks, gravel, etc. and to pay the labor costs necessary to repair the kitchen.

loans.name: Maria Agustina

texts.es: María de 47 años de edad vive con su grupo familiar. Ella es una mujer tenaz que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos, además su esposo emigro al extranjero para tratar de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. María desea cambiar el techo de la cocina de su vivienda, ya que actualmente este se encuentra deteriorado, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada y polines para reparar el techo de la cocina de su vivienda.
texts.en: María, 47 years old, lives with her family. She is a tenacious woman who earns her living supplying domestic services. In addition, her husband emigrated to another country to try to improve the family's quality of life. María wants to replace the roof of the kitchen in her home, which is currently deteriorated, and, for this, she asks FUSAI for a loan to purchase galvanized metal sheeting and purlins to repair the roof of the kitchen in her home.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized metal sheeting and purlins to repair the roof of the kitchen in her home.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo de 33 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y su hija de 1 año y 10 meses. Él es un hombre  tenaz que desde hace 13 años se dedica a trabajar como albañil, lo que le permite dar un buen soporte económico a su familia. Wilfredo desea construir un servicio sanitario en su vivienda, que como se observa en la fotografía está en proceso de construcción. Por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: plancha de cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, lámina y madera, además deberá pagar mano de obra necesaria para la construcción de un servicio sanitario en su vivienda.
texts.en: Wilfredo is 33 years old and lives with his partner and their daughter who is 1 year and 10 months old. He is a tenacious man who has been working as a bricklayer for 13 years, allowing him to give his family good financial support. Wilfredo wants to build a bathroom in his home; as shown in the photograph, this is under construction. For this, he is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy cement slabs, sand, gravel, brick, corrugated sheets and wood and also to pay for the labour required to build a bathroom in his home.

loans.use: to buy cement slabs, sand, gravel, brick, corrugated sheets and wood and also to pay for the labour required to build a bathroom in his home.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Elizabeth. Her previous loan was a big help for her business, as she was able to purchase products for her direct-selling business. The loan is also useful in the education of her children. She used a portion of the loan to purchase school supplies and to maintain her photocopier. Her income from the loan assisted with their everyday expenses at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan. It will be used to buy additional supplies and merchandise, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elizabeth dreams to have her own merchandising store. She also hopes to start up other forms of business someday. She meets with her co-fellowship members* each week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics

loans.name: Ruben Alonso

texts.es: Rubén de 43 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos de 14, 15, 9 y 7 años de edad, además su madre y hermana forman parte del grupo familiar. Él es un hombre emprendedor que desde hace más de 20 años se gana la vida como jornalero, pero además 2 días a la semana se dedica a la pesca logrando un ingreso extra, su esposa presta sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar lo que le permite aportar a la economía familiar. Rubén desea mejorar la cocina de su vivienda por lo que ha pensado construir un cuarto para esta, ya que como se observa en la fotografía, no cuenta con uno y el lugar donde se encuentra está completamente deteriorado. Por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: bloques de cemento, arena, grava, cemento, lámina y madera para construir un cuarto para su cocina.
texts.en:
Rubén is 43 years old and lives with his wife and their four children, ages 14, 15, 9 and 7. In addition, his mother and sister form part of the family.  

He is an enterprising man who has earned his living as a day laborer for more than 20 years. But in addition, he fishes two days a week, earning an extra income. His wife works as a housekeeper which allows her to contribute to the household income. 

Ruben wishes to improve the kitchen of his house, so he has thought of building a room for this purpose, since as is seen in the photo, he does not have one, and the place where it is located is completely run down. For this reason he is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to buy cement blocks, sand, gravel, cement, sheet metal and wood for building a room for his kitchen.

loans.use: To buy cement blocks, sand, gravel, cement, sheet metal and wood, in order to construct a room for his kitchen.

loans.name: Ahmmed

texts.en:
Ahmmed is a 26-year-old, single man, living with his family in the capital city of Sana'a. Ahmmed has a university education. He knows how he can run his life very well. He always hopes for the best. 

In order to achieve his dreams, Ahmmed decided to start his own business by opening a grocery store to sell goods, so he can look after his family. As the source of income for his family, Ahmmed has sold groceries and food products for more than five years. He started this business with a small amount of capital. Thanks to hard work, he has been able to develop and expand his merchandise. 

He earns good profits from his business and, for the purpose of further developing his business, Ahmmed requested a loan of YER 200,000 to buy more goods and items for the grocery store in order to meet all the demands of his customers.

Ahmmed plans to invest the earnings from the loan to further increase his business. He also intends to expand his business by opening other branches, besides the first one.

loans.use: to buy more goods and items for the grocery store in order to meet all the demands of his customers.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 49 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, with none of them currently in school. For the past 8 years, Rehema has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells toilet paper, sugar, pens and other essential items. To help expand her business, Rehema has requested for a loan of 4,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. This loan will be used to purchase more toilet paper, sugar, pens and other essential items, which will help Rehema to generate greater profits and increase her working capital. Rehema hopes that in the future, she will be able to own a supermarket. 




"

loans.use: to purchase more toilet paper, sugar, pens and other essential items

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal is 39 years old and lives in the town of Kisaasi in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, whom are all currently in school. For the past 8 years, Racheal has been working hard to manage her poultry farm, where she rears broiler chickens. To help expand her business, Racheal has requested for a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. This loan will be used to buy more broiler chickens, which will help Racheal to generate greater profits and improve on the economic status of her family. Racheal hopes that in the future, she will be able to have another business. 




"

loans.use: to buy more broiler chickens

loans.name: Isaa

texts.en:
Isaa is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has no children. For the past 5 years, Isaa has been working hard to manage his charcoal business, where he resells charcoal. To help expand his business, Isaa has requested for a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. This loan will be used to purchase more charcoal, and will help Isaa to generate greater profits from his business. Isaa hopes that in the future he will be able to employ more people to help him with his business. 




"

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: To generate income, Susana buys and resells fruits and vegetables in her community. She is 39 years old and blessed with three children who attend school. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she needs to increase her income to support the education of her children. To further improve her business, she is asking for additional capital of 10,000 PHP to buy various fruits and vegetables to resell. Being a diligent mother, she believes that she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy various fruits and vegetables to resell

location.town: Brgy. Ineangan, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase additional quantities and varieties of grocery items as well as products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures. She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. Emma hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams for her children to finish their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kasangati in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, who are all currently in school. For the past 5 years, Prossy has been working hard to manage her electronics shop, where she sells electronic items. To help expand her business, Prossy has requested for a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. This loan will be used to buy more electronics items, which will help Prossy to generate greater profits and increase on her daily income. Prossy hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her business. 




"

loans.use: to buy more electronics items
